Reviews.Title: “Good family hotel”
Reviews.Author: April1972
Reviews.Content: We spent Easter there and with 7 people from 2 to 75 we could not have been better looked after. We stayed on one of theClub floors which will give you an amazing view, a complimentary all day buffet, snack, wine. And free wifi in the lounge which is great as they charge 50euros a day normally. Breakfast is amazing and very child friendly. They arranged egg hunts etc and made the children feel very welcome. It is very large and slightly corporate but it is well run, lots of nice little detials like flowers etc, the little club on the 1st floor is nice they have a dj on the weekends and it is nice and laid back. We ate at Enoteca and was dissapointed but perhaps it was just us on that perticular night. I also had a great massage in the Six Senses Spa which was great. All in all a very pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “close to perfection”
Reviews.Author: gordonbye
Reviews.Content: Nothing is perfect but the Arts Hotel tries its best to disprove that idea. From the warm welcome by the bell boys to the check in staff, the restaurant waiters, bar staff, pool staff, room cleaners, nobody could be faulted with their attitude or appearance. All staff appear to be multi lingual and proud of their hotel as well as being very good at anticipating your needs. The rooms are excellent, roomy with superb views, whichever side of the hotel you are allocated, provided with high quality bedding and towels. It is not cheap but it is certainly worth spending these prices for this level of service and comfort. My only small issues would be no free wifi in the rooms which should be an essential these days in a hotel of this class ( you can get 1hour free wifi in the lobby each 24 hours but the lobby is generally busy and not convivial for working on a lap top). All rooms have b and o CD players, which were great 10 years ago, but are old hat now and should be replaced by ipod docks. Lastly there should be English newspapers available, ( Financial times is provided) but all other papers are Spanish whereas the clients seemed to be at least 50 % English speaking when we were there. Overall the best hotel I have stayed anywhere. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gandalf610
Reviews.Content: They treat you like royalty at this Hotel. Great location, friendly staff, right on the Beach, this is a top notch Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: PSU82
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 days. Very nice hotel. We were there on Marriott points and were upgraded to a suite which was spacious and lovely. Also included free wifi which was a nice perk. The main bathroom had the best shower we have ever experienced. Room views were fantastic! Ask for a high floor; it seems the most popular clubs are on the beach right next to the hotel. The partiers are out in full force until 4 - 5 am. We were on the 20th floor and I could still hear their revelry every night when the clubs let out. The service is excellent; at times comical the way they fall all over you to do things like push the elevator button for you! The young men at the entrance are very friendly, pleasant, and helpful when calling a cab and welcoming you when you return. If you don't eat breakfast at the hotel, the next block over has a wonderful place for breakfast/or a late snack. Very reasonable, delicious coffee, and great food. We did not use the pool but it we checked it out and it was very nice. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great breakfast, exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: callehiedra
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Arts in Barcelona in February. We were a family of four. It is pricier than we would normally prefer but the deal we got included breakfast each day and the location really can't be beat. The rooms are clean and they brought in an extra bed which meant that my kids each had their own. The bathroom was large and there are lots of fun bathroom amenities. The breakfast was the best I have ever had anywhere. The friendliness of the staff was amazing. Your glass was never empty and one of the chefs would walk around asking you if wanted anything fresh made. The presentation of the food was fabulous and on the fresh made churros and chocolate plate that they would bring to your table, there was often a written message in chocolate, like welcome, or hasta luego. I cannot say enough about the staff who always smiled, always helped out, and always went that extra bit to make sure you didn't need anything. The only negative I can say about the hotel is their charge for the internet which I believe should at least be free in the lobby. It's a hefty charge and for the amount you are paying already, seems a bit excessive. I would avoid the restaurants along the harbor for meals. The concierge will recommend you eat here. There are much better and cheaper ones in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Just Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: b0nnieb00p
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Arts, Barcelona (owned by Ritz Carleton), is lovely. The rooms are huge and tranquil (zen), and the service is amazing. Breakfast was included in our room rate and it was by far, the most varied and delicious breakfast buffet I've ever experienced in a hotel. Stay here and you won't regret it. I'd return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location”
Reviews.Author: Trawor
Reviews.Content: We, me and my boyfriend, stayed at the hotel at the end of March in a superior suite. The view was great and the room clean and spacious. The staff was friendly. Only con is the wifi in the room for which you have to pay (EUR 25/24 hours) and the expensive breakfast which was not included in the room price (EUR 30). I had a massage (EUR145 for 1 hour) which was good, but a bit expensive. The spa is located on the 57th floor, so great views on the harbour and beach. The spa is clean and quiet and again very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay At Hotel Arts”
Reviews.Author: A L
Reviews.Content: Hotel Arts Barcelona is a very good hotel! The service that we wanted was there, and we like the style and the decorations. We liked the rooms and the view and everything was great! The location of the hotel was very convenient to reach everywhere in Barcelona. There is only one thing that we would like to improve: the variety of the breakfast choices in the club lounge should have warm foods such as eggs, omelets, or pancakes etc. Other than that, we enjoyed our stay in Hotel Arts and overall, Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great view.”
Reviews.Author: Lakeanahuac
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great weekend at Hotel Arts. The check in and concierge were great. The room had a few problems with lights and tv but they were addressed. The location was great for walks on the beach and in to town.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: carlos g
Reviews.Content: arts since star has remained the best hotel in barcelona, with the best views of the city and mediterranean a top service and a greta offer of restaurants in and around the hotel. the marina is at the side of the hotel with a big offer of restaurants pubs and tapas bar

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: GourmetTraveller0
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Hotel Arts is sublime. From the way you are greeted when getting out of the taxi, the seamless transfer of bags to your room, check in, check out and everything in between! Corner seaview rooms are spacious and the views are magnificent! Room 1201 has panoramic views of the beach and the marina - as I imagine do all the **01 rooms, being on the same corner of the building. Decor is elegant, bed linen truly luxurious. Bedside panels control all the lighting and operate the blinds. My bathroom had a large deep bath, wetroom and separate wc plus twin basins and an abundance of towels - excellent. Location is right on the beach and within a five minute stroll of the Marins and its abundance of bars and great eating places. Any negatives? Take care that you don't inadvertantly rack up a hefty room bill - we all expect to pay for the minibar but here everything is extra much of which is on the dresser outside the mini bar including the mineral water at 7€ for the small bottle and 9€ for the large bottle and the coffee machine (great to have nespresso machine and pods) but they are 4€ a shot and it is only when you look in the in toom information that you realise that they are not complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel, but look out for extra charges”
Reviews.Author: MikeJameson
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location in a fantastic town. The hotel is lavish, rooms are well-appointed. My room had two comfortable queen beds, 3 easy chairs, small table, a desk, floor lamp, safe, magazines in a rack, flat screen TV, Bose sound system (CD/Radio), capsule coffee maker, mini-bar (extremely expensive) walk-in shower with massage jets and rainfall, 2 sinks, bathtub. Nice view to the beach. Many restaurants nearby. Friendly staff, courteous service, and everyone speaks English. The restaurant and bar are also excellent, but pricey. Breakfast was good with real scrambled eggs. Internet is expensive (why is this not free at these rack rates?) and they will charge you for each device which connects, so watch out for that. Good connections to public transport. There is a casino next door; beware as there was a mugging in broad daylight when I was there. Taxis are always on hand. Good concierge service. If you can afford it, there's no better location in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway...fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: CHD3
Reviews.Content: This was a great location and easy to take off and walk this beautiful city of Barcelona! We stayed for six nights - the staff was outstanding and always willing to help. My wife used the spa and said it was incredible. A few items of note: I did not appreciate 25 euro for wireless access. I thought is was a bit excessive. they do offer one free hour per day in the lobby....gee, thanks. I would suggest you use restaurant suggestions from trip advisor instead of the concierge - for some reason they suggested a few mediocre restaurants that were just pricey - stick with Trip Advisor. Breakfast at the hotel is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury worth paying for!”
Reviews.Author: aligo68
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Arts hotel for 4 days. We deliberately booked based on recommendations (both on here and from friends) and were very happy. Arrival is a bit strange, as you need to get a lift to reception but check in was very smooth and courteous. We were celebrating a wedding anniversary and requested a high floor and were given a fantastic view from the 25th floor. Very quiet!! The breakfast is one of the best we have had in a hotel and the opportunity to sit outside in the sun is a lovely way to start the day. Breakfast is served until11:30 - another bonus, especially if you use the blackout blinds in the rooms!! A great spot to explore the harbour and the beach with some nice restaurants nearby. Would recommend Bestial. The Arts is a few minutes walk to the metro and the tourist bus goes from just outside so very handy to get around the rest of Barcelona quickly and efficiently.

Reviews.Title: “This was not good !”
Reviews.Author: Filip K
Reviews.Content: Sorry, This was one of my worst stays in a hotel. On average I stay more then 100 days a year in a hotel and this was not nice. 25 Euro for 24 hours of 'high speed internet' who was terrible slow. I was with my wife a couple of days before my busininess in Barcelona in a small cozy hotel were they even had free internet. All my water cranes where turned to the hottest stand every day. (and you can t see clearly what stond its on) Breakfast chares a rates that is way over what you get for it. This is a total rip off with a SMILE (from the staff) They even try to charge you (my collegue) for minibar-goods you didn't use. A lot of noise in the hall during the night gives you not a good night rest.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service and great view.”
Reviews.Author: Matt B
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved the hotel. The rooms were large and well decorated. I would definitely stay there again. GREAT PLACE, great food too.

Reviews.Title: “nice helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: tinycampbell
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for a couple of days to run the Barcelona marathon,lookinf forward to the spa afterwards. the entrance lobby and reception are beautifull and the room looked nice enough,the flower displays were totaly georgeous. however there was a red smoke detector light that blinked all night and the room was so noisy you could here the other guests, our bed creaked all night and the sound of the ambulance from the nearby hospital (which is not the hotels fault) was not helpfull for a good night sleep, the shutters in our room were broken, the sink plug didn't work (we reported it twice) they came once to try and fix it but it didnt work... then there was the mini bar 11 euros for a pot of smarties. 8 euros for a can of coke, i think the water was 11 euros this is too much, nobody minds paying a bit more than normal but this is outregeous. then 25 euros per day to use the internet connection, we didnt we went to a cafe and used a free wirless system. a hotel charging theses room rates should have fee internet access. breakfast was a good range of items and my husband had some nice food, i ate a bannana and had a cup of tea and was charged the full breakfast rate. finaly the spa (the reason we had booked this hotel) so after the maratahon we trotted up to the 43rd floor where we were told by a rude young lady that it was 40 euros each just to use and we would have to use it seperatly men in one side women in the other.... alll we wanted to do was sit in a steam room or sauna and relax our legs after the 26 miles... at no other 5 star that we have ever stayed has the spa been an additional cost, no body minds paying for massages, pedicures and such like but just to use the facilities this should be free. so overall not great, which was a shame as the hotel staff were so nice x

Reviews.Title: “Service! Service! Service!”
Reviews.Author: Belgiantravellover
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel for design lovers, we had a room booked at club level and were upgraded to a corner suite, pure luxury! service: This is really the key word in this hotel, very friendly staff who serve with a smile. It's all about the little things: who goes jogging to get back a bottle of water. Free water in the pool. In the lobby bowls with sweets and refreshing lemon water offered. Upon arrival at the reception / lobby, a staff member ready to help / guide you. rooms: We got an upgrade to a corner suite, 75m2 pure luxury with a view over the entire city and part of the marina on the 31st floor. The lower levels have sometimes no views (until level 5-6) about other buildings very near! B & O sound system in each room, soft comfortable beds. The curtains and lights could be controlled from a panel near the bed. Spacious salon. garden and swimming pool: Large swimming pool with a 100 sunloungers (Royal Botania), seems a little on busy days? Jacuzzi in the garden. The garden is not too big but pleasant. club level: RECOMMENDED on de31st to 33rd floor, accessible by private key only for club level guests. The club lounge, this is really the cream of the crop, very quiet lounge (like your own living room) where they will welcome you upon arrival with a glass of champagne or fresh fruit juice. Continuous food (breakfast, lunch, dessert buffet and dinner and tapas non stop) and beverages (cocktails, Champagne Laurent-Perrier, wine, beer, soft drinks, coffee nespresso, tea and other spirits of international brands throughout the entire day) the view spectacular. There are confortable salons and tables. Free meeting room is available. Free use of 3 elecktrische cars of the brand "Smart" which you can use up to 4 hours a day in the city. Bar: Very nice and cozy bar, the drinks are very expensive (cocktails € 20) That certainly gives you your advantage at club level. Situations: Very good on the seashore and the harbour, very close near the Metro (200m), You reach the city center in 10min, even by car. By feet 15min from the Ramblas. There are close restaurants and bars. Be aware from tourist trap hotels in the harbour! This is one of the very best hotels in Europe!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at its best”
Reviews.Author: nkelloggs
Reviews.Content: Excellent service. Friendly Staff. Efficient every step of the way. Staff were good for recommendations of restaurants, bars, clubs and site seeing tours. The pool area was clean and we were able to get a sun lounger on our visit. Id like to give special praise to the staff on duty in the Club Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “World Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: justsittinonthebeach
Reviews.Content: This Hotel exceeded all of our expectations. This hotel (owned by the Ritz) is one of the best we've stayed in. My wife and I are usaully a Four Season's Hotel regular and found this Hotel in the same class. We had a room overlooking the ocean and city.... just wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels....”
Reviews.Author: Chezzabear
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Arts whilst attending Mobile World Congress. Disappointedly I was only on level 2, the first room had a view of a brick wall so I went back to change rooms - and got a view of the roundabout instead which was slightly better considering I was staying there for a week! Given that the Hotel was full, the staff did there best to look after and I liked that they always greeted you wherever you were in the hotel or lift. Big improvement on the bar area and liked the new cosy feel to the back room of the bar. Breakfast here is one of the best I've had in a hotel and nice to be able to sit outside if the weather permits. Would be nice to come back here in the summer and enjoy the pool area and the hotel when it is not completely full with business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous luxury with the best view!”
Reviews.Author: Louise S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our daughter's 18th birthday and it was a marvellous experience. We had sea view rooms which looked out on the marina and beach. They are modern and very comfortable. The level of service in the hotel is fantastic and reception gave us a great route to take in the sights on the way to the Gaudi House. Dinner at the Arola restaurant in the hotel was wonderful; Tapas meets food gastronomy! The prices are pretty steep but as our daughter tells us; 'you only live once' and we do have amazing memories of a wonderful weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel, would not stay on personal trip”
Reviews.Author: GoBlue88
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, nice rooms. The bathroom in the room is really nice, one of the best I've seen. Very friendly staff that speaks multiple languages. While it is true that you'll get a "buenos dias" everywhere you go in the hotel, I didn't find this to be an annoyance. The prices for drinks in the hotel bar are absolutely ridiculous 20 euro for a cocktail - they were about half the price down at the new W which is a nice 20 minute walk along the beach and has an unbelievable view from the bar at the top. Location of the Hotel Arts is ok, you can get to the metro in about a 5-minute walk (and Barcelona's metro system is easy to use and surprisingly clean) and there are very convenient buses around. Very happening bars next to the hotel. Be careful walking around the beach area late at night - I was approached both by "working ladies" and by drug dealers in an area that otherwise feels very safe. The breakfast is really good. Lunch and dinner were o.k. Save some money and head out for some tapas instead. My usual annoyance about high-end hotels charging for WiFi exists here as well: a ridiculous 25 euros a day. However I didn't have trouble connecting multiple devices without paying extra, so I'm not sure what the issue was with some of the other reviewers on this point.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely located business hotel within heart of Barcelona but hotel needs revamp”
Reviews.Author: Carthagean
Reviews.Content: Nicely located business hotel within walking distance to Marina. Friendly staff however hotel needs a technology revamp: TV service and internet were not working very well. AC was noisy

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in lovely location”
Reviews.Author: Sunshinenw3
Reviews.Content: Stayed Friday night and Saturday night. Delightful hotel, beautiful room, fantastic service, extremely helpful and interested staff. Nothing was too much trouble. We had lunch on Sunday before leaving for the airport and, although expensive, it was really lovely. We sat outside in the sunshine and were thrilled with the food.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous albeit pricey hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fifi_banana
Reviews.Content: Fantastic rooms - spacious and comfortable; mine was on 21st floor with wonderful view over the marina. Nice walk along beach towards central Barcelona, plus tourist bus stops outside hotel. However, it is expensive, and therefore outrageous to charge for things like Internet (minimum spend €25 for 24 hours) and even the coffee making machine in the room, which I had assumed would be free.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every euro”
Reviews.Author: cheryl2425
Reviews.Content: The rooms were spacious and the staff couldn't have been more accommodating. While not in the center of town, the hop on hop off bus stops right on the corner and the metro was about 2blocks away. On the right we had a view of the Mediterrean and to the left a city view. Black out shades kept room very dark, so you might not want to close them all the way so you can have a little lite in morn. Beautiful flowers throughout lobby add a special touch. The breakfast buffet was great and offered anything you may want. Tanya, Marta,Carman, and Carlos to name just a few were exceptional in their helpfulness. Only drawback was the 25 euro a day charge for Internet. We had it included in our room package but for only one device (we had 2) All in all, a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, probably the best in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: lachaplin
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with amazing rooms. Staff very helpful and the pool was perfect. Even the restaurant was great. Would stay here again. Only downside is its very expensive but you do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: patrickjeffsmyth
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything. Honestly have never stayed in any hotel that could come close!! The staff where out of this world & catered for every need & chatted away to you so friendly again better than anything I've experienced before! The views well I was on 26 th floor & wow you could look out over the city & Marina superb. The prices in hotel were a wee bit on the expensive side however you were a stones throw from the beach & loads of lovely restaurants & chic bars. Honestly would say to anyone going to Barcelona this hotel is a must ;)

Reviews.Title: “luxury overkill”
Reviews.Author: nappyrabbit
Reviews.Content: staying on the 7th floor and can still hear the street traffic. the charge for WIFI is 25 Euros per day per DEVICE. Totally outrageous. Way too many buttons just to work the lights. no TV reception at all. Everone pushes for a tip.

Reviews.Title: “City cool”
Reviews.Author: Jardoor
Reviews.Content: Wow what a hotel. This place had been talked up to me by everyone that had ever been and i see why. It's simply perfectly run.., friendly and highly professional, beautiful and stunning, it's just a place you should go. The room, well apartment (comes with its own open top Mini, Macbook etc) was incredible (huge with the largest, most comfortable bed i have ever slept in) with views across the city (including from your bed) but equally you could request views of the sea (it sits on the beach) or a bit of both due to its location. I have to admit the stay was a gift to me, thankfully so as an apartment could set you back a bit, the suites as well but a room would be equally as exciting. If money is no object do it and stay unless you have not been to barcelona before! Why do i say this, well it's a great city and you wont want to leave the hotel or its grounds! Great service, stunning views, friendly, organised, chic. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Midnight arrival, Upgraded to the Top of the World”
Reviews.Author: mike e
Reviews.Content: A train problem in Germany caused my wife and I to miss our flight out of Munich to Barcelona. Ten hours later, we arrived in Barcelona and pulled up to the Hotel Arts just after Midnight. Exhausted we approached the front desk to check in and apologized for being so late and explained our ordeal. The night clerk noticed that we had stayed at the hotel before and taking heart to our train and plane issues said he would upgrade our room. Wow! What an upgrade. He gave us one of the Apartments on the top floor of the hotel. 3 bedrooms, living room, dining room, full kitchen, 3 bathrooms and an outside terrace that gave us a view of all of Barcelona and the Mediterranean. Service was impeccable, food was excellent and the staff was like family. If you are going to Barcelona, there is no better place to stay than the Hotel Arts.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robg721
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a company trip back in July 2011. It has superb views across the ocean and the rooms are fantastic. I particularly liekd the addition of a Nespresso machine in the room - a quality touch. The hotel is right on the beach in safe part of town. I was with colleagues and we had a great time visitng the beach bars which are situated almost directly underneath the hotel itself. The one aspect of the hotel which was a bit annoying (hence the 4 star review as opposed to 5) was that to get to your room from street level involved a very complicated stroll around numerous corners and it was easy to get lost. I think this was a flaw in the original design fo the hotel because I can't see why you would have things arranged this way. I never made breakfast (too many 4am finishes in the bars, I'm afraid so I can't comment on this but the service in all other dining experiences was excellent. If you are in Barca and want a hotel located near the beach but still within reach of everythign else the city has to offer, look no further

Reviews.Title: “Nice but expensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: JulianaSM
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel very much. Its beautiful, the rooms are large (although mine was a little noisy) and the staff is very will trained. The negative aspect would be the very expensive restaurants, but still, I recommend and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Still very good, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: PotterMoose
Reviews.Content: A very friendly welcome with a glass of cranberry juice in the Club Lounge, but they didn't seem to know that we had stayed with them several times before (albeit five or more years ago). We were given room 3204, just below the Lounge, a big room with views of both city and sea. It had a huge bed, comfy chairs, desk, fridge, Nespresso machine, CD player. The bathroom was relatively small, with a separate bath, shower and WC. The decor was slightly worn in some areas and part of an electrical socket fell off the wall when we used it. There was no turndown service at all. The service in the Club Lounge was very good, and the food presentations all excellent, especially breakfast. We had light snacks downstairs in Frank's bar, which were good, but expensive (€13 for 6 small pieces of fish and a dipping sauce!). Also, whilst WiFi was free and quite quick in the Lounge, it had to be paid for (€25) in the room, which seemed a bit mean. Because our BA mobile app wouldn't work in the Lounge, we had to go to the Business Centre in the basement and pay €5 to use the Internet for 15 minutes to check in for our return flight. And this after paying over €400 for the room! We have stayed at the Arts many times, and still love the service and the views, but feel it now needs to up its game as there is much more competition out there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ItsAboutTheTravel
Reviews.Content: Hotel Arts is a beautiful hotel, but the location is not my favorite in Barcelona. You will have to cab to everything it feels removed from the city. The rooms are fantastic and very well maintained. Room service was not as tasty as it is expensive. The cost of the daily internet is out of control as well as the business center pricing. Overall it is beautiful but would prefer to be closer to town for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “The Art of the Hotelier”
Reviews.Author: rob w
Reviews.Content: The only word to describe the experience, luxury and service provided by Cam (Hotel manager) and his team, is flawless. Perfection, setting the standard for 5 star plus accommodation. We can't wait to return - and will !! Thx Cam - Rob & Caroline Walker

Reviews.Title: “Purrrrrfect”
Reviews.Author: nolatravel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came to Barcelona for 5 days - we chose to stay a 2 nights in 2 hotels and a 3rd night in a third hotel to explore different areas of the city. After reading reviews here and looking at the benefits offered through American Express Fine Hotels and Resorts we chose to stay on the Club Level and arrive to this hotel. (late check out / €85 voucher). We arrived around 10am from the airport and after approaching the check in desk on the 1st floor (2nd in US) were escorted to an elevator bank up to the 33rd floor where we were welcomed by name, given beverages, and quickly checked into our room that was waiting for us. The room was nice - furniture starting to wear but nice - B&O TV unfortunately burned in with artifacts from welcome message being repeatedly displayed. Bedding great and comfortable. The views were wonderful - larger rooms face NW and SE - normal rooms Dave NE and SW - I think SW beach view is nicer - we had NE view of adjacent office tower next door with marina. The location of this hotel is near the beach but far from most things people come here to see. The metro is easily accessed a few blocks away and cabs are plentiful - but it is a good long walk to the gothic quarter which is why we stayed in multiple hotels (this one, 1898, & W). You can look up the road and see the Segrada Familia on axis with the Cassandra de la Marina. The thing we most loved about this hotel was the service and the staff in the Club Lounge. Really nice spreads of food for breakfast, lunch, and evening snacks (really could call it a buffet of appetizers which combined make a meal) - you could eat all of your meals here and never get board with it - and the food along with drinks were all included as part of the club level. The staff were always friendly and talkative as well as helpful and always willing to answer questions about the city or help get tickets. We especially recall Michal who brought us decaf Capachinos, Sonia who helped us get tickets, Madhu who checked us in and out and answered questions and Raluca who always made sure we had all we needed to eat or drink - but everyone we interacted with was wonderful. We used our voucher to eat at one of the hotels restaurants: Enoteca - the food was interesting and good - but pricey - the voucher offset the cost 40% or so for the two of us. We very much liked our Server Dani who went out of her way to explain things and answer our questions and still manage to provide the same great service we were given to her other tables. We also used the electric smart car which was free to use in increments of time (I think 4 hours) to guests staying in the Club Levels. We regret we did not make it to the spa, and we very much missed the club level with its food and beverage after moving onto our next hotel. We checked out at 4pm but hope to return soon. It was the most welcoming hotel of our stay and fit perfectly as the first hotel to recover from the flight in and take an easy first few days. We will go back and likely explore other Ritz Carlton's based in tis experience.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to detail and Guests”
Reviews.Author: jewelofmontreal
Reviews.Content: Though I was staying at the Hotel Arts for work. I enjoyed my few peaceful moments at the hotel. I especially looked forward to my showers every morning in this wonderful room with rain shower and sauna like feeling in the room. I loved forward to my baths before going to bed. The room amenities are a perfect combination of items which encourage you to spend time taking a shower and bath. The window are huge with where you can sit staring out at the beach and mountains sipping a glass of wine or a cup of coffee. Loved the Nespresso machine in the room! The hotel has beautiful flowers everywhere, candy's in the lounge in the main lobby which changed as the days went by. The staff were extremely attentive and there was always someone around if you needed help with just about anything you might need. Everyone was extremely helpful with a smile 24hours a day. There are balconies everywhere for you to enjoy the outside. Though exceptional cold when we were there it was still beautiful. Close to a metro stop, the beach, wonderful seafood restaurants. the beach. A 30 minute leisurely walk to the Ramblas, the hop on, hop off bus has a stop next to the hotel. It is a real treat, privilege to stay there. During my stay two minor incidents happened however the hotel were apologetic and helpful. A lovely stay!! Ruby Montreal

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great views!”
Reviews.Author: KosmoK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a top notch property, I enjoyed my stay and would definitely stay here again. Nicely appointed, big rooms with great bathrooms. Inviting common areas and the food is very good. The staff are very friendly and go out of their way to help you. They are extremely genuine and one of the hotel's best assets! I was here for a big corporate meeting, they did a great job with everything and I was especially impressed with the dinner served one evening for over 200 people. It was very good quality for a group of that size. The hotel is a block from the beach and water. It would be the ideal location in summer! The views of the ocean, beach and city are great. The hotel is a bit far from the main tourist sights, though. probably the one drawback of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: nycfam123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from 2 nights at the arts. From the moment we arrived until the moment we left it was an amazing experience. We were welcomed warmly and greeted by name when we came and went. The concierge staff was very helpful. When the guest relations manager at check in realized we were tired from our early am flight and arrival she immediately offered water and a few sweets on a tray - we didn't ask but boy was that welcome and a touch. The room was fantastic - great bathroom, comfortable bed, great view. Very high end. And we were staying on Marriott points! Couldn't ask for anything more, if you are in Barcelona you must stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again it was decent”
Reviews.Author: colorblind123
Reviews.Content: Good club level. Delicious food. Service was average. Roof top pool was great. Room were good size . And clean. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Superlative”
Reviews.Author: AlinHauca
Reviews.Content: Breakfast - best ever Room - junior Suite superlative, great view everything great Staff - superfriendly Gym- very good Spa - very good Room Service - very good large choices Fine Dining Restaurant for gourmands Everything is superlative, I felt better than my stay at many hotels in world

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sreinyer
Reviews.Content: I stayed tahere 10 years ago and it hasn't changed. High quality, great food, B&O music in the rooms,.... Sometimes too many buttons to light the (bath)room, but that's a minor thing. Not cheap, but good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: wrldwonder
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on the water, and absolutely outstanding. Its a good deal for the money, considering its a Ritz Carlton. The rooms are modern and spacious with incredible views. The facilities are beautiful, the restaurants are superb. The staff is wonderful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, excellent service, kid friendly”
Reviews.Author: Parkinsummer
Reviews.Content: Hotel Arts is located outside the city center and has a very different feel to hotels in the denser parts of the city. Located on the rebuilt and revitalized beachfront, Hotel Arts is next to an arcade of casual restaurants and a wide esplanade where you can walk or bike along the water. There are nicer beachfront restaurants between the hotel and the beach as well as an open air night club or two. Directly across from the entrance to the hotel is a small casino. The hotel itself is lovely- an elevator takes you up to the lobby, which has a very nice lounge with complimentary candy and green apples. The elaborate flower decorations seemed to change daily and were a nice touch. Another set of elevators go to the rooms themselves. We used the hotel's car service, which picked us up(my husband, myself, our 2 year old, and my parents) promptly at the airport, but we had to endure a 50 minute traffic filled ride to the hotel. Upon arriving, we were greeted and told that our rooms were not ready, which was disappointing as the hotel had all of our travel info and we had actually arrived late because of the traffic. We had booked 2 adjoining rooms and were happy to be upgraded to a 2 bedroom apartment because due to a pharmaceutical conference, there was a demand for single rooms. This made our wait much more tolerable! The apartments are on a floor with a dedicated concierge, who was more than helpful in accomodating our needs. Our duplex apartment had an incredible view of te water through 2 story windows, a small galley kitchen and two ensuite bedrooms upstairs. It is the perfect setup for families and if it is within your budget, I would highly recommend! Service was Ritz quality. A baby cot was in place and a large coffee table removed promptly when requested. As for amenities, the restaurants and food were overpriced but as expected in a hotel. There are plenty of food options just outside the hotel, which was convenient. Wifi charges were ludicrous but alas, expected. Given the hotel's size and location, I would have expected a larger swimming pool/bar area and a shallow pool for kids, but the existing one was fairly nice. However, the pool was not heated and far too cold, so we spent time in the jacuzzi instead. Bottom line, this is a luxurious and comfortable hotel for families and for those who are not adamant about staying in the city center or who have been to Barcelona before and are content with less local charm. For families, there is plenty of room and food options and the nearby beach to entertain. I would advise anyone that although the local area looks pristine, be aware of pickpocketers and thieves. They are not isolated to las ramblas and we heard about tourists being targeted along the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: grk75
Reviews.Content: A beautiful Hotel. The staff is very friendly & helpful. A nice breakfast spread. Spacious rooms with a view of the sea. Nice clubs are situated at a walking distance. Good conferencing facilities, you need to pay a penalty if you are using a outside vendor for doing the conference event as the hotel has its own contracted vendor.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful deco-inspired dreamy hotel”
Reviews.Author: 3Mice
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days before departing on a cruise. The hotel is incredibly picturesque with amazing attention to detail. There were fresh flowers everywhere, and the staff was very accommodating and helpful. We were originally put into a room that looked directly out to the building next door with construction going on (Workers were able to see into our room, if I'd opened the window, we could have shaken hands, it was that close). It wasn't that big of a deal, but I did ask if there was the possibilty of moving to another room so I wouldn't have to keep the curtains drawn the entire time. They moved us immediately into a room with a lovely view of the city and the beach. Great location, would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accomodating staff”
Reviews.Author: Geoff S
Reviews.Content: Very Accomodating staff made our stay a great pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, lovely restaurants, great location, ridiculous WiFi costs”
Reviews.Author: TorontoRoemer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days and toured Barcelona using the subway which is convenient to the hotel. You have the perfect combination of being on the beach and having easy, clean and cheap access to all of Barcelona. The tasting menu in the signature restaurant is outstanding. Our only negative is the ridiculous cost for daily wifi .

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel and service in the world”
Reviews.Author: MargaritaFenwayI30
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in a club level room on the 33rd floor of the hotel this past month. It was by far, the friendliest, nicest hotel you can imagine. My sisters and I were so touched by the personal attention of Sonia, Marco, Lilianna, and the other fantastic members of the team. They greeted us each day by name and cheerfully directed us to wonderful restaurants, shopping, and catered to our every need. Some other wonderful perks in the club lounge included the amazing food presentations each morning and evening and included wonderful meats, cheeses, mini sandwich, tea, fresh salads, fruit platters, cocktails, beers, wines, and more. The spa was fantastic. I had the morning ritual treatment which is a great value because it includes a massage, wrap, scrub, and facial, all in an hour and a half! The vitality pool, steam room, sauna, and relaxation area was incredible. We were served ginger tea while relaxing on the roof deck, under heat lamps, with a gorgeous view of the sea. Enoteca was very good food, the Waygu Beef was a must have, as was the Monkfish. The dessert wasn't really up to our expectations there, but the oysters with bone marrow sauce and the special surprises from the chef (quail eggs, nut cookies) were AMAZING. The location was great, a five minute cab to las ramblas and the city center, gothic quarter, etc. and Walking distance to the beach, shops, nightclubs (more than you can imagine) and more! This trip was so incredibly special, and so much of this had to do with the hotel. I am the biggest fan of everything about this hotel and absolutely can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Visited Colleague staying here”
Reviews.Author: M0nika81
Reviews.Content: Although I didnt stay here, I spent enough time to warrant a review. The hotel was fabulous and the staff sensational. Friends had taken the upgrade, and so had access to the club lounge which proved invaluable for informal meetings. Given the opportunity again I would certainly be booking a room here. Central location, so close to the beach and great night life all around.

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming and relaxing hotel, with a luxurious boutique feel.”
Reviews.Author: GourmetTravel888
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, terrific staff—attentive, motivated, engaged. Large rooms were beautifully appointed. Lots of great design details. Amazing rain shower and large, separate soaker tub. Spacious bathroom. Instantly hot water. Very plush bathrobes and towels. Was offered a glass of cava while checking in--nice touch. Lots of great little touches like that, like the free delicious hot chocolate and the little candies in the lobby. Location was terrific for enjoying strolling along the seaside beaches. Taxis were abundant, even on new year’s eve. Concierge was very helpful and knowledgeable. Wanted to try a local fisherman’s stew and the concierge recommended a restaurant in Barceloneta, that was within easy walking distance from hotel. It was exactly what we had wanted. A seafood restaurant packed with locals. Very fresh seafood displayed on ice when you entered the restaurant. Enjoyed a very good seafood meal. Only downside was that our room was on a lower floor, so the view was not so impressive. Disappointed because I particularly chose this hotel because I wanted to have a memorable view of the city or the sea on our first day/night in the New Year. Oh well, the hotel was very busy.

Reviews.Title: “A strange pricing policy !”
Reviews.Author: Jerrybosch
Reviews.Content: A great hotel but how come can they charge you 25€ for a WiFi Room connection ! Amazing for a 5 stars hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous breakfast on the terrace, elegant rooms and city-view on top floor!”
Reviews.Author: Anja_1204
Reviews.Content: Barcelona is beautI vas amazed how beautiful can a marvelous Barcelona look like from the top floors of this hotel. You should defenitely book a room on higher floor (!). After having breakfast on hotels terrace on sunny day I felt like haven! Hotel has a elegant bar, where we enjoyed cognac in the nites, amazing terrace, location near harbour makes adventure or a calm stay even more lovely, nice clubs are near 8a walk distance), fitness center, good resaturants... I would defenitely reccomend this hotel when staying in Barcelona. P.S.: We even shared a flčoor with David Guetta when staying there...how cool is that :)

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service at an awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Southenders
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Arts Barcelona with my wife and two year old daughter. We cannot say enough about the hotel. The room was immaculate, well-designed and sleekly elegant. They allowed us an early check-in with a brand new seeming crib for our daughter already installed. Most remarkable about the hotel is the outstanding service. Carlos Nunez and his concierge staff could not have been more helpful. And the entire team went out of their way to make us feel welcome, including always crouching down low to ask our daughter - in English and Spanish - how she was doing. We could not recommend the hotel more highly and we look forward to visiting again!

Reviews.Title: “Globally nice but a few things to improve”
Reviews.Author: jclinder
Reviews.Content: Globally my experience in this hotel was very good, its situation in Barcelona on the beach but still near everything is very good. The hotel itself is very nicely decorated with a lot of nice art pieces and the staff is very nice and always greeting you when you meet them. The breakfast is also incredible with a big range of nice things including iberico style ham, laurent perrier champagne, eggs done in front of you to your style, very nice organic teas and you can get nearly anything from the kitchen if you ask. Not so nice is the furniture in the room which is old and should be changed and also the service is sometimes a little below what should be 5 stars service, like for example there was a nespressp machine in the room but the capsules were only replaced on the last day of my 4 days stay. Internet is 25€ per day which is a shame !

Reviews.Title: “NYE in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Paola B
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, excellent service! Hotel is located at Ciutadella, easily accessible via the metro. The view over the sea is amazing as long as you get a sea view room and potentially at least on the 6th floor. Hospitality and general service is excellent. Strongly recommend it if you are looking for a top hotel in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great service ,expensive room service and in room items ,watch out they even charge for the nespresso in the room !”
Reviews.Author: motormouthSpain
Reviews.Content: Great staff but is now getting tired in the rooms. Do not stay in a room past the 10 floor on a windy day as you will hear the building moving and creaking

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: SADAZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend at the end of October and cannot praise the staff highlu enough. We ate in the Restaurant and had the tasting menu, which was absolutely superb. The chef came out to speak to us at the end of the meal which made the experience even more special. Our room was on 21st floor with a sea and city view which was lovely. The staff in the cocktail bar where exceptional both with their cocktail making skills and their attentiveness.

Reviews.Title: “100% Perfect Stay - Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Phototravelgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights with my husband while visiting Barcelona for the first time. The entire stay was absolute perfection: - We requested a feather free bed at time of booking - done! - We requested a high floor - done! - Quiet room with lovely comforts and sound system - Staff was super friendly and helpful - Full breakfast was included - Convenient location, especially for hailing a taxi and the marina, only 20 mins to airport Tips: Bring your own nespresso pods for the in room machine, which cost 4 Euro each. Bring your own CDs for the sound system, the one in the room is charged at 25 Euro if you open the package. Hotel restaurants are way overpriced, try the local places...we went to Gelonch and Sensi, both were wonderful and short taxi ride from the hotel. We will definitely be back during our next trip to Barcelona. -

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Howard M
Reviews.Content: Very Stylish Building Ocean Front Location Outstanding Staff We checked in with 30 pieces of Luggage (don't ask) and it was handled effortlessy Hotel lobby does get crowded when hotel is busy and layout of lobby, shops and restaurants is confusing but beautiful very large rooms and really outstanding staff make this a Must Stay Hotel for Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel -- Location, View and Service”
Reviews.Author: LaurathePowers
Reviews.Content: I went to the Hotel Arts for a business conference and stayed a few days after for sightseeing. The hotel is suberb -- great location and outstanding service. My room was located on the 26th floor and offered a gorgeous view of the ocean and Port Olimpic. The rooms are spacious, especially for European standards, and I loved the bathroom (full tub, separate enclosed shower with rain shower head and side jets) It's a short walk to the beach and many local restaurants and shops. The metro is nearby, and the tour buses also stop just outside of the hotel. Wifi is offered in guest rooms, but it's costly (24 Euro/day). I'd definitely recommend the Hotel Arts, and if I return to Barcelona in the future, I'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: EuroLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference in October. This was my second visit - the first being for a long weekend a few years ago. Not much to add to that review. Rooms Got a special bedroom rate of 250 Euros, which is OK, I think. The rooms haven't changed much - think they are due a refurb in a couple of years perhaps, but for now, they look fine. They're still done up in beiges and browns. And they're still very big and spacious. They still have Nespresso machines and they still charge a ridiculous 4 Euros per capsule. Food Had lunch in the ground floor restaurant - was fine. Also ordered breakfast for myself and colleagues one of the mornings - 8 bacon sandwiches, orange juices and a small fruit platter set us back 240 Euros. I think all of the reviews of this place go on about how expensive the food is, but still... Conference and meeting facilities If you're planning an event in Barcelona, this is actually quite a good hotel to choose. The meeting rooms are all mainly below ground, but there's a really impressive space on the 41st floor which we used for drinks and dinner - great views. Service Very little to say - the staff were all really good. We had no complaints there. Overall, very good for work, comfortable, good staff, expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - amazing view”
Reviews.Author: skappy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Arts post cruise. We booked two adjoining rooms, one suite one standard room. The rooms were beautiful, very spacious and the view was amazing, our room overlooked the mediterranean and Frank Gehrys Fish. The staff including the concierge, was very accomodating and helpful. The only negative to the hotel is the pool, its small with limited seating. The seats are full by early morning. Short walk to the beach and marina. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay in Barcelona. Amazing views of the sea.”
Reviews.Author: Furman55
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay in Barcelona. The staff is courteous, multi-lingual, and attentive to guests needs. The rooms are very spacious and are more reminiscent of Ritz hotels in the US than Europe. If you are lucky enough to get a sea view room, wake up early one morning and watch the sun rise over the mediterranean, simply amazing. Avoid the restaurants in the hotel. While they are Micehllen rated, they are extremely over priced and are average at best in terms of taste. Other than that, would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotels Arts is Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Crooz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Club room on level 32 and loved every moment of it. Check in was fast and efficient, a nice touch was the drinks waiting for us on arrival at the Club Lounge Reception and the escort to there from the main reception on level 1. The rooms are nice and big and housekeeping does a great job looking after them,an added bonus is the fantastic rain shower and jets...best hotel shower we've ever had.The staff in the Club Level Reception we so nice and very friendly,especially Mario (hope that is his correct name), always greeted by name when ever we went there for drinks and nibbles. All the staff at the Arts were so friendly and nothing seemed too much trouble for them. Location wise was good for us, walks along the beach,terrific views, not as central as Las Ramblas but would ALWAYS stay at the Arts on future visits, no point looking for another hotel. Great hotel, super great staff, it was the best hotel on our 6 week journey Well done Hotel Arts, you are the best !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: Helen W
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels all over Europe but never before received the level of service and warmth of welcome I did at the Arts Hotel. From the second we got out of the taxi the staff were welcoming, friendly and extremely professional. They were the difference between a pleasant stay and a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “The best in town”
Reviews.Author: Felipe L
Reviews.Content: Nice view, nice location. Excelent service, breakfast, room and staff.

Reviews.Title: “They treated me right.”
Reviews.Author: godsmack44
Reviews.Content: While I don't normally stay in luxury hotels, I had a chance to stay in the Hotel Arts. From the moment I entered, I was treated extremely well and the service was excellent. The rooms had fantastic views, the concierge was extremely knowledgeable about the city and the restaurant had pretty good food. It was a little pricey for my taste, but I can see why guest pay a premium.

Reviews.Title: “Catalan Glamour”
Reviews.Author: GradRecJo
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt one of the top boutique hotels in Europe. Immacualte room, immaculate service and fantastic food. There is not much else I can say.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz Carlton you might expect”
Reviews.Author: Jpresskin
Reviews.Content: This is a very average and overpriced property. We stayed twice thinking we night have better luck the second go around but we did not. We were rushed by the staff, overlooked and our suite was really just a bigger room then most. Not up to the Ritz Carlton standards that I have know. Expect a Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and service !”
Reviews.Author: AMTLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights as a very short winter break. We'd stayed here 8 years ago but hadn't been back because it is so expensive. While it's still not cheap it seemed better value than on our previous visit. We had a slightly shaky start as we arrived late at nght and had a little difficulty checking in because there were men working on ladders at the desk, and then we had to phone down to chase up our luggage which should have been quicker. Everything else was great. Our room was on the 21st floor and had a great view over the Olympic Port out to sea. The room as lovely with a good sound system and TV and a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was the best ever with twin sinks a full bath, and separate shower and toilet each with a door. The shower was brilliant. We overslept because the room was so quiet and the blinds were so good at keeping out the light. Our room rate included breakfast which was excellent. Service was friendly and efficient with staff circulating with fresh orange juice ( best ever ) and coffee. There was a really good selection of items laid out over a number of counters along with a hot food area. The public areas are beautiful with lovely flowers and candles. One slight negative was that there were a number of items laid out on the table in the room which looked as thought they were free but weren't. At least when everything is in the mini bar you know not to take them. There was a bottle of still water left beside the bed which was free but the sparkling water and everything else was chargeable. There was no tea making facility and the coffee was 4 euros a cup which is a bit steep on top of the room rate. While it is a very luxurious place there were a few signs of wear and tear which you wouldn't expect at 5 stars. A lot of woodwork was chipped and there was a water stain on our wall. The basket work on one of the dining chairs was broken and the gold thread trim on our blanket was frayed. Small things but detracts from the 5 star experience a little. We have always liked the area around the hotel as there are a number of bars and restaurants in the Olympic Port . However time has not been kind and the area is now quite scruffy and down at heel. The bars looked unpleasant and the restaurants were very touristy. The receptionist looked aghast when we said we would be going there and pointed us to Barceloneta which is much nicer. The beach area near the hotel is nice in daytime and in good weather as there are a number of nice places to eat just above the beaches in both directions. Just be careful at night as we were nearly robbed in that area a couple of years ago. Best to stick to busy streets with good lighting.

Reviews.Title: “Way too plush for a peasant like me”
Reviews.Author: CPHLN2
Reviews.Content: Had a nice work visit to Barcelona and stayed here because the event was at this location, its is very plush and a great shame that I was there solo in a humungous room with two of everything, better planning next time

Reviews.Title: “magical and fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: cheeky7
Reviews.Content: My best friend and i just returned from staying 1 week at the Hotel Arts and we were blown away by the hotel and fantastic service! It started with a pickup at the airport after a long flight with our very well informed driver named Frank who had a beautiful and clean mercedes waiting for us. Stocked with fresh fruit and cold water...what a nice relief after a long flight from Canada. He proceeded to tell us all about spain and the culture and places to go in Barcelona including ones we had not already read about before travelling. On arrival at the Hotel Arts...we were greeted like rockstars! They knew who we were before we even got out of the car! Whisked to our rooms where our luggage beat us there and they had upgraded us to a beautiful room on the 28th floor with much more space. Groovy music on the bang and olsen stereo played and soft lighting everywhere. Ambience is everything with this hotel we were about to find out! They knew is was my 50th birthday (1 second after handing the front desk my passport!) and the next day a bottle of champagne and strawberries dipped in choclate were waiting for us when we got back. This went on all week with more strawberries and tapas and little surprises. Very clean rooms and service was immediate on any of our inquiries. the bar in the lobby called Franks is groovy and fun. The staff is young and fun...we especially liked the waitress named Janiek Maats...who greeted you every evening as a long lost friend and was so lovely with her big smile and stories of travel and fun. Yes,,drinks in this hotel are very expensive and yes the morning coffee and tea we ordered was insanely over priced...but some how it was all worth it when you looked around the hotel and enjoyed the great service! i would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone travelling to barcelona and i hope to visit again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Love the design, but not the details”
Reviews.Author: Stiina
Reviews.Content: Hotel Arts has nice rooms, and good gym. The location, however, is quite far feom the city center, and it lacks on some details that you would expect from a hotel of this calibre. The most notable thing is that you cannot get cold water from the room, nor can you find ice from the hallway. A guest should have a choice whether to buy the 7 euro water bottle from the mini bar or not....Also, the wlan connection is expensive (25 euros/day). Rooms are fairly big, the bathroom is nice and the service is friendly. If there is a big event, youwill wait for ever for the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Middelburg
Reviews.Content: Because of an early arrival I had to wait for my room. The friendly reception staff went out of their way to help me as fast as they could to get my room ready. I had to wait in the bar which was almost worth the wait. Nice lounge area and nice croud drinking their coffees. Because the wait was longer than expected I was granted an upgrade to a suite which was actually amazing. Beautifully decorated corner suite overlooking the sea and the harbour. Overall, great location, great hotel and great staff. I can truly recommend this hotel for your next stay in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: RIADVERUSFES
Reviews.Content: No surprise heres, this is prime hotel at its best. everything is incredible except the high price unfortunately. got a free upgrade and the poolside is very cool, breakfast expensive i felt. 2nd time i had stayed here and if i had all the money in the world then would live here its that great. you dont want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Michael G
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Hotel Arts for 3 nights. From the moment we entered the property we were made very welcome. We stayed in a Club room and the standard of service form each and everyone of the staff was outstanding. Excellent food and drinks in the Club Lounge. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to enjoy Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: TAmemberSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: Hotel Arts boasts the best of Ritz Carlton tradition. We satyed at a high floor corner suite and the views of the Mediterranean were breathtaking. The room was spotless, the service very attentive. Sergi Arola's tapas restaurant is a must. The taxi rank works perfectly, so you never have to wait for a car. Well, nobody is perfect, so there are some minor drawbacks: Although the views are fantastic, the neighborhood is not as fancy as the one on Passeig de Gracía; you hadrly will leave the hotel walking. Service is really international (more than once we had breakfast beside the table of a Dutch family, assisted by a Dutch waitress), but a bit too much international. They may be fluent in several languages, but concierge needed to make phone calls no know what is open or closed on weekends; But those little problems will not compromise the excellence of the place. It is not cheap, as you may expect. But it is still a great place to enjoy this astonishing city.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melanie_G10184
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Arts is a beautiful hotel in a prime area. From the moment you enter the property the beauty of the hotel and excellent service starts. The recepion area is tastefully decorated and can be a bit crowded as this seems to be the hotel of choice for many. Concierge can also get quiet busy and we stood waiting for almost an hour on a Saturday morning but it was worth it in the end as the guy there was extremely helpful and gave excellent recommendations. We stayed in a one bedroom suite which was large and modern, the views of the ocean on one side and the city on the other side was amazing. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was also lovely, however the shower can make you feel a little claustrophic at times as the ceiling in the shower is quiet low. There were a few minor issues that we encountered such as the pay per view not working in the room even after the technician tried to fix it and an expensive bottle of makeup going missing. I complained to the manager at housekeeping, she sent a cleaner to look for it but it was never found and no one phoned back out of courtesy to apologise. I think it could have been thrown out by mistake by one of the maids so i never made an issue. With that being said we still thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. The food in room service was good and we had overall good service with everything. If you want to stay in luxury while in Barcelona in the best location in my opinion then the Hotel Arts is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: Arfa18
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in our honeymoon. This hotel is so modern and classy that even though it was full, it still felt relaxed. People at the front desk where very competent and they worked fast. They were very helpful with dinner reservations and tips on where to go. We ate breakfast everyday, room service, and it was very very good, everything was delicious and they had a lot of options and fresh fruit.We never used the pool of the hotel, so i can not comment on that. The location was great, we took tour buses all over Barcelona, And walked in Las Ramblas. We ate at Con gracia restaurant, i made a reservation 3 months before our honeymoon. Overall, this hotel was very nice and different. We really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury here”
Reviews.Author: n2research
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel prior to our cruise. We had a large corner room with views of the port and the city. The room and service at the hotel were unmistakably Ritz Carlton. We would have liked to spend more time at this hotel and in Barcelona. I could write pages about how much I enjoyed the walk-in shower. The hotel is very near a metro station (5' walk), the Olympic Village, giving you access to the city's treasures. The cab fare was about 40 euros from the airport. We also enjoyed the casino next to the hotel. The gym is also very well equipped for an athletes needs. A great place to stay! We will definitely come back here!

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Perfect”
Reviews.Author: MLadvice
Reviews.Content: Two days and two nights in a suite overlooking the ocean, Marina, Sagrada Familia and the city – beautiful seeing the sun rise over the ocean. Nice, spacious rooms provided with every conceivable comfort. Beautiful garden, pool and breakfast terrace. Delicious breakfast buffé. Excellent service, the staff goes out of its way trying to help, even helped me with my ipad. Appreciated the location; a combination of seaside resort & big city– enjoyed walking along the beach, through Barceloneta, to the Gothic Quarter. Will stay there again, hopefully I can spend more time in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury with a personal feel”
Reviews.Author: mosto
Reviews.Content: Ws in Barcelona for 5 nights and stayed 2 nights at Arts Barcelona. The hotel and staff are just amazing. The hotel staff are very pleasant and initiatively offer advice and help. The views, room (spacious and we were not on the club floor) and hotel grounds were in tip-top condition. Can't fault anything except for the bedroom lock which was broken but was fixed immedietedly once I mentioned it. I recommend to take room with breakfast because the breakfast is just wonderful - good spread and very nice environment. The gym is well equipped. Location is great as we love the beach and plenty of restaurants to choose from. We also ate in Arola and Enoteca - I must say that the food and wine selection is great. Main dishes were a bit salty for our taste. Prices were acceptable for a hotel of this standard. I certainly think that the hotel made our stay in Barcelona really wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a few kinks to work out”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travelwith4
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this beautiful hotel for a business trip with my husband. The Room was perfect the view was fabulous. The hotel in general was close to many attractions or the double decker bus to every attraction was just in front of the hotel. There were so many great places to eat nearby, the hotel had places to eat but terrible service at the pool cafe. The tapas eatery on the otherhand had great food and service. Casino was right outside the door of the hotel but we never did go to it so I can't comment but great location for this 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best view of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: hanord
Reviews.Content: Previously I had stayed at the Arts hotel at the Mobile World Congress but this time I chose Arts for our family vacation in June, traveling with my wife, three kids and with my mother in law. We had booked two deluxe rooms on the executive floor for six days. Upon arriving we were offered an upgrade to a two-story apartment on the 34th floor. What a treat! The apartment was large but had only beds for max 4 people, but the staff added a couple of rollaway beds in a hurry. The apartment stretches from one side to another of the building and there's a view of the ocean, beaches, downtown and all the way up to the mountains behind the city. It's the best view I've had from a hotel room. Ever. The staff at the hotel are friendly and give excellent service. The concierge on the 34th floor was always available and always friendly. Another great thing about booking an executive floor room is that you have free access to the executive club. I think it's on the 33rd floor. They offer great food and drinks several times a day and we often started the evening with a glass of champagne there before going to some restaurant. They also have a good gym and a pool, although the pool area can be quite crowded on warm days. But the beach is only a block away. I'm definitely going back to Arts again when I'm in Barcelona on vacation, but probably not for the Mobile World Congress when the price of rooms everywhere in the city skyrocket.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent (but at a cost)”
Reviews.Author: MapiMat
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel right ont he beach & marina. Very international classy clientele (many americans, rusians, etc). Many seem to be attending conferences (at the end of September anyway). Standard Rooms are very confortable and spacious (Nespresso machine, bath robe, sleepers, etc), but for the price it is to be expected. Breakfast is varied and caters for all tastes (with champaign, strawberies, etc). In the negative side the lifts are terribly slow, the wait it is almost unbearable at times (6 lifts for over 40 floors can get very congested at check-in check-out times). it also lacks highly specialised personnel...staff seem to be students from all over the world. Very nice & polite but not experienced enough in hospitality domain. Pool area can get quite busy. If you want a luxury hotel with all possible facilities in a great area of Barcelona then you'll be just fine....if you want personalised service & be pampered then choose a smaller 'palace' type hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful seaside hotel in Beautiful Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: Traworld2007
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Arts is a stunningly beautiful mid size hotel in Barcelona. We were upgraded to one of the penthouse apartments with a large balcony overlooking the beach and marina on one side and beautiful vistas of the city on the other. The two bedroom apartment was large and tastefully furnished. Service was outstanding,cordial and prompt. Hotel Arts is the place to stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel--Service Service Service”
Reviews.Author: Sept16
Reviews.Content: We stayed a few nights on the Club level and had a very relaxing, enjoyable experience. The Club personnel are very attentive without being obstrusive, and the light snacks and drinks came in handy whenever we happened to be between outings. The room itself was spacious enough but nothing beyond what you would expect for a Ritz property. The flower displays in the lobby, however, were remarkable--fresh and smelled great. The location is not exactly in the center of the tourist area, but is only minutes away by taxi, metro, or bus. Plus, it right next to the marina and beach with nice restraurants nearby. We will definitely be back on our next visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: gorichville
Reviews.Content: This place is far from Las Ramblas but the ambiance of the area is peaceful. Its one of the best hotel in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Wow at first!”
Reviews.Author: SullyR33
Reviews.Content: Ok, firstly, this hotel looks amazing! That's because it is overall! Where do I start, staff were great welcoming and nice, but don't be in a rush for your suitcase as it did take quiet a while to get to the room... The rooms are really nice, comfortable & great bathroom... The bed was one of the most comfortable I've been in in a long time! But given the price of the rooms, to charge for a coffee in the room €4 was a but much. Like any 5* in room prices were high & WiFi being €25 / day was greed. The food was fantastic & faultless for the 3 days... The lifts were a big gripe, even with 6, you could be waiting a long time! The pool was great with nice deck chairs and friendly staff... Location, on the beach, need a say more! Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “The best gets better”
Reviews.Author: sockster
Reviews.Content: Just back from our eighth visit of the Hotel Arts. There has been a large staff changeover since we first started coming here, but I have to tell you, it's better than ever...Each and every staff member genuinely seemed concered about not only us, but all of the guests. The rooms are starting to show some wear and tear and could definety use an upgrade. This said, they were outfitted perfectly, and the housekeeping is as amazing as ever. If you come to Barcelona, there are many places to stay- The Hotel Arts makes you feel as you are at the beach on vacation, rather than in a major city. Great job!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Seaside Views”
Reviews.Author: Spanish_Tutor
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a trip to Barcelona and if you would prefer to be beside the sea rather than in the Gothic area look no further than Hotel Arts. Situated right on the beach the Hotel Arts boasts stunning views of the sea and the city. The rooms are superbly fitted out. Everything in the room I stayed in was luxurious and the staff were really friendly and helpful making the entire stay a pleasure. Nearby are lots of seafood restaurants and the city centre is a short walk away. Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “What a class act!”
Reviews.Author: TTLotus
Reviews.Content: The hotel is elegant with European charm. Fresh plants and flowers adorn the entry and lobby beautifully. Incredible views from our high floor room. The service was superb and the staff were helpful and always with a smile. Our room was modernly designed with dark wood, double sinks, a tiolet and a bidet, and an Expresso machine! We felt totally pampered.

Reviews.Title: “BEST SERVICE! - concierge rocks”
Reviews.Author: ila9
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Arts last week with my husband who was there for work. We got a large room with the Aqua di Parma bath stuff. Unfortunately my husband fell ill and the Carlos at the concierge called for a doctor who came within 45mins. For the rest of our stay, Carlos took care of us and introduced me to Orial (bellman) who gave me great places to eat and enjoy the city as a local. Really great service... the hotel was very nice and clean. One downside was there wasnt a 'giftshop' type place to buy stuff like cough drops. I had to walk about 1omins to a pharmacy.

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: koenbl
Reviews.Content: When reading about this hotel on this and other sites, one would believe this to be the best hotel in Barcelona. And I think after my recent stay that they are among the better ones, but have some issues: The room I had was very spacious, but so dated: the eighties lived on here. 25 Euro to get on the internet, are you kidding? A waiter asked us after dinner " do you manage to keep the food inside ?". The interns run the place and there seems to be a lack of senior staff to supervise and coach these young enthousiast professionals. If you plan on visiting the city of Barcelona: this hotel is not in the center, so there are better options (Le Meridient to name just one). If you love the beach and are looking for a hotel with some style, try the W.

Reviews.Title: “Location is almost everything”
Reviews.Author: JonL_52
Reviews.Content: We (family of 3) stayed at the Arts in August, before & after embarking on a cruise. It's an imposing structure on the water, relatively close to the port, and a brief ride aboard the bus to La Rambla. Communicating via e-mail with the property direct was hopeless, as they failed to respond twice to my inquiries. Calling for a rate quote yielded as many varied rates as number of calls. Finally booked through a corporate partnership rate which was considerably better than their rack rate posted on the web site. It's a luxury hotel, no doubt, with high end amenities, crisp service, and remarkable views if you're high enough up and face the Marina. Sampled room service twice, both times exemplary fare delivered as assured. As mentioned ofter in reviews of this hotel, the pool is abysmal for the size of the Arts. "Saving" chairs is ticklish business at many upscale hotels, with little or no enforcement of the policies. Listen, I have no problem with any policy, as long as it's made public and that it's consistently enforced. Free for all with no rules? Fine. We'll arm wrestle for a lounger. Grease a pool kids palm to have him reserve your spot? Can do. Make saving space a room charge? OK. But do what you say you'll do. Causes less dissension among the ranks, although there is no perfect solution when there are far too many guests for pool furniture. I like this place, although value-wise, I'm betting there are better choices. Didn't help that the Euro was worth $1.57 American, but that's obviously not the hotels issue. I'll take that in consideration in Nov '12.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat disappointed”
Reviews.Author: LondonDisappointed
Reviews.Content: Of course there are a lot of positives to be said about the Arts but we found many of the things you expect from a 5 star hotel to be lacking with contrasting experiences of service.
