Staff politely asking if we needed anything when we were just passing through reception but when we actually asked for help with internet, menus, a simple room/hotel directory, more than 4 hangers in the wardrobe etc we either had to ask a few times or just gave up. Possibly the most irritating point was when room service made your room up at 4.45pm when you were just having a siesta. On the third night we put "do not disturb' on our door but that was no deterrent to the cleaning supervisor who kept knocking until we opened the door and was clearly on the verge of letting herself in. Cleanliness in the room was also very below par with stains on the window seats and chipped furniture. Be warned that everything is unnecessarily expensive in the hotel such as room internet access at 25 euros a day. It is a beautiful hotel although much better for a Summer stay as the nice areas to sit are all outside. I'm genuinely not sure where you would sit inside on days when the suns not warm enough to sit out unless you are full on dining in one of the restaurants. We were there 5 days incidentally.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Excellent Service, Food Very Pricey”
Reviews.Author: BermudaMom1956
Reviews.Content: Arrived mid morning from the U.S. and received early check-in as I'd requested which we were very appreciative of. Check in quick and easy. We were told we'd been upgraded but since I'd booked a suite, I wasn't sure what the difference was between it and the one we actually were put in. It was very nice. Very European and modern, wonderful views. We had a roll away put in the living room for our adult daughter and she was quite comfortable on it. Main bedroom bed was very comfortable as well. Internet access in the room was easy and fast. Only complaint with the room was the televisions. Supposed to be able to buy movies to view but the service wouldn't work on either TV. Someone came up to try and show us what to do but they couldn't get it working either. No big deal but since we don't speak Spanish, it would have been nice to be able to watch some movies at night in English. There was also a radio/sound system but we couldn't find any instructions in how to work it. Only had one meal in hotel, lunch in Bites. Was extremely overpriced for what we had and food was less than good. Husband had some sort of fish special and there were four large bones in it which shouldn't have been there. Daughter had a club sandwich which had a fishy taste to it and I had a chicken caesar and the lettuce was really brown all along the edges. It shouldn't have been served. Then had two sodas and I think a tomato juice and it was 97 Euros. Crazy. We spoke to a couple staying there who had dinner the night before in the hotel and they also weren't impressed with the food and thought it was very over priced. I know hotel meals are generally higher than elsewhere, but the food should at least be good. Really liked the area where the hotel was located. Right across from the Port Olimpic area where there were the usual tourist junk shops and a nice area with loads of restaurants. We did find one of the shops on the closest side to our hotel had lots of snacks, bottled water, sodas and other misc food items which was handy. We also found on our last morning that there was a nice cafe just around the side of the hotel by the casino where we had a nice breakfast sitting outside. A good find. There is also a hop-on-hop off stop just outside the hotel which is good if you plan to use that to get around and see the city. Plenty of taxis available just outside the hotel. Never had to wait. I must say since we've been home the hotel has contacted us re the comments we made on the comment card and I do appreciate this. Staff at the hotel were excellent and always offering to assist us and we noticed them regularly approaching guests in the lobby to see if they needed help. We would stay there again if we return to Barcelona - just wouldn't eat in the hotel! We would recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “"Amazing 5 Star Luxury and Service"”
Reviews.Author: tuckerCalgary
Reviews.Content: Every time we have been to Barcelona we have tried a different 5 star hotel. No more, we have found the one! The exemplary service started the minute our car door was opened with a true heart felt welcome and friendliness that never stopped until we left. We stayed on the "Club" level which cost a little more but worth every dime. The Club level rooms start on the 33rd floor which means breathtaking views from every room and the extras include very exquisite appetizers, refreshments, breakfast and various treats in between. The hotel was on the beach and noticed the hop-on hop-off tour buses stopped right at the hotel. It also has a casino but found it small and hot but that is the only negative thing we can say about this fabulous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FirstClassMedford
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Arts in Barcelona (Ritz-Carlton) is truly outstanding. We stayed there with access to the club level and the experience was fabulous in every way. The hotel is located on the beach and the building is beautiful inside and out. Our bedroom had a view both of the beach and the city. At night the city lights were beautiful and during the day we could see the beach and water. The hotel is beautiful but what really sets The Hotels Arts apart is the service provided by the wonderful staff. The lobby is on the second floor and only accessible to hotel guests. Every time we sat down to rest in the lobby we offered refreshments. The club lounge is well worth the extra charge. The service was extraordinary and the food, along with the beverages, was beautiful plus plentiful. I look forward to returning and recommend The Hotel Arts. The Ritz Carlton Hotel New York, on Central Park South, is a grand hotel that lives up to the Ritz Carlton name and tradition. We stayed in a beautiful room overlooking Central Park. The Hotel is very beautiful, quiet and dignified. The service is quick and sure. The hotel makes you feel very comfortable because it runs so smoothly. We had access to the club level and I would recommend this extra. The food settings are lovely and it is fun to visit and have a drink with visitors from all over the world who stay at the Ritz Carlton. Or just relax by yourself and overlook the park. I am looking forward to my next visit to this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Oops - never again!”
Reviews.Author: Catherine U
Reviews.Content: Positives: - great shower - great location close to the beach and several bars / lounges to hang out at night Negatives: - Bad food - Lost luggage and after luggage was located had to call several times to have it delivered to the room - Had to carry my own bags to the storage room - Chinese bath products - Nobody picked up the phone when calling to get a wake-up call - EUR 25 for internet for 24 hours - Empty amenities (no shower cap available etc) - The concierge gave us a terrible recommendation for dinner - EUR 11 for a small bag of M&M's

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Five Star Hotel all the way!!”
Reviews.Author: riocobb
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Arts whilst visiting Barcelona during the Circuit Party and the hotel was an oasis in all the madness! Great location on the beach and all the bars and restaurants close by. The service was faultess in every area of the hotel and despite the pool appearing small for the number of rooms we always got loungers to relax down to the creativity of the pool staff. There is always an expectation with a Ritz Carlton brand of hotel and the Arts still managed to surpass that!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best!!! An incredibly wonderful place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Karyn M
Reviews.Content: I can't wait to return to this fabulous hotel. It is 5 Star in every category..ambiance, friendly- can't do enough for you staff, great help from the conceirge group, beautifully maintained facillity including gym, spa, pool. Rooms were beautiful and cleaned several times a day...wonderful linens...I could go on and on, suffice it to say that I found this to be the best Ritz Carlton that I have tried.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and service - top notch”
Reviews.Author: Popect
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Arts for several days in October and found it to be a great place. We were situated on the 18th floor with a big room facing the Med. Great bed, sheets, and service make this a very good choice, but not for those on a tight budget. Don't get me wrong it is an awesome place but it is expensive. Never saw the casino. Never used the beach. Note to those who want a pool - smaller size pool maybe an issue for families. Overall we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “one of the greates hotels i ever remember staying on”
Reviews.Author: manuel c
Reviews.Content: the title preatty much covers it all, i've travel a lot and stayed in many hotels but thats the one hotel that i always remember, i stud there a while ago but the picture of the place grew on my mind to the point that i even rebuilded my bathroom to be like the one from the Arts suite, with those lateral shower massagers, so good. if ypure looking for a luxury hotel in Barcelona, Spain, this is defenitly the one....enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, comfortable and efficient”
Reviews.Author: Peponi
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a conference in Barcelona where we stayed at the Hotel Arts. While I would generally always prefer to stay in a small boutique hotel, the Hotel Arts was pretty wonderful as far as big glossy hotels go. We had a large airy and very comfortable bedroom overlooking the marina with an equally large and luxurious bathroom to match. We found the service and attention to detail excellent. The lobby is very attractive and stylish and staff always helpful. The pool is large and well arranged. Everything gives a cool and trendy impression but is not pretentious at all. The lift service is a bit slow but that is just about the only tiny criticism I can muster.The position of the hotel is very convenient with the medieval part of town about 15 minutes walk away. Full marks to the Hotel Arts.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christian B
Reviews.Content: The hotel foyer is lovely, amazing flowers and a really friendly welcome. Unfortunately this is the only area in the hotel where the service is really good. The hotel rooms are big and the views dramatic, if you are prepared to pay the extra for an upgrade. There are no free drinks in the room, no welcoming flowers, no fruit, nothing. Even the Internet is not free which is outrageous in this day and age. Room service was poor, our bed and room were not made up on the first night and there were no nice touches. The breakfast was amazing, the best buffet breakfast I have had anywhere and the staff friendly. Service by the pool and in the garden was by contrast patchy at best. There was no service, this had to be sought out, drinks took 20 mins to arrive and were incorrect, this was still not corrected adequately and was then then repeated with the next order! In a five star hotel of this price I would expect everything to work smoothly not just bits of it. I wouldn't choose to come here again and would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I ever stay”
Reviews.Author: Edward-A A
Reviews.Content: Awesome - with superior staff service and high-quality facilities. It's a great hotel at all. My room has a very good sea view and is at one of the top floors. Room facilities are excellent - I like the background jazz music too. The bathroom is very good and the interior design make you feel very comfortable. The hotel location is also fairly good - with lots of (seafood) restaurants close-by and a middle-size shopping mall. The disappointing fact is the internet rate is very expensive but the quality is not that good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but... something missing?”
Reviews.Author: cclisch
Reviews.Content: Can't quite put my finger on it... something was missing. Gave this hotel 5 stars as we stayed here 4 nights during La Merce and had a great stay. We arrived in the early morning and our club level room was ready and waiting for us. Our room was partial city view and partial ocean view. Quite nice. Staff in the lobby and in the club level were very friendly and courteous. The room itself was modern and roomy, with many added comforts. The beds were comfortable. The bathrooms were very large with 2 sinks, separate tub, shower and toilet areas. The multiple shower heads were an added bonus. The towels were lush and oversized; the hairdryer a powerful one, not like the pitiful ones you may find in European hotels that barely blow. Turn down service every night. It was my husband's birthday weekend, so twice the staff gave us birthday treats: chocolate mousse cake and then chocolate strawberries and cava. Nice, personal touch. The Club level was adequate. It just didn't meet our expectations. We found the food to be sub-par to the food you may find at Ritz Carlton club levels in the US. We love European wines; however, we were disappointed in their wine choices here on the club level. All this said, we enjoyed the comfort of having the club level to relax and refresh. The pool was beautiful and the staff here was also courteous. We did have lunch at the pool one day. For an 18 euro caesar salad, I would have expected to not have brown lettuce. A disappointment. We did go down to the beach in front of the hotel and rented chairs for a couple of hours. Not enjoyable at all! Stay away. The beach itself was beautiful and the water gorgeous. However, the plethora of "beach attendants," I guess you would call them (not affiliated with the hotel), constantly walking back and forth calling out "Beer, coca cola, cold water" was absolutely unnerving. Then on top of that, you had the Asian ladies (again, a good number of them) asking you multiple times "mess-ah-hee (massage)? I give you good price." Couldn't take it! Went back up to the pool! Quiet and serene there. Overall, our stay was pleasant and comfortable. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and issues galore...”
Reviews.Author: Ita86
Reviews.Content: Where to begin?! This is not a five star hotel. At all. First impressions are great and you are greeted by friendly staff, however... The service in hotel arts is shocking. We arrived from the airport and ordered room service after checking in. We were told it should be in our room in 35 mins at most. It hit 50 minutes and the food still had not arrived... so we rang... twice... and they said it should be there soon (both times). Eventually the food arrived and our pizza was not cut, which left us with the messy task of having to do it ourselves. In addition we ordered three cokes, and they arrived with the lids left on them and no bottle opener. We rang through and asked for one and it arrived... 30 min later, after we had finished. I think this should be up to the hotel staff to serve. Whilst the hotel did apologize and gave us the dinner free of charge, it's still not good enough that this occurred in the first place.... Also... 7€ for a tiny can of Coca Cola?? 10€ for 2 biscuits? And worst of all 25€ for 24 hour wireless internet access?! Every other hotel I've stayed in has had free Internet.... Also, out of 3 room keys only one worked? There were 3 of us in the room and we had an occasion where we all needed to enter return at different times, but couldn't... had to go get this sorted with reception. And for the icing on the cake... at check out time we called to have our luggage taken and we were left to wait half a century. Just an indication as to what you can expect for 400€ a night. Defintely not value for money...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Corneliusfudge
Reviews.Content: Stayed here earlier this year and booked a Club Level room. Was upgraded to a suite which had a city / Sea view and was spacious and well equipped. The Club Lounge has 4 food changes per day and unlimited alcoholic drinks. Well worth the money. Staff friendly and helpful recommending and booking restaurants. A little on expensive side but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Comforts of the U.S.”
Reviews.Author: Laurie53
Reviews.Content: Guest rooms not quite up to Ritz Carlton standards in the U.S. but a very comfortable hotel with good service. After a long day touring the city it was great to come back to a hotel with American style amenities--shower had overhead rain type shower head and 2 side heads, pool was beautiful, cool and wonderful. Room spacious by European standards. 5 minute walk to the nearest metro. We were on 18th floor and could still hear sirens all night; there is a hospital nearby. It wasn't too bad, but we did use ear plugs. We were on the hospital side with a city/sea view, so maybe a room on the other side would have been better

Reviews.Title: “First timer in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: ladydame
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my hubby for 3 nights. Our room was clean, very comfortable bed, and the bathroom was spacious. I love the shower room with the sitting space area and rain shower head. i didn't like the way the lavatories were designed, found it uncomfortable to use as you tend to spill water on the side and the faucets seem to be on the wrong location. The bath towels were soft and large. The hallway where the elevators where located were a little dark and narrow, they should add some lighting there. Found the staff very friendly and helpful. Their breakfast is excellent, had very good choices. But for their lunch and dinner options, very limited and not as good compared to other places outside of the hotel. The location of the hotel is very convenient. I found traveling by taxi in Barcelona to be safe. It is very easy to go around the city i.e. bus, metro or taxi or even just walking around. I love the city, the shopping areas and the food!!!

Reviews.Title: “overvalued”
Reviews.Author: nmilhaud
Reviews.Content: Despite a great location and nice rooms, it is one thing to pratice astronomic prices at bars (18€/coktail), restaurants (?), spas (40€) or even wifi (25€/day !!) but you should expect a perfect service to accomodate. On the contrary, you see housekeeping investing the room or not coming back if you ask for 5mn break, internship students responsible of the bar making such poor coktails...it is such a disaster. Not mentionning the crazy architect who built this hotel where you need to take three different elevators to get to the top. Big disapointment. Apart of this, rooms are very nice but at such level, service should be at the right level.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 2011 New Year!”
Reviews.Author: Ingrid_O
Reviews.Content: My mom and I got a great deal on Expedia for a New Year's trip to Barcelona. Although Hotel Arts is a distance from the bustling Ramblas area, the marina is beautiful. It's quaint, rustic, and charming. And staying at the hotel added to the magnificent trip. We got a standard room that faced the water. Every morning we were greeted by amazing staff in the breakfast room. Breakfast was incredible: charcuterie, breads, yoghurt, fresh fruit, eggs made to order, patatas with truffle... and more. One day my mom and I decided to drive up Costa Brava. Carlos in Concierge was overly helpful in getting us a car for the next morning, as well as a free upgrade for a more pleasant drive. The next day, the staff in the breakfast room packed us som churros and chocolate to snack on, on the ride up. The car was brought to the hotel and the car rental representative talked me through the functions of the car. It was the most amazing 4 days in Barcelona I've ever experienced and largely attributed to the amazing service at the hotel. Not to mention amazing food at their Michelin star restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “holiday in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: eddy32
Reviews.Content: A really relaxing holiday here. No problems with housekeeping and when we asked for extra toiletries they were soon provided. We found all the staff very helpful and friendly. The breakfast choice was excellent. The whole hotel complex is very attractive with art works in many locations. It's very convenient for the beach but also walking distance or a short taxi ride from many attractions. The tourist bus stops nearby and we took a 2 day ticket to travel and stop off all around the city. this was well worth the money for the convenience and tourist information given on route. The Casino is part of the complex and there are popular night clubs and bars nearby this however does not make the hotel noisy. A great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: dtanpcs
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on Marriott points and was very happy with the experience. It is not quite as impressive as a Mandarin Oriental or a Peninsula, but still very comfortable. I liked the light sealing blinds and the multi-head showers. I was disappointed with the Michelin rated restaurant, it was expensive and did not overly impress me. I liked the the food at the other restaurants in the hotel more. The concierge was very helpful, working diligently for 4 days to locate my luggage that the airlines had lost. All the staff were very friendly and helpful, though some were much more knowledgeable than others. The location is great, right next to the beach. The only other luxury beach alternative is the W. I preferred the location of this property. There are more interesting beachfront restaurants and bars in close proximity.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Ritz Carlton at all”
Reviews.Author: FunTravelerForSure
Reviews.Content: I checked into the Hotel Arts post cruise as arranged by my cruise company. The hotel is in a great location right on the beach! The rooms are large and well appointed bathrooms with terrific rain head shower. The service however really lacks! So, so housekeeping, no turn down service and they never cleaned my room in the afternoon or prepared it for the evening in the 3 days I was there. The staff was very friendly and helpful at the front desk and lobby but the pool staff nearly ignored you! All in all the Arts was not at all to Ritz Carlton standards from my experience and quite dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: “No reason to go home”
Reviews.Author: TheConstantEater
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the recent European Poker Tour event, and was lucky enough to have it paid for me. BUT, I couldnt find anywhere better to stay in Barcelona It is near the beach, near great restaurants (hope the hotel does not mind me mentioning AGUA), the rooms are lovely, the breakfast is AWESOME, the staff are wonderful (but beware of Americans monopolising the concierge, not the staffs fault, but it can be frustating as a guest). Ever little detail from sweets in the lobby and water bottles at the pool. I love this place and am now spoilt for life. Barcelona is a recurring visiting spot, but how can I stay anywhere less than this?!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a great city”
Reviews.Author: Rodriek
Reviews.Content: We were at Arts for a business event. Location at seafront is great. Rooms below 10th floor are somewhat noisy because hotel is located near to nightlife area. Staff was extremely friendly and food was great. Swimming pools is nicely located but rather small in relation to the size of the hotel. Good connections to the city center via tube and great walk to Port Vell.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ruth6
Reviews.Content: If you want to treat yourself to something a bit above the ordinary when in Barcelona, I would recommend the Hotel Arts. Located in "Barceloneta" just a few minutes by taxi from the lively bustle of La Rambla and surrounding narrow streets, you are a world away in a magnificently located and suitably luxurious haven. If you have time, after lazing by the pool and being tended to by the highly efficient and personable attendants, you should try the spa. It's heaven! Bring plenty of pocket money, though. A class act.

Reviews.Title: “Club level is a MUST at this location”
Reviews.Author: NSIInnerloop2
Reviews.Content: What others have said here is definitely correct - nice, big rooms, great views, good location, etc. I think the real key to a GREAT experience here and a GOOD one is booking a Club Level room. Not just for the free drinks and higher/better view, but mostly because this is a BIG hotel. I mean really BIG. And the lobby can be a bit of a mob scene. Using the Club level concierge made our experience so much more personal and enjoyable, I can't in good conscience recommend booking a non-club room here. I think the key differentiator between those reviews with a 5-star experience and those with a 3-star review are whether they had the pleasure of dealing with the great staff and service of the club level.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have stayed in"”
Reviews.Author: DML2011
Reviews.Content: Hotel is right on the beach and provides a peaceful retreat from the city while it is just steps away from all the action. Room looked over the mediterranean and was high tech and complete luxury. Close to metro stations and staff was attentive to every need. Highly recommend staying here if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not the service you expect from a Ritz.”
Reviews.Author: Ksquare8
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and a good size. We found the location to be great. My biggest complaint was the service. For a Ritz hotel it was lacking. The pool service was horrible. We ordered frozen drinks pool side and they sat at the bar 10 min before they were delivered. The hotel food was over priced and average. The breakfast buffet for two was $100. This hotel was not up to par of the Ritz name.

Reviews.Title: “Rather mean with restaurant food portions”
Reviews.Author: Colette G
Reviews.Content: The view from our suite was stunning. Such comfortable beds, could have slept for days! Spacious and impressive contemporary design throughout. Big downside for us was the miniscule portion sizes of meals in the Verandah restaurant. My Grandchild's meal (chosen from the children's menu) was exactly the same size as the one my husband chose from the main menu - extremely small amount of food on both of their plates. As both were pasta dishes, could not see why the portions were quite so small, hardly expensive ingredients! Having travelled a long way from early morning, we were all really looking forward to a great meal. Prawn salad was equally disappointing, about 5 prawns and a few chopped ice-berg lettuce leaves. Everything took more than 45 mins to arrive - why? Pasta takes about 10mins to cook and how long does it take to chop a few lettuce leaves and toss them into a dish with a handful of prawns? Adding insult to injury, we paid more than £150 for the food. All still very hungry and having eaten the equivalent of "appetisers", we left the hotel in search of a local restaurant for a top up dinner. Shame on you Hotel Arts, no need to be quite so mean. Water features and wonderful flower displays are impressive but a great meal would have made a finer impression on us.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star all the way apart from----”
Reviews.Author: WalesWelshman
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights on a leisure trip and the hotel service, rooms,comfort, breakfast, cleanliness etc were 5 star all the way. Location also excellent at the heart of the marina with many restaurants and walking distance to Ramblas. Our only complaint that the hotel's pool and gardens are woefully too small for the size of the hotel. We could not get near the pool as the 20 or so loungers were taken(mainly by Russians and their bodyguards) and we counted just six loungers in the garden area one of which was broken. We had to sit on our towels in the garden area and drink our lemon fantas at 7 euros each from pool bar!! A great hotel but not if you want to laze around pool and gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Not that good for a Ritz Carlton managed hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tnova
Reviews.Content: Stayed for seven nights. May issues with overall service and facilities. Hot tub not hot, not clean and numerous very youg children. Thought it was a kiddie wading pool. Turn down service not timely nor completed three out of seven nights. Asked concierge for menu for the hotel's premier restaurant - did not have one available "at this time". For the price not impressed whatsoever. Location is very good. Although a nice hotel not sure I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, poor service”
Reviews.Author: SusieASeattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 1 night prior to getting on a 7 day cruise and it was the perfect choice for the relaxing after a 15 hour flying day. My kids loved the pool area and their buffet breakfast was hands down, the most deluxe buffet I've seen at a hotel. Lots of selection and very high quality. The food service was very good, the servers were attentive and responsive. They also had a wonderful little play area set up in the buffet area for little kids which I happily utilized. The only bad parts were that the check in process took a long time and one supervisor decided that she would berate the front desk clerk in front of us for not getting the correct paperwork from us. I thought that there should have been a better time and place for that. Also, we booked a room with 2 doubles but they said they didn't have this reservation (even though that's what I confirmed via American express platinum travel). They were sold out so we agreed to take a roll away bed. However, it took them several hours to get it to us and when they did finally get it to us after 4 phone calls, it had no bedding and it took them another hour to bring us the bedding. At check out, I had a food credit but the front desk clerk didn't know how to apply it to my folio so instead, she just asked me to pay the amount. I've never heard of anything like that and I told her that I wasn't going to pay when I had a credit to use and she would have to figure out how to properly adjust my bill...not quite what I'd expect from a Ritz Carleton.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jennifer k
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, new and fresh, beautiful flowers and our room was large with a great view. We stayed Club Level and really enjoyed the lounge with great food and no charge for any alcohol. You can easily walk to the beach and enjoy a day in the sun. The pool is very small for a hotel of this size and most diffucult to find space to sit down. It is expensive but Barcelona is a world class cosmopolitan City so that high prices go with the territory. I will definitely stay here again...we had our two teenage daughters along as well and they loved this property.

Reviews.Title: “Too Expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Sean J
Reviews.Content: I paid for two nights, and used marriott reward points for 4 nights. First the good 1. Beautiful rooms 2. Nice location, all rooms have a view of the marina 3. Mostly cheerful staff The bad 1. I am a marriott platinum member. When I made my reservations, I asked and was told I would get platinum benefits such as access to the executive lounge. when I checked in, I was told it's a ritz cartlon and marriott benefits do not apply. I objected and told them that the reservation agent said, they then said it was based on availability 2. They do not have enough elevators. there are two elevators to take you to the lobby from the first floor, and six to take you from the lobby to your room. I had to wait 10 minutes to get an elevator to go to the lobby 3. The pool is too small for such a large hotel

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel, Seedy Area”
Reviews.Author: EFE2000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights on Marriott points. It is a very nice city hotel - but really indistinguishable from any city Marriott or Renaissance hotel. I'd had not stayed at a Ritz-Carlton before, and the only things that really stuck out were the prices. 32 Euro for breakfast, and I think a beer was 7 or 8 euro. The service was attentive, and they were able to check us in at 9:30 in the morning after an overnight flight. Having been left waiting to settle in with small children before, that was a blessing. The rooms were nicely decorated and clean. The clientele seemed to be a lot of families, and the pool was insanely overcrowded. Overcrowded to the point that one look and you knew you weren't even going to bother trying to find a chair. Very pretty in the pictures, unusable in practice. The hotel is next to a rather seedy strip of clubs in the marina, whose patrons whoop on the streets after the bars empty. A low floor room will get you more of that noise. There is also a casino next door that brings in a lot of traffic. Out for an early morning walk, I was propositioned by a local streetwalker IN THE HOTEL CARPORT, and there was a club goer passed out drunk, also directly in front of the carport. Very classy. Overall, it was a pleasant hotel to stay in, but I was glad I did it on points.

Reviews.Title: “Six star experience - fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Rooinek
Reviews.Content: We checked out of the W Barcelona early and moved to the Arts, and boy are we glad we did. Instead of enforced Wow coolness (see my other review) we got excellent but understated service where nothing was too much trouble. We booked the Club rooms, which gives you access to a lounge on the 33rd floor where you can eat, drink, relax, look and the skyline, and plan your next outing. It's a hotel within a hotel and absolutely worth the supplement. Special mention to Madhuri, the club multilingual lounge manager, who helps everyone with unfailing courtesy and unflagging energy. Our rooms on the 30th floor were good-sized, beautifully decorated and with a fabulous rain shower, and excellent consumables. As good as one could wish for. The pool area is a little small for the hotel size but there is an excellent outdoor restaurant right there, and lovely gardens with hypnotically-sprung freestanding hammocks. Despite being a city hotel, we did feel like we were in a resort. Fabulous stay, would go again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite What We Expected”
Reviews.Author: grateful_edi
Reviews.Content: Since this is a Ritz Carlton hotel, we had high expectations for both the service and the amenities. Unfortunately, we were underwhelmed by our experience. On our first night, we called for an iron and foam pillows and even after several phone calls it took 6 hours to for our request to be delivered. Needless to say we had to go to dinner in wrinkled clothing. The pool area is not near large enough to accomadate a hotel of this size (30 floors) and trying to find an open chair was was like playing the lottery. You are relegated to the grassy area or across the street to the public beach. While I found the people in the pool area to be very hardworking, the services was inconsistent. My bill also contained several errors and it took multiple conversations with mutliple people in order to resolve the errors which took time out of my last day. If Hotel Arts is representative of the Ritz Carlton brand, then I am very reluctant to book another Ritz Carlton hotel.

Reviews.Title: “still one of the best”
Reviews.Author: Martin K
Reviews.Content: Had a great time, staff very helpful. food on terrace not the best. will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Goldeneye_007_James
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Arts Hotel for 2 nights as part of a 7 night stay in Barcelona. Compared to other 5 star hotels we have stayed in Barcelona this is the first one worthy of a rating of 5 stars deluxe in our opinion. We just loved every minute of being there. On checking in we were originally allocated a room on the 2nd floor. We explained we liked a room with a nice view so we were offered one with a view of the beach and harbour on the 24th floor so long as we didn't mind waiting a short while so that the room could be prepared. It wasn't just the reception staff who were helpful though. All the staff did their best to ensure our stay was the best possible, and the hotel has alot of staff to look after the guests. A bit of a headcount round the pool area alone showed about 10 staff looking after guests round the pool and a further 5 top class chefs working an outside restaurant. A special thanks must go to Yamn Roche the poolside manager who took the trouble to come and speak to us several times a day and remembered our names throughout. We were totally pampered throughout our stay and whilst the hotel is one of the more expensive hotels in the city it really was well worth paying the extra for. The hotel itself is beautiful with spaceous bedrooms all kitted out with no expense spared. It is located right by the beach next to the Olympic Marina and well within walking distance of the main harbour, La Rambla and the old Gothic area of the city. If it falls within your budget you will love The Arts Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: pchang637
Reviews.Content: As many other reviews have mentioned, this is a beautiful hotel. The lobby, hallways, etc. are all simply and elegantly decorated. Right when you walk into the lobby, there is staff waiting to help answer any questions you may have. The concierge was also very helpful in making dinner recommendations, as well as assisting us with rental car issues. The room we stayed in had a view of the city. The room itself had all the amenities of a 5-star hotel (high-end bath products, large walk-in shower, big bathtub, various lighting settings, etc.). My only complaint with the amenities available in the room was the fact that EACH coffee pod (for the single-serving espresso machine available in the room) was 4 euro. I felt that was a bit steep for espresso you make yourself, when many hotels will offer free coffee packets (granted, not espresso) in the guest rooms. The pool was on the smaller side, but the staff servicing the area was attentive. They helped lay out towels on the lounge chairs, and brought out the wine that we ordered with complimentary bottles of water. The location of the hotel was nice in that it was right along the beach, where there were a ton of great restaurants and people watching. There is also a casino right next to the hotel. We did have to take a taxi into the city in order to check out more of the touristy sites, but taxis weren't that expensive. All in all, a great hotel. I was lucky to be able to get a corporate discount rate (which included free internet access), so while our stay was pricey, I didn't pay full market rate. I would probably hesitate to stay here if I had to pay full market rate, given a tourist might still have spend a little more money for taxis to the tourist destinations. However, if you are looking for a relaxing and pampered stay right on the beach, this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in BCN but...”
Reviews.Author: nico_ch
Reviews.Content: We spent close to a week at the hotel, and overall enjoyed it. It's clearly one of the best hotels in BCN (and I'm there for business 4-5 times a year). The staff is great - especially with children, sometimes to a point where it becomes "too much" and clearly not genuine anymore. We loved the rooms and the garden. The pool is small (it really appears much bigger on the pictures) and when the hotel gets busy is totally overcrowded (and so becomes the garden). The location is great and there's lots going on - which implies a lot and constant background noise (even during the night - and you hear it even from the top floors). The breakfast is impressive but it never ever changed during our stay, so after 3-4 days it becomes really boring. Food they serve in the smaller restaurants (by the reception and by the pool) is OK, but very pricey. And speaking of pricey, Internet access is 25E/day if I remember correctly. It's cheaper to roam with your 3G phone...

Reviews.Title: “Trendy vs Attentive”
Reviews.Author: MatthewR4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Arts for 5 nights total. I didn't realize it was a cruise layover hotel. It is a Ritz-Carlton, right? Chaos in the small lobby area upon arrival. Staffing levels were good but need to have one point of contact for your entire stay. We had at least 7. Pre-arrival concierge was VERY helpful in making dinner reservations, car rental, and spa treatments. I would like to give a special thanks to Meredith (Front Desk Agent). Awesome customer service. Even made sure she was there for our checkout. I also want to send a shout out to the pool/bar interns they rocked it. Overall nice stay. Housekeepers are very pushy and persistent. Room service attendants personable, food blah. Would recommend this hotel if you are of the tourist mindset but as a get away.... not so much

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice but bring your check book”
Reviews.Author: marajoe
Reviews.Content: We loved the place. Stayed four nights at the Arts and loved it. the pool was so nice, but the drinks were very expensive. Way to much. The had a very nice view from our room. Could see both the sea and the city. very close to the metro, and the casino. The Casino is nothing like Vegas. The Spa is way over priced. We travel a lot and the spa may be good, but no way worth the money. The staff is top shelf. They are there to help you. You will not be disappointed. Lots of places to eat around the hotel. This is a must stay if you are in Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Best Decorated Hotel I've Seen!”
Reviews.Author: annjensen5
Reviews.Content: Everything in this hotel is beautiful, down to the flowers. From the minute you walk in you will feel like you are immediately at ease and in an incredibly luxurious place. The architecture and interior design are unlike anything I have seen in a hotel. It almost feels like you are sneaking into a beautiful mansion of some sort of art-collecting wealthy family. The staff are very helpful and knowledgeable about the city, the hotel, and the surrounding area. I have a few minor complaints which I will list only for the sake of helping others, but I will say that they were very minor and they will not deter me from staying here again. In fact, I plan and hope to return to Barcelona and the hotel arts very soon. 1) there is a charge for the internet (25 euros) a day... In my opinion when you are staying at a 5 star hotel you should not have to pay for internet. It is a small thing that can make a big difference 2) the cleaning service could have been better. there were no real problems with the housekeeping, I just think that for such a nice hotel it could have been up to par with comparable hotels. Other than that, the stay was fantastic. The spa was also phenomenal. (As expected, it was very pricey but worth it) The views alone from the sauna and steam room were unbelievable. I also recommend the chauffeur guided car service the hotel offers. Ask for Ricard, he was great!!

Reviews.Title: “luxurious rooms and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Barbsrubyslippers
Reviews.Content: Received excellent assistance from front desk and concierge after AA lost my luggage. The front desk arranged for the concerige to follow up with AA every few hours so that we could enjoy our visit. After AA's delay caused by only 1 daily flight to Barcelona from NYC, the luggage arrived on the 2nd evening and the hotel staff promptly delivered it to our room and left us a message on our cell. The ammenities of the hotel are very nice as well as beautiful views, and quiet rooms. While the hotel does have a 110 outlet, it was not enough watts for a flat iron, even with a converter. The rooms are stocked with ample supplies of shampoo, shower gels, hair dryer, a bidet and comfortable robes. We did not have any issues with interruption from house keeping. Also, room service and lattes for breakfast were delicious and prompt. Would definately recommend based on wonderful experience and great location, and views of the sea.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel...very $$$”
Reviews.Author: BChackes
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the first stop on our honeymoon in Spain. It was a wonderful introduction to Barcelona...we stayed on the 29th floor and had beautiful views of the city and the beach. The room was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was amazing! We spent time on the beach which is just a few minutes walk from the hotel and we were able to rent towels from the hotel for 6 euros. The beach in Barcelona is very urban and popular, but a little dirty. The pool at Hotel Arts is very relaxing with complimentary pool chairs, hammocks, water and apples. There is a metro stop just a few minutes walk from the hotel which will take you anywhere in the city. Stop by Arola for patatas bravas and great views on the patio!t

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: JonTon102
Reviews.Content: Hotel Arts is in a very happening area. Our suite had a view of Sagrada Familia on one side and Port Olympic on the other. If you're booking a flight, don't expect to check in early. Rooms were nice and spacious and could perhaps use some minor upgrades. The staff we met were extremely pleasant and helpful. I thought it was a great location. True, you're not on the busy streets of Las Ramblas or Passieg de Gracia but to me that was a plus. The hotel is a short walk from the train station. You can jump on a train and be in all the right places in a few short minutes. There are restaurants all along the beachfront or you can walk to nearby Barceloneta. Along the beach they have these xiringuitos or open air restaurants where you can enjoy a drink or a snack if you don't want something more formal. Within close proximity of the hotel, there are delis where you can get decent food at a reasonable price. That's what we did for breakfast everyday. The hotel gym had excellent equipment. Plenty of cardio and workout machines. If you're into gambling the casino is right next door to the hotel - make sure you bring your original passport if you want to get in. Just be forewarned, you're not in the country so don't expect the same tranquility. Barcelona streets come alive after dark. We really loved the hotel and would be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST place in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Michael S
Reviews.Content: The Arts is a fantastic experience for any visit to Barcelona. The high level of personal attention we received from the moment we walked in the door to the moment we left made or trip a unbelievable experience. The Club level service, concierge service, snacks, and view made this the differentiating element. The location is fantastic, to be on the beach plus have views of the city gave you the best of both worlds. We will be back to enjoy an extended stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best in the city”
Reviews.Author: Frankie M
Reviews.Content: By far the best hotel i ve been in barcelona , great service , great views , great rooms. If you have the time go to the spa , its located on the top floor with the best views of the city , so you can be at thecsauna watching all the coast line , just amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Service unlike any other in Spain”
Reviews.Author: The-Bull-Shark
Reviews.Content: Modern, comfortable hotel in great location in Barcelona .... right by bars, restaurants and beach and short commute to all city attractions. Staff was incredibly helpful and courteous, not what you are used to in Spain. Get a room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families, expensive, but worth it.”
Reviews.Author: gazborangers
Reviews.Content: Opulent surroundings, attentive staff and a great pool area. It is expensive but we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We had two massive adjoining rooms with all mod cons. Breakfast is a sight to behold and the whole hotels reeks of class. It is located by the beach so the sea breeze was a welcome relief after exploring blazing hot Barcelona. One criticism, I was on a package with a $200 room credit per night and this had not been deducted from my invoice, I actually had a small argument to get it, but once the head of reception was called it was sorted out. Would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: PaulSNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 5 days at the Hotel Arts. It is beautiful and well designed (our large room ended in 16 with spectacular views of the sea). The location is excellent with the beach and a boardwalk with bars and restaurants right behind. The most exceptional feature is the staff who are all superb. Vicenc (Director of Restaurants), Yann (pool manager), Selma (pool staff) and Ivan (chef for the most amazing breakfasts ever) all made it a wonderful trip. Getting into the city (particularly El Born - a wonderful distrrict with shops an restaurants) is easy. This is THE place to stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and very high end”
Reviews.Author: gerryjets11
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on a family vacation. The pool area is very nice as well as the breakfast/food areas. The service was very good - including the concierge who was very helpful! The room itself was very high end as well. I would highly recommend this hotel when in Barcelona!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: magicHK
Reviews.Content: We would recommend this hotel without any hesitation. It is especially good for families. If you are going on a cruise, this hotel is near the port, which is very handy. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly, and the rooms are comfortable. Also the mood in the hotel is very cheerful and upbeat. The only down side (very minor) is the design of the bathroom sinks, which aren't very practical. But overall, we love this hotel and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, 5 star hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: njenkins30
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the best of the best!!! Hospitality was A+++++. Right along the beach, next to night clubs, shopping, cultural. Housekeeping was spectacular. Fitness room was nice and private. I recommend this hotel to anyone going to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, a few disappointments”
Reviews.Author: PhilZG
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel with my girlfriend and another couple. We arrived quite late in the evening (past 11pm) on a Friday and stayed till Monday. I had booked one of the hotels 3 night offers where we were to reveive a hotel credit to be spent at the hotel during the stay (about 150 EURs per room per stay), which was confirmed at check in, that this could be spent at the restaurants and bar and would be deducted at check-out. The negatives: Check-in was unbelievably slow, 20mins+ eventhough there were 3 ladies checking us into the 2 rooms. The Spanish cliché of taking their time with things was not applicable since the staff were from all over Europe but not Spain. We had 2 very nice rooms with fantastic views of Barcelona, and the beach, facing south. When entering the room my friends discovered a naked man in their room. To make a long story short, the ladies at check-in had made a mistake with the room and they got another room 2 floor down. Other than an embarrassed lady at check-in who apologised, no apologies about the incident were made. Unusual for this Hotel category. On check-out, we had to ask for the deduction mentioned earlier for the promotion booked, preliminary bill had someone elses dinner and no deduction on it. We then discovered that alcoholic beverages can not be deducted with this offer. So we ended up with most of the credit left over and quite a large bill from the bar. (cocktails are EUR 18). The alcoholic beverage clause being exempt from the offer must have been in the small print I assume I failed to read somewhere when booking, but it was certainly not pointed out to either of us at check-in, which would have been the way to go, and we would have spent the credit on food instead. Almost 300 EUR down the drain. Again, something I wouldn’t expect in a Hotel in this category. WIFI should be free in today’s times! The positives: The Hotel is really nice, great lobby, with very attentive service, great bar. Great food in the restaurants, also with great service, although we didn’t try the Michelin star restaurant (also in the Hotel). The concierge was very helpful. Staff throughout the Hotel were generally very welcoming and friendly. The rooms were very nice, with great views over Barcelona, the beach, ocean etc. They are spacious in a modern style. Beds are very comfortable! Great large gym, and again attentive staff. Housekeeping, was very forthcoming. We had been in the room one evening and turndown service wasn’t done as usual, we came home late and asked for some waters and coffee capsule refill. Housekeeping came immediately to stock us up. Definitely the most service oriented house-keeping I have experienced for a while! Location is great. Off the city center, right at the beach and a nice stroll along the beach away from Barcelonetta. All in all a great stay I would recommend. Shortfalls however were quite upsetting.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not Ritz Carlton standard”
Reviews.Author: L0nd0nBee
Reviews.Content: I am a regular RItz Carlton guest and booked Hotel Arts on this basis. A friend and I stayed for a four day holiday weekend. We had booked club level with a special deal (3 nights for the price of two). Our initial impressions were not great: the check-in at the club reception was rushed to say the least. The club area is on the small side and therefore busy. But things got better when we got to the room which was spacious and nice and well equipped, although it would be nice to have at least one english television channel that is not a news channel. The view from our room (and the club level) was fantastic! After a night out, we went to the club for breakfast which was supposed to be open until 11.30am. We arrived around 11.00am but already at 11.15am we were told they would be closing the buffet so we needed to hurry if we wanted more food - and true to their word, all food was gone by 11.30am. My friend has a gluten-intolerance which we had reported before arrival and reconfirmed upon checking-in but it still took the kitchen 20 -25 mins to get her a piece of bread by which time the buffet had closed. So much for a relaxed breakfast. The early closing of the buffet service seemed to be standard practice. In addition, we often found the club buffets half-empty and we constantly had to ask for plates and cutlery. Admittedly, staff were very friendly and helpful in getting any items you asked for but I would expect a Ritz Carlton hotel to have their logistics under control without guests having to prompt staff. The fact that most staff seemed summer-interns might explain some of their inexperience? When we got back to the room, we turned on the privacy light but that did not stop hotel staff from entering the room without ringing the door bell or knocking on the door! This happened to us twice in the four days we stayed at the hotel. On one of our days, we decided to spend a bit of time at the pool. Thank god my friend got there early because there were only two lounge chairs left... The pool is tiny for the size of the hotel (many guests made the same comment) and clearly not enough space is available around the pool for guests. Also, the water in the pool is cold, and I mean cold, even though it was nice and warm outside. The food served at the pool and in the hotel restaurants is ok but not great and very expensive so I would recommend going out for tapas or a meal rather than eating in the the hotel. There are plenty of places in the city with great food. Despite the above issues, we did enjoy staying at the hotel but only because we managed to get a deal. If we would have had to pay the full Ritz Carlton price, we would have been very upset and angry because we certainly did not get Ritz Carlton service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HoustonJan
Reviews.Content: Breathtaking views of the ocean and the city out the window of our room. Good food, and nice shopping close by.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wykenio
Reviews.Content: This is a a truly beautiful Hotel, right on the sea front and very close to the Port with all its restaurants and shops. The staff are very polite and helpful. The rooms are fantastic with great veiws, we had a corner room which had views over the sea front and the port. Would definitely recomend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: frmrbrit
Reviews.Content: Great location in the Port. Best rooms are on the highest floors with ocean views. They always seem to be sold out so I am never able to get the Platinum Amex upgrade here. Try to get a high floor corner room - those are amazing. Avoid rooms close to the ice machines which are noisy. Best for the young and hip

Reviews.Title: “Saving my position”
Reviews.Author: onetravelagent
Reviews.Content: I and some Japanese clients arrived at the Club Level to check in and were greeted with a tray with refreshing cocktails. We shown our rooms and the Japanese chairman was kindly upgraded to a one bedroom duplex suite. The chairman was horrified with all glass suite that would have been a perfect backdrop for a Hollywood couple as Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie, elegant and modern. He asked to change hotels immediately. The Club concierge was dumbfounded as I was but I understood that from an earthquake proun nation, some Japanese emotionally feel frightened and insecure in an top floor all glass highrise, in a loft like suite with floor to ceiling glass walls and a sweeping staircase to an all glass bedroom. I quietly explained this to the concierge and he and I quickly inspected other rooms and I settled on an ordinary standard room where solid walls predominated and gave the chairman a secure feeling. The concierge was gracious, efficient, and professionally in control thoughout this spiraling disaster to a perfect solution. The Arts Hotel Barcelona has class. The tranquil Club Lounge with great sea views was well stocked at all times of the day, breakfast, lunch, and dinner with great delicacies and food with a wide selection of the best Spanish wines. It was so pleasant a stay that the Japanese chairman wanted to extend his stay. The professionalism of the concierge and staff of this great hotel saved my position.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is Hip and Happening!”
Reviews.Author: kidris
Reviews.Content: The Arts Barcelona is a fantastic hotel. It is hip and fashionable. The location is great! If planning a cruise, the Arts is an excellent place to do a few pre and post nights. Even if you are not cruising, you are walking distance to the pier. lots of happenings there. And the food..OMG.....there is a eating venue to meet every palate! A must if visitng Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Very kind and personal service.”
Reviews.Author: Muss82
Reviews.Content: The Club-rooms are amazing. Loved the room, the bed and excellent housekeeping-service! The breakfast, lunch and lovely sweet snacks in the Club were delicious! Only one thing we didn't liked so much were the movies played on the Club-TV ;-). Maybe a dvd of Planet Earth will do better! Above all, it was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing place with wonderful service and a great location”
Reviews.Author: JansyJJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Arts. Our room was beautiful, the staff incredibly helpful and kind and the concierge desk set up everything we needed. We got a private tour guide set up by the concierge desk and it was wonderful. We would absolutely come back and stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Ladies and Gentlemen serving Ladies and Gentlemen”
Reviews.Author: HollisterRanchGirl
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous! Beautiful hotel, excellent service, spectacular pool, great location. LOVED IT! Avoid the touristy boardwalk and take a taxi into town. The concierges gave us excellent recommendations and there is a hop-on/hop-off bus stop a block away (sooooo touristy, but well worth it if you want to see the sites of Barcelona and get a cheap ride around town). Five Stars!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: BWHJhb
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel, close to beach, great rooms and bathrooms A bit far from shopping area but plenty of taxis Room service exceptionally expensive For price of hotel would have expected free wifi

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 255103Robert
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice the staff are attentive and our butler gave us some good restaurant tips The spanish tapas bar at the hotel was great. I will definitly stay there again The location is on the beach and is only 10 minutes by taxi to downtown Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “TOWIE The Only Way Is Espania! Well, Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: cc16
Reviews.Content: Hotel ARTS is fab for great service and comfort. All the small details such as great pool side service, electric blinds in the rooms, coffee machine, great toiletrie products in super bathrooms, the list is endless. Club Level is fantastic for drinks and snacks, available from early morning till late at night, and the breakfast chef makes great omlettes! My fave destination for a truly relaxing summer holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable yet luxurious accomodation!”
Reviews.Author: gtahir
Reviews.Content: I have never heard of this hotel before, but from the first moment I stepped into the hotel's lobby, I was blown beyond expectation. For about 190 Euros, I had expected a 3 or 4 star hotel, but not Arts Hotel. The staff was extremely patient, helpful and friendly, the hotel's location is also pretty strategic with a great view of the ocean, the hotel feels quite trendy with its art-deco modern style, and there's free wi-fi at the lobby. My room was in the corner of the building, so it was larger than usual with double windows for view. The toiletries were furnished by Acqua di Parma which was great, but for extra soaps they only gave us Neutrogena (??). My two complaints for this hotel are: 1. The body shower (not rainshower) just doesn't work. They shoot off waters from all directions, and on my first night the cold water was not working at all, had to wait till morning for them to come and fix it. This was a common problem encountered by my family who was also staying at the hotel. 2. My family and my rooms were all charged with extra stuff that we didn't purchase/take: umbrellas, mini bar. But after a complaint, they managed to void the charges. So I'd suggest for all visitors to double check their final hotel bills upon checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Very dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: Salvation_10
Reviews.Content: We have spent 2 nights at the Mandarin Oriental and then moved to the Arts. Nothing to compare service cleanleness athmosphere are fantastic at the MO and poor at the Arts as well as the pool is ridiculus for a 400 bedrooms hotel I will never stay at the Arts again

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite Hotel on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: Iam3
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Arts at the end of our cruise and were delighted. The service was outstanding, the views amazing and the rooms were very large - particularly by European standards. The bathroom and shower were heavenly. The exercise facility and spa is the nicest we've ever experienced in any hotel. The hotel is right on the beach and walking distance to many restaurants and night clubs. It is also a two-block walk from the nearest metro station which is very clean and easy to use. The Hotel Arts is a Ritz Carlton hotel and guests can use Marriott points for free rooms and upgrades. Spoil yourself and stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location and geat service but it hits your wallet hard”
Reviews.Author: janer1000London
Reviews.Content: We went to Barcelona for a birthday trip and stayed in the Arts as its in a great location and has always been my favourite in Barcelona. Things haven't changed, except for the price of food, which seems to have gone sky high. We had a very simple burger and salad by the pool on our last day and got no change from eur70.00 (and we didn't have drinks with it) - rip off - definitely ; even if they had fanned me with ostrich feathers while I was eating it and dropped peeled grapes in to my mouth, it wouldn't be worth that much. The pool location is lovely but don't dare to leave your sunbed unattended for more than a brief swim or the staff will swoop in and deposit someone else on your lounger - beds are at a premium! It was great to be able to have a midnight dip, however, without someone saying the pool was closed because it was dark - as long as the pool isn't being cleaned, you can swim, so we did! I would still stay at the Arts again, but would make sure I took a snack with me to the pool, as unless you are Midas, those prices are madness. Rooms were still very nice, although looking a little more tired than my last visit - time for a bit of a makever maybe. Staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful, so all in all a delighful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel with some room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Travelingbiz
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great if you plan to spend time on the beach and the amazing pool. The hotel is nicely designed as are the rooms. Mine had a spacious bathroom. I also loved the partial sea view. However you would expect a bit more care with cleaning. Parts of the room were dusty and there were some hairs in the bathroom which were not from me. The room was cleaned in the morning but there was no turn down service. Service in the hotel can take some time. The luggage took around 30 minutes to arrive in my room and the service in the bar was slow. There were often longer waiting times for the reception and concierge but people were very friendly once you got a chance to speak with them. I loved the pool area with the lovely towels and snacks provided (sometimes you have to ask for your basket with water and apples). However on the weekends the pool area was too busy for my liking. There were some major events in the hotel with the occasional loud music during the day and night. Prices in the hotel are high for everything. There is a rather hefty charge for using the internet. In the room itself you can purchase a range of products including CDs. Apparently they also charge for using the Nespresso machine in the room. I have not tried it but the minibar menu listed Nespresso coffee as an item. It might be nicer to include some of those extras in the room price. Overall, a pleasant hotel with some room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good but maybe not the Ritz Carlton standard that I am used to.”
Reviews.Author: PMok
Reviews.Content: The staff were very pleasant. A few bad experiences: luggage took really long to arrive at the room, at least half an hour. The food at the marina restaurant is simply awful. We sat at the lobby bar and no one came to serve us for 15 mins. I had to go up to someone to order our drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Service has gone down hill, not worth it”
Reviews.Author: marti074
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 7/2-7/5/2011. Service was poor, not up to Ritz Carlton standards. Food just o.k., took 20 minutes to get a cup of coffee at the cafe. Rooms need updating. If you stay there on Marriot points beware, they will not take care of you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - Even better staff!”
Reviews.Author: justme2Georgia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Arts the day before leaving on our cruise and the day we returned. Both stays were lovely. They remembered it was our anniversary on the second stay and brought dessert and drinks to our room. We had a lovely view both times overlooking the Mediterranean and the city. The staff was extremely helpful showing us places to visit. Would return here if back in Barcelona, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and great location”
Reviews.Author: MCTaysom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved everything about the Hotel Arts Barcelona. The room was clean and contemporary in style. Every evening the room was set to a relaxing mood with music and lighting. The spa was lovely and the women there were very accommodating and friendly. The floral arrangements in the lobby were something I will never forget. Beauty everywhere you looked at this hotel. We found the service to be friendly, but we never experienced any problems that needed to be remedied.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline1971
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at around 930am and check-in wasn't supposed to be until 300pm. We had reserved 2 club level rooms so they quickly escorted us up to the club lounge so we could relax and have something to drink and eat while we were checking in! Since we were a family with 4 children ages 3-11, we needed our rooms very close together or adjoining! They said they would not have any available so they would like to upgrade us to an apartment at no extra charge! This apartment was truly amazing and much bigger than a regular hotel room! I can't stress enough how nice it was to be able to go to the club lounge for drinks (alcoholic and non-alcoholic) and food whenever we wanted! Even with the increased cost of a club room I'm sure this saved us a large amount of money because with having 4 kids who are always wanting soft drinks and snacks we would have been spending a lot more! Most clubs I've experienced in the past have only been open a few hours here and there! Their club lounge was open at 630am until 11pm every day and always had food and drinks available!! The service of everyone at the hotel was perfect! The 1 tour that they scheduled for us to Montserrat was exceptional. They conveniently allowed us to charge it to our room and they took care of paying him! It was an amazing tour that I'm so glad we experienced it! We were considering canceling it but thank God we didn't because we would have missed out on something big!!! Overall, I can't say enough about this hotel! It's basically right on the beach which is an added bonus! It didn't seem like there were that many hotels with such great beach access! This is not a cheap hotel so be prepared to spend some money! You truly get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “stunning view and amazing rooms”
Reviews.Author: bicocchinaonesta
Reviews.Content: We've been at Arts Hotel and it was an amazing experience. Hotel Staff was really kindness and our room (Executive Suite) was really gorgeous (see pics). We loved the luxury and the interior design of this Hotel and we've had the possibility to visit also the "mega-suites" on the top of the building and they were spectacular. For sure, this is our best and preferred hotel in Barcelona. The price of the room are really expensive but they offer a really high-standard kind of service. Real luxury is never cheap. Enjoy Arts and stay tuned!

Reviews.Title: “'The' place to stay in Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: Barcelonatrippers
Reviews.Content: Fantastic. We booked a room on the executive level as a treat for a 50th Birthday celebration, it was worth paying the extra as it gave us access to the executive lounge. Wow. The food and drinks, champagne as much as you want, flows all day. Delicious breakfast, tapas, snacks, desserts etc. all beautifully presented, the staff cannot do enough to help. Lovely room, luxurious bathroom, as you'd expect from a 5 star hotel, with fab. views of the sea and the city. Only a short taxi ride to the centre or a half hour walk. Would go back tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff - 4.5 star property”
Reviews.Author: eton1970
Reviews.Content: Lovely staff that was a pleasure. Concierge was very helpful, recommendations for restaurants excellent. The room are very nice, slightly tired in some cases but still fine. Location is good if you like the beach area. Some odd points were the elevators that had deep scratches in the doors, strange for a Ritz. Overall, a good property with particularly nice gym and roof top. Staff shines through.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: MWestNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Arts for 5 nights it was Wonderful! Staff was so friendly and helpful. I travel often for business and pleasure and this trip.... I experienced the best ever concierge, Carlos he made our trip very enjoyable. His English is perfect, his knowledge of Barcelona and his personality is outstanding. The Hotel is in a perfect location. Close to almost everything. Rooms are very large and the views of the beach and city are awesome. This is the Place to stay if you want a perfect hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorite hotels”
Reviews.Author: Ryguy22x
Reviews.Content: Wow. Beautiful hotel. We only stayed there one night but the staff was exceptional and they upgraded us to a beautiful huge room. Like I said we only stayed there one night, but would have stayed the week if we had the opportunity. There are many restaurants around the hotel and it is about a 5 minute taxi ride to the marina and La Rambla. Having stayed at the Mandarin Oriental last year it is a tough decision to say which is nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel on the Mediterranean”
Reviews.Author: BostonJoy
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Arts for a business meeting, and found it to be incredibly comfortable. My room on a high floor had a breathtaking view of the city and the sea. During breaks, the location was very nice for taking a quick stroll along the beach. It is walkable to old town, and wandering the neighborhoods between the waterfront and the old town was very nice. You will stumble upon random street art and beautiful parks. The food at this hotel was surprisingly bad, but that may have been the selections of the meeting planners.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service....well trained and ultra friendly and helpful!”
Reviews.Author: TBSmall
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located on the waterfront, a very busy and active area. You need to take a taxi to visit museums and gaudi sites. Staff is very friendly, however concierge service gave misinformation regarding times that museums were open - they need to be up on this information- since many sites are closed or have shorter hours on Sundays and Mondays. Hotel staff is constantly asking 'what can they help you with' and there are 'over staffed' with well trained employees offering service (a GOOD thing).

Reviews.Title: “Big, comfortable, expensive but forgettable”
Reviews.Author: ifp43
Reviews.Content: Arts is fairly typical example of all large, modern hotels. Very comfortable, fine amenities, well situated, but will you remember it two months down the road? Probably not. What I will remember is a member of staff whose job was apparently just to offer a glass of water to those guests checking in. A nice touch, I suppose, but maybe a dispensable cost. The restaurant was disappointing - and empty. Nice spa and pool. I think they charge for internet but can't remember, like I can't remember how our room was....but I do remember how our bill was big!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning view of Sea, Great Hotel, Average Location”
Reviews.Author: FloridaJayBird
Reviews.Content: The staff here is really great. I had absolutely no complaints about the hotel - great breakfast in the morning, my room was always spotless. It was a little annoying that I needed a cab to get into most of the city sections I was interested in. But in contrast, its right on the water. I can say this, If you are interested in staying here or the W - forget it - this is much better. But I think there are some better, more Barcelona-centered options. Still, very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz Hotel Arts - classy and splendid hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bari_74
Reviews.Content: Hotel Arts a classy, elegant hotel with great views of the sea! The hotel is spectacular, clean, service is superb. The front desk staff is friendly and welcoming. They are very attentive to your needs and provided tips or cool places to visit or eat. The room itself was what you would see in a magazine and the shower MAMMA MIA!! A rain shower with the jets, not to mention the bathroom was marble and HUGE for Europe. We were extremely pleased with this hotel and would not hesitate to stay there again when we visit Barcelona in the future. Great job to everyone at this gem of a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fell short of expectations.”
Reviews.Author: HappiestTraveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel is without a doubt in a great location and the views are spectacular but otherwise it fell short of expectations. Staff were friendly but did not live up to the 5 star level. The elevator system was endlessly frustrating, and it took 15 minutes of waiting to get an elevator down to reception during checkout period. Drinks and food were very expensive, as were the room services (7 Euros for a bottle of water and 25 Euros an hour for internet). Rooms were finished in a modern manner but did not stand out from other 5 star hotels. It was clean, functional and conveniently located but otherwise was just another hotel room to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but some sort of disapointment”
Reviews.Author: Sinaloa237
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel Arts in Barcelona for a week-end with my wife and 8-year old son. I know Barcelona quite well and was not surprised by the location of the hotel which I find great: slightly out of the very center but still close to everything, be it by metro, bus or taxi. The service is very nice, everybody is smiling and helpful. Still it lacks a bit of professionalism: concierge is nice but did not appear to me as a real insider, giving practical still not original advice; servcei coming twice to the room for the same issue, etc. Overall, we also found the hotel slightly run down and seems to me way too expensive for what it is (I was on Ritz-Carlton points but it does not change the picture). Many pieces of furniture in the room are broken or damaged (e.g. desk), bathroom is nice but the flush was not working well, etc. Nice week-end indeed but not good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: frogprince
Reviews.Content: We stayed several nights on the club floor. Service was incredible, our room was lovely and we had absolutely no complaints. Food was good and in some cases remarkable.

Reviews.Title: “WOW.”
Reviews.Author: RichHol
Reviews.Content: Stunning. Clean. Helpful & polite staff. Incredible food. Just ...WOW.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: travelswithboy
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a lovely visit from this hotel. The staff was delightful, food was great, location was great, pool was lovely. My only warning is to go ahead and buy wine by the bottle as they pour 5 or 6 glasses from each bottle if you buy it that way and a glass of wine could easily be $20. They were extremely helpful and family friendly, our lack of language skills was no problem. There were 10 or so kids staying at the same time and all of them buddied up and played soccer on the lawn every afternoon and evening before dinner. It was extremely pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel i stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Vacaiiition
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the "Executive Suites" for 3 nights when in Barcelona. Great ocean view, 2 Bang & Olufsen TV´s, two large bathrooms. Everything in great condition. Service was as good as it gets and the location is perfect. Bed was large and comfortable, separate living room and designer furniture all through the suite.

Reviews.Title: “The people were the difference”
Reviews.Author: Claus_Hj
