Reviews.Content: Hotel Arts provides the basics flawlessly - as they should given the 5 stars. So the room was large, clean and well maintained, the breakfast was excellent with a good selection of produce and made to order pancakes. However for me the stars were the staff who were invariably smiling, helpful and friendly which just made my stay one of the best in a few years.

Reviews.Title: “I was quite disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Eviik
Reviews.Content: Well, I was in this hotel back in dec/2007, however I still feel to write this review. This hotel is very nice, has nice rooms and equipment, however this is quite expected from 5 star hotel. I was here in business trip for several days. Upon arrival receptionist behaved very strictly, I´ve seen some distance, approach was not very familiar and this made me feel kind of "homesick". Moreover, I was asked to provide a deposit. I was previously in other 5 star hotels, but I have never experienced this. I thought, that deposit is the thing of low star establishments. My stay was sponsored by the company, so I did not have seen the point. The whole impress from the hotel was significantly lowered by terrible service. My impression is, that unless I am a star or well known businessman, I am not that welcomed. To be honest, I was previously in BCN in another hotel, where service was extremely friendly, was always helpful and I felt like at home and welcomed. I would never choose Hotel Arts again unless, I am invited there by company or generally for business.

Reviews.Title: “not up to the ritz carltons usual standards”
Reviews.Author: bus1234
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights on business and was surprised about the general tiredness of the hotel.The rooms have incredible views but my room 17th floor was very noisy from street traffic at night and also was quite shabby in places.Housekeeping left a lot to be desired! I ate in three restaurants Aurola which was very good,The marina,poor and the light bites which charged 26 euros for a caeser salad and 8 euros for a very small side of fries!!After complaining about this the staff did take it off the bill but why does a 5 star hotel have to penny pinch like this?The fitness changing rooms were filthy,the sauna was out of order and the steam room was dirty.Overall a dissapointing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, gorgeous room and great location”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter087
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Arts for a long weekend and were incredibly impressed by the speed and friendliness of the service all the way from check- in to check-out. Upon arrival we were given a gorgeous room on the 25th floor with amazing views. The concierge was helpful and gave us great reccomendations on where to eat. A perfect stay and we'll definitely be back. (Look out for the beautiful flowers all over the hotel- all ladies will approve.)

Reviews.Title: “Stunning”
Reviews.Author: uga_travel
Reviews.Content: The most impressive hotel I've ever stayed in. Was here for 4 nights in Jan. Was here for work and fun.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: jack552
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the hotel Arts in Barcelona and we loved every second. The decoration of the rooms and the lobby is very contemporary and modern , which is not our style, but when it comes to Barcelona it suits the atmposhere of the city. The spa of the hotel is the best we have ever visited. Located on the top floor, with a breathteaking view of the whole city!!! We are  definitely going back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: SPBLondon
Reviews.Content: embarrassingly, the hotel checked myself and colleague onto the same floor, only for us to discover my room was twice the size of hers (I couldn't complain). Lush room, huge bed and luxury bathroom, fantastic views over the city. room service breakfast very average. dinner at a beachfront restaurant nearby lovely, and perfectly positioned for the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location....”
Reviews.Author: PBTrav
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a recent business conference....excellent hotel and staff. Great breakfast buffet....high priced, so only ate there once though! Walked to cafes on other days for breakfast.... Great beach location and easy walk to heart of Barcelona....or access to public transport if desired. Downsides: Minibar items highly priced....25 euros a day for Internet, traffic noise and sirens as hospital close by.....

Reviews.Title: “Could be a lot better.....”
Reviews.Author: FranciscaR
Reviews.Content: For a terribly expensive hotel I really think that it could be better. On arrival we were welcome by a lot of very young people, it all felt more like the hotel was full of apprentices. Then the just as young reception personel bombarded us with all kinds of personal questions, like school kids on a day out. They meant it well but it felt a bit much and not very professional. I think that they had just taken on a lot of new personel as I saw some being guided around the hotel. The room was very nice but, although we asked for a quiet room it was opposite a hospital where the ambulances go in and out day and night making a lot of noise and also on a very busy road (easily heard although we were on the 17th floor). We got another room on the 20th floor but it only helped with the noise from the road, we could still hear the syrens. Great breakfast and lots of personel to serve it, we felt really spoilt. We chose this hotel because of the sauna but.... you have to pay 40Euros a person so we didn't go. It seems that there are separate saunas for men and women in some dressing rooms but that is not our idea of fun. So.... we ended up paying a lot of money for a hotel not getting what we were after. A piece of advice... you don't need to eat in the hotel as there are hundreds of restaurants in the area and you can even walk to down town Barcelona. A minor remark, why do double rooms often only have the light switches on one side? One of the person has control of the lights but if that person is already asleep the other one has to get up and go to the other side of the bed to switch lights on and off. Strange...... also, why does this hotel only have the facility to make coffee in the room, not tea? I am sure that a lot of people don't drink coffee but would very much appreciate a cup of tea!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Arts in Barcelona is the definition of a 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thewiseking
Reviews.Content: We arrived tired and bewildered and were cheerfully greeted and whisked to our room, a spectacular, huge suite with views over the entire city and the sea. We were thrilled to head downstairs to the most sumptuous, incredible included breakfast served in a lovely sunny courtyard flanked by gardens and post modern sculpture. The location was not central but to us was better because it was away from the noise and right on the beach which made morning or evening strolls either to Pt Olimpic or Barceloneta a breeze. The service was amazing right across the board, especially in the restaurant and at the concierge desk. Our stay here was the highlight of our 2 week trip to Spain.

Reviews.Title: “It's what you'd expect from the Ritz...Excellent”
Reviews.Author: mtuts007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Arts on the 22nd floor with views of both the Mediterranean and the city. The hotel staff was top notch, best service I've experienced at any hotel. The food was rather pricey, but you do have plenty of options within walking distance. The beach is very close, but can get very, very crowded in the afternoon. If you are on a lower level, be prepared to hear street sounds or club music until very late at night. Because we were up high enough, this was not an issue for us. Overall, excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The most fabulous hotel experience I have ever had”
Reviews.Author: SarahSLS
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weekend at Hotel Arts. It was my husband's 50th birthday and I spent hours on the internet searching for a super hotel. I booked Hotel Arts mainly because of some good reviews on here. From the moment we arrived we knew that we had made a good choice. The welcome we received from everyone was just brilliant. We booked a club room which I don't think is very well described on the website. It was wonderful. What a view from the 33rd floor and to have such friendly help from the staff was incredible. Lovely food and great drink. The weather was awful on the Saturday and the staff were so helpful with recommendations of places to go. Nothing was too much trouble. They made our stay so special. Some reports have said that the hotel is too far from the centre of Barcelona. Of course it isn't in the centre because it is by the sea. However, there are plenty of taxis outside the door and the tour bus stops seconds away. I shall try and keep this write-up brief but basically the hotel was superb. The staff were superb and the food and drink were amazing. I have stayed in many, many top hotels but this one by far out ranks anywhere I have ever stayed. The staff in the club lounge were just lovely. Julien, Desiree and Jennifer made our stay just perfect and I hope they read this report. We were very sad when it was time to leave and cannot wait to stay again. Location, room, food, drink, staff were all just fabulous. Stay here and book a Club and you will see what I mean.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - a 'proper 5 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NewickChap
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a couple of times - most recently last week. It really is what a luxury hotel should be like - smart, great staff, state-of-the-art technology in the rooms, and lots of space. Only slightly odd thing is the location of the lobby on the first floor - a bit claustrophobic in my view, but I guess this retains the privacy and exclusivity of the place, which is half the attraction. Champagne bar scarily pricey too! Would always choose to stay here when visiting Barcelona (as long as someone else was paying!)

Reviews.Title: “So comfortable that I visited twice...”
Reviews.Author: katwoman01
Reviews.Content: I had booked the Hotel Arts for two nights before getting on a cruise from Barcelona and I liked it so much that I booked another night on the way back. It is absolutely perfect and the service is amazing. The rooms have incredible views of the beach and the city, depending on which way your room is facing. The beds are super comfortable, so much that my teenager son did not want to get out of bed to go sightseeing. I cannot comment on the food as we did not eat here but the property is immaculate, the rooms are spacious and comfortable and the staff go out of their way to make sure you have everything you need. I hope to return again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Superb in every way”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkers4
Reviews.Content: We are discriminating travelers who recently stayed at the Hotel Arts and can say this is one of the finest hotels in the world and the perfect place to stay in Barcelona. The Hotel is elegant and stylish, perfectly maintained,with superb service and restaurants. The staff are extremely professional and warm, clearly happy, and do not miss an opportunity to ensure an extraordinary stay. The Arola Restaurant is excellent and earns its reputation as a lively,lovely, and excellent restaurant. Special mention must be made of the Concierge staff who strive to please and of Hector Busto and his staff for providing top level service without hesitation. Our family included teenagers and though elegant the Hotel Arts is welcoming to all ages Love the location by the beach and promenade and an easy walk to the metro. Hotel Arts definitely deserves its reputation as one of the world's top hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Views, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: A20NEV
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Barcelona for a City weekend break, there are 6 in our family so we had two rooms both of which were of a very high standard with outstanding views over the marina and Barcelona coast. The staff were quite exceptional and could not do enough for us. Our teenage children enjoyed the nearby night life and there are ample local restaurants of varying standards from MacDonald's up over many of the good nearby eating houses were on the lower promenade level on the edges of the beach just to the front of the hotel. My only disappointment was that the snacks and treats in the room mini bar were very exceptional with no clear price list ( that we could find) for example a tub of Smarties 11.00 Euro, small packet of chocolate biscuits 10.00 Euro which came as a bit of a shock at check out, however all that can be forgiven for a super hotel and a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service, great bar”
Reviews.Author: Ganfina
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel if you are after some luxury in Barcelona. The staff is extremely professional, always smiling and friendly. I've got some excellent suggestions for dinners and was assisted with the bookings. As far as accommodation, you will not be disappointed - it's has the space, the view, the discrete house keeping, and small touches that make you feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “The Arts is not what it was.”
Reviews.Author: RoadwarriorLynne
Reviews.Content: I used to love this hotel but it is getting very tired with worn and stained carpets, some very saggy mattresses and generally fading luxury. Even the halls looked scuffed and tired. While the staff continue to be very friendly, service levels have detriorated and there are glaring inconsistencies. The Six Sense Spa continues to be excellent.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: FoodloverLondon
Reviews.Content: The arts is one of the friendliest hotels ive ever stayed in. From the moment we arrived the staff couldn't have been more welcoming and helpful. From the 28th floor our room had an amazing view the Marina and beach. The decor is modern without being uber trendy and intimidating, the public areas all had stunning plants and flowers and smelt wonderful and felt relaxing. We only ate one meal in the cafe so can't really comment on the food, but I will definitely stay here next time I'm in Barcelona. Compared to the w which is the only other beachfront hotel in the area the arts is more intimate and welcoming whilst retaining an air of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Sublime best describes this wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeverleyH-Smith
Reviews.Content: Enter the world of the Hotel Arts and you'll experience what a 'proper' hotel feels like- The staff are superb,and you get the feeling they really want to be there looking after you..Bar service,restaurant service,al fresco,each bring there own unique style to you-but in wonderful convivial surroundings-

Reviews.Title: “Delightful surprise: The best of 2 words!!”
Reviews.Author: MV2009
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Barcelona by chance (our flight was London-bound but had to land in spain due to the snow storms in the UK), and had all our travel plans altered. I have enhoyed staying in other Ritz-carlton hotels before, but the Arts is truly the best of two worlds: classic, chic, luxurious and with a fantastic service typical of a Ritz-Carlton + a young and friendly atmosphere and staff. The location is fantastic and our room (a 1 bedroom apartment) was great, beautifully and tastefully furnished, modern yet cozy. The view is amazing, and the hotel offers great options for lunch/dinner. The Bites is great anytime of the day/night for a nice meal or snack. The other options include 2 michelin-awarded restaurants, one more formal and another (Arola) great for tapas and the terrace. I can't wait to go back in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Sheer class and elegance!!”
Reviews.Author: coxjon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice in 2010 and stayed in both one of the duel floor apartments and also a suite both of which were fantastic!! The service I received was personal and 1st class with my every need attended to. When staying in the apartment I had a complimentary massage, which was great, as well as access to one of the hotel mini coopers, which unfortunately I didn't have time to utilise. Both times I had views over the ocean and woke up to beautiful sunrises. While using the conference facilities on the top floor again we had great sercvice and matching standards of food! I would strongly recommend this hotel to every type of travellers it is pure heaven!!

Reviews.Title: “Inspiring”
Reviews.Author: tgancayco
Reviews.Content: Save for the not so grand lobby / reception area, the Hotel Arts in Barcelona is a complete pleasure to be in. Sleek and modern, our corner suite had fantastic views of the city and the sea. Beautiful sunrises, a nice bottle of champagne and the most attentive service! The buffet breakfast is a must, I could not stay away from the jamon carving table for long and certainly enjoyed the freshly squeezed orange juice out on the terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel - probably not really for families”
Reviews.Author: hayesfamilywexford
Reviews.Content: this hotel was amazing. The decor is amazing. The rooms are fabulous with massive beds, city or beach views with marble bathrooms. Service in the hotel is first class, as you would expect from a 5 star. Besides breakfast I didn't eat here, but the breakfast buffet is the best i've ever had. Drinks in this hotel are really really expensive. The whole place is pure luxury, but I don't think I would be bringing my children there. It's definitely an adult treat destination. It's right by the beach, the marina, and lots of lovely restaurants. I know it's expensive but if for a treat I would highly recommend it. If you are a business person trying to impress a client, it's perfect! Worked for me.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff, great suite, but interesting lighting!”
Reviews.Author: KansasCityBrian
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night only; can't wait to go back. We reserved a room but upon arrival asked about possibility of a suite; were offered a great suite at a good price with beautiful views of the sea; complimetary wine sent up to the suite (and this was AFTER complimentary cava while registering!) Suite was spacious, stylish, comfortable. Staff was super-friendly and accomodating. Great recommendations for dinner (fantastic paella available nearby). Only one strange thing: Unless we just couldn't figure it out, the only way we found to turn on the light in the shower was from 20 feet away, outside the entire bathroom, using the master light switch in the suite's hallway!! Maybe there was another way, but we never figured it out. That said, this is clearly a world class hotel that provides great service. We will defiintely stay here again on our next trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Mediocre Food and Mattress”
Reviews.Author: ancPR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Arts Barcelona for 3 nights after a cruise. The hotel is lovely and the service is superb. However, although the rooms are huge, the bed and pillows are very uncomfortable. It is not the type of mattress and pillows we have experienced at other Ritz Carlton properties (this is a RC property). In addition, the room service food was pretty mediocre - bland food.

Reviews.Title: “Modern elegance with a view”
Reviews.Author: PittDoc
Reviews.Content: Ended a seven day Mediterranean cruise with one night at Hotel Arts in Barcelona. Upscale hotel with a crowd and view to match. Tasteful modern decor, models and Russian mogul types in the lobby (big futbol game that weekend). Even our basic room had a phenomenal view of both the city and Mediterranean with spacious living area and bathroom even by US standards. This is owned and managed by Ritz Carlton but is far nicer than any of the dozen or so Ritz's I've stayed in domestically. Thankfully the decor was more modern art-inspired than your standard Ritz formula and fitting for a city like Barcelona. Booked through a travel agent for a very reasonable price that included continental breakfast and 60 Euro cash voucher. While food and drink is expensive the quality is top-notch. Five-star amenities in every respect. Service was 6-star! They patiently accommodated every request and tolerated my rather demanding extended family much better than I did (after 8 days together). Brunch was amazing and will try the restaurant when we return (without kids). It is walking distance from good and less expensive restaurants, close enough to some of the sites to walk, but definitely not in middle of the action. Located in a revitalized part of the waterfront and one of the very few high-rise buildings in the city. TIP: We hired a car service to take family from cruise ship port to hotel. This was expensive and unnecessary. Hotel is very close and many taxis of all sizes are available on arrival. One could almost walk.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: William60713
Reviews.Content: One of the best luxury hotels we've stayed in. The staff made every effort to make our stay a five star experience. What impressed us the most were the accommodations. The rooms and bathrooms were luxurious and tastefully designed. Furthermore, they were well maintained and exceptionally clean. A must if you're planning a trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection.”
Reviews.Author: camillaking
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel every year for quite some time now, and whilst it changed slightly when taken over by "Ritz Carlton" - the standard has never, ever slipped. I usually stay in a sea-front suite, which has a particularly spacious bedroom, separated from a beautiful, unique bathroom, a modern and comfortable lounge, which also has its separate washroom. The penthouse apartments are beautiful, but not necessary unless you have enough guests to fill them, as they are extremely big. The pool area is one of my favourite in Europe. The outside restaurant serves delicious fresh food, and the staff are impeccable. If you would like to experience Spanish tapas with a modern twist, I urge you to dine at Arolas. This hotel covers all the bases; whether it's a long weekend city-break or a two week summer holiday, this hotel is perfect. The only thing I wouldn't advise, is bringing your children. It is not that the hotel doesn't cater for them, but it's just not the place for young children.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular hotel but has its faults”
Reviews.Author: JasonWG
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here quite a few times now and it is my preferred hotel in Barcelona. It makes the perfect quick week end from London - grab a flight from City and you can be in Barcelona in time for dinner and the nightlife along the beach at the Arts. Then lounge by the pool at the hotel and get 2 full days before returning to London. We tend to do this often. The Arts is expensive and now with the W Hotel perhaps some competition will keep them in line. The pool is pretty small and often has waiting lines for chairs. The W hotel has a massive amount of direct beach and pool chairs so I will try this next time. Arts service is spotty. Sometimes my room has been left uncleaned and people can forget orders/requests given how busy it is. But they make this up given their responses to anyhting that has gone wrong. Being part of the Ritz chain, they certainly take customer service seriously. The concierge is excellent - fabulous suggestions and very helpful. If you want to stay at the beach and like good nightlife and then head into Barcelona for sight seeing every once and a while - then this is a fabulous choice. Take note that the spa is outrageously expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Made our Anniversary Special”
Reviews.Author: onionryder
Reviews.Content: We had several nights in Barcelona prior to booking a cruise from there and elected to stay at the Hotel Arts using Marriott points. We arrived on Nov 10 which also happened to be our 37th wedding anniversary. At check in the staff not only acknowledged our anniversary, which I had only mentioned to the Marriott booking agent, but gave us an upgrade to a suite which was absolutely beautiful! The room was enormous and they even asked if we would prefer a city or sea view. At lunch we were treated to a complimentary glass of Cava and the concierge booked us with a tour guide for the afternoon who was fabulous. That evening we asked for something special for dinner to celebrate our anniversary and reservations were made at Con Gracia, which was another hit with terrific food and wine! Thank you to Aurelien Saint-Gal, at the front desk, for making this a very special stay for us. This is a lovely hotel, in a great location.....in good weather it's an easy walk to most things, and the room was super!

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: ILT186338
Reviews.Content: * Location: next to the beach, quite touristy area * Metro station (Ciutadella Vila Olimpica): 5-10 min. walk * Room: quiet and spacious, nice design * Bed: great, good quality and very comfortable - WiFi: quite expensive (twenty something EUR per day - if I remember it correctly) - Mini bar: very expensive - No tea making facilities - Coffee should be a courtesy instead of asking for 4EUR per Nespresso cup - Concierge: not helpful at all. I have asked for a small, traditional tapas bar. The answer was: "There are no traditional ones. They are all touristy but even locals go there." Instead of knowing some nice, individual places all she could do was circling Restaurants on a map which had obviously been sponsered by these Restaurants. - When we arrived a light bulb in the bathroom was broken. A sealing strip at the shower door was loose. The bulb had been replaced after I had informed them but the strip was still loose. - I was surprised that there was no evening service/making up the room for the night and had asked the Concierge. He told me that I need to ask for it... - Shoe shine service as a courtesy but bag was so small that just one pair of shoes could fit in which is - considering that we had booked a double room - a bit strange. - Missing value for quite a lot of money (room rate incl. taxes was more than 300 EUR per night).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, but pricey for what it is!”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Carlos
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt that the Hotel Arts in Barcelona is one of the better hotels in the city. It’s situated right on the marina front with a good selection of bars and restaurants near by, so location wise its perfect as you get to have that beach feeling with the city right on your doorstep too. The entrance is a little strange with the need to go up one floor via an elevator to actually get to reception. Once you’re in though the hotel is very plush with some lovely modern features, the pool is set high up looking down on the front and the terrace for lunch and dinner is fantastic too. The rooms are huge with very comfortable beds and a lovely bathroom. I really can’t fault this hotel at all, the only thing I did feel is that at nearly £300 a night it was good but not that good. I have stayed in hotels of equal standard if not better for nowhere near the kind of money this hotel charges.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL EVER!”
Reviews.Author: milcent
Reviews.Content: My family and I had travled through out moast of the world and stayed in very different hotels. Some bad, some horrible, some good but, this one was EXELENT! When we first got there, we were attended by the supportive and great staff members. The rooms were big, clean nd had everything we needed and much more! Me and my husband had a room with view to the ocean and I could say that if you can afford to pay more for the view, you should. We whent down stairs to the restaurant and the food was very good. It was high quality, tasty, and the plate was set up beautifully. The concierge was exelent, helpful and supportive. If we come back to Barcelona we will definitely stay in this hotel one again. Stay on the Art Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: fxybrzln
Reviews.Content: Wow...awesome hotel. Great decor, employees were very attentive and serviceable. Amazing spa services, probably one of the best I've ever had. Our room was a suite which contained a sleeping area separate from the two bathrooms and a living room. We had a front and a side view of the ocean. I'm still in love with the way the room was decorated. Service was amazing, within walking distance to beach, a few shops, restaurants, metro... Definitely recommend this one. Only one drawback, it was a little far by Barcelona standards from the main streets like Paseo de Gracia and Rambla Catalunya.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vestfoldgirl
Reviews.Content: Big room with a comfortable king size bed, and partial ocean view. Very clean and modern. Nice to be able to control both the window blinds and the lightening in the room by a panel next to the bed. Slept sooo good. The bathroom was excellent. Toilet in one seperate room, and also a separet shower room. Bath tub and double sinks, very spacious room! Nice products from L'Occitane, and large soft towels. Minibar items was VERY expensive, and as also others has mention, 4 euros for a nespresso coffee in the room, that is a rip off. The breakfast was wonderful, nice selction of hot and colds,and the freshly squeesed orange juice was to die for!! A lot of people working in the hotel, so their able to attend to you without any waiting. Nice outdoor seating area, the weather was warm enough to enjoy lunch outside. The location of the hotel is not that great if you are a tourist and want to be more in the centre of the city. The "hop-on, hop-off" tourist bus does stop quite close to the hotel, however. If you want to go to Las Ramblas it' s a bit of a walk, but taxi was only around 6 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but no up to their prices...!”
Reviews.Author: Lulu761121
Reviews.Content: Hotel s pretty nice and beautiful i love the fresh orchids they have every day... Staff is o.k. Prices are to much for what they have to offer Pool is way to small and limited for all the guesses the aloud on the hotel How came u have to be on a waiting list to get a chair by the pool? coffee and assorted cheeses at ur room 50 Euros really...? give me a break... Showers are phenomenal...! I dont mind the prices when you get what u r paying for...but they need to be more up to their 5 stars status...

Reviews.Title: “Arts still is t h e choice in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: dkdklmpsz
Reviews.Content: Probably the most reputable hotel in Barcelona, Arts Hotel's major plus is the great location at Port Olimpic beach. The hotel itself comes in great luxury with a decent chic. Guest rooms of some 40 sqm really give you a lot of space. As I attended a conference in the hotel, I could make use of a very interesting group rate which made the stay affordable. All extra items like wi-fi internet, spa use, drinks in the room were quite expensive, on the other hand. Still, the overall impression was really great.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: JBRubin
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel with a gorgeous view. Totally incapable of service. Started with lost luggage, lied to by bellman who stated it was put in the room. Never was shown the room, merely given a key, (EXECUTIVE SUITE) no one showed up to inform us of the amenities or to aquaint us as to how best to use the facilities, or to ask if we liked the room. No tissue for 3 days, food left in room until moldy. I found out after coming home that I was supposed to get a euro credit for food and or wine which we were never offered. Upon checking out, I was advised that there was a charge for the limo from the airport. Of course, after I mentioned that we came by train and then taxi, they advised me that I would not be charged for the limo. Bad expierence!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic..but..”
Reviews.Author: Namblearc
Reviews.Content: Great service ,Great room, Great views. Expensive(but what do you expect from a 5star?) My main complaint is regarding the swimming pool. Beautiful gardens and nice pool but freezing!! I was ther with husband for 6 days.Part of our holiday is being able to swim.I know it was end of October but sun was shining 17/20 degrees.There was several people trying to swim without success. For a luxury hotel with all the money put into it how difficult is it to heat the swimming pool?

Reviews.Title: “Don't use the mini bar or buy a drink!”
Reviews.Author: BodgerDogSproxton
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel - but wow the prices! The room rate for our conference was pretty good for a Ritz Carlton Hotel at €210 for a double room including breakfast (which was very good). But the extras .......... €4 if you wanted to make yourself a very small coffee in the room - or €9 plus tax and another €6 for room service tea, coffee etc.We discovered you coudl use the espresso machine as a ketle and bought tea bags. A sandwich was around €25 plus tax and delivery - taking it to over €30. A scotch and soda plus 2 beers in the bar came to almost €40 euros. Internet in room was €25 a day - but you could log on for free in the lobby wifi and take your lap top back to the room - the repeat the process every hour. Car park - €35 a day. I travel a lot around the world and it's the most expensive I've ever seen for extras - if you exclude €12 euro for a small packet of rice crackers in Paris! I think for teh higher end hotels it woudl be good to at least have tea and coffee facility in the room included plus free wifi as you get in the States and often in China and India. Also on check in we were given the keys to an occupied room and surprised a gust in the shower - who was ten not at all pleased to have our luggage delivered to her 20 minutes later. The conference group meals were OK - but could have been better for a 5* hotel. It was a good location for the beach and marina - but needed a taxi if you wanted to go into town. Pool small and cold but well maintained and comfy chairs. Conference facilities were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service, swish surroundings, a pleasure to stay here”
Reviews.Author: RedFred1000
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, it was clear the service here is something special. Universally charming attention for adults and young children alike. Great outdoor pool with excellent outdoor restaurant attached, cool crowd at dinner time, and excellent breakfast choice. Depending on how high your room is, superb views over city and sea - and v close to the beach. Dare one quibble? Well, the jets in the outdoor jacuzzi weren't working, the minibar prices are ridiculous, there was no battery in the bathroom scales, and the waiter who persisted in sneezing into his left hand really should have asked his boss for a hanky. But these are trifles; this is a great hotel and well worth considering for a luxury break.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: TinaBK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Arts for 3 days and I can assure you it was one of the best hotels we visited. While checking in, we asked if we can have a room with sea view and we have been offered a free upgrade to an exective suite with an amazing view. The room was very big and beautifully decorated. Wherever you walk in the hotel you see people smiling at you and offering you help. Everything about this hotel was welcoming. I would have stayed much longer if the prices were a little cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Ncll01
Reviews.Content: * Great location, fun people watching, beach bronzing by day/exciting restaurants & after dark options, amazing views, clean/contemporary gym, lovely personal touches throughout (gorgeous flowers, afternoon tea offerings, etc.) modern and magnificent architecture; a stunning hotel laced in luxury! > Only negatives: Ghost town at night (perhaps due to so many boardwalk bars/restaurants?) slightly over-priced drinks/food (but, it is a Ritz-so expected) and concierge is not as helpful as needed. **Of importance, I left an expensive package with the front desk for a friend who was checking in the day I was departing; which mysteriously disappeared! (I later found out there had been 2 theft complaints at the hotel during my stay.) After several international calls and e-mails, I was finally able to make contact with a manager who informed me that he would investigate further. I gave the manager, the description of the items, the exact time I left it (since it was a 5:00 AM checkout for flight) and a description of the front desk staff, to which the package had been given; however, I never heard back from the hotel manager, nor anyone from Ritz corporate!

Reviews.Title: “Exeptional staff in this Mediterranean seaside hotel”
Reviews.Author: BHM_Traveler
Reviews.Content: My brother was part of the team that opened the Hotel Arts back in the 1980s, and he had always raved about it (and Barcelona generally). So, we were very excited to stay here during July 2010. First, a note about the weather. It is very hot in Barca in July, and it was exceptionally hot during our week here (90+ degrees F most days). The only problem with this is that the hotel's HVAC system seems to be very outdated, at least in our rooms. Our apartment (more about this later) was very hot, and we could never get the A/C to get it cooled down. We ended up keeping the blinds closed all day (when we were out in town anyway) to help keep the heat down. The staff brought us two fans to keep the air moving, which helped us sleep at night. I know Americans are accustomed to more A/C than Europeans, but we expected better cooling for this class of hotel (especially at night when trying to sleep), and this is really my only complaint about the hotel. We were upgraded to a two-bedroom apartment by the very accomodating staff when it took a very long time for our two rooms to be cleaned and ready upon check in. We were patiently waiting in the lounge when we were advised that the staff wanted to upgrade us. The apartment was fabulous, and it was like our own private penthouse above Barcelona. We were on the 40th floor and had unbelievable views of the sea and city, particularly at night. We were there the night Spain won the World Cup, and we watched the fireworks all night long. Being on the 40th floor helped muffle the horns that honked all night long.... The staff, what can I say about the staff in the apartments. They were the most attentive, service-oriented staff I have ever experienced. They went out of their way to make our 4-year-old daughter's stay special, bringing her candies and coloring books, etc. I cannot say enough about the staff of the apartments. They are top flight, which is what you expect from Ritz Carlton. The same is true about the staff at the front desk and housekeeping. As far as location, there is a metro stop a couple of blocks away, and getting a taxi is very easy. Barcelona is a great walking town. If you need "supplies," there is a mall, which includes a grocery store, a few blocks away in the former Olympic village (ask the staff, but it is about 4 blocks to the east). We found it handy to stock our apartment's kitchen with food and drink for our weeklong stay. Hotel drinks are a bit pricey. The kids enjoyed the pool, but it got a bit crowded during the middle of the afternoon. Early in the morning and late at night we had it to ourselves. Barcelona is a wonderful city to explore. We will definitely stay at the Hotel Arts again, although we will probably aim for one of the cooler months next time!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing View--Great Location On The Water”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelAddicts
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a corner executive suite. The views over both the water and the city were gorgeous. The hotel itself is very modern, very clean, bed are comfortable, breakfast was good. It is right on the boardwalk and there are restaurants right behind it. If memory serves, there is also a casino right next door. A hop on hop off bus picks you up right next to the hotel making sightseeing very easy. Stay here if you want luxury set out of the chaos of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: texas-sugarmom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Arts in conjunction with a Reward Trip with my company. The location is perfect for accessing the beach and the view is amazing. The staff were helpful and friendly. The beds were comfy and the bathroom large and roomy. On a side note, I only rated a 3 for value because the rooms can be quite expensive. Our group rate to extend beyond our tour dates was 199 euro and at that price the value would be a 5.

Reviews.Title: “The Arts- Still Incredible”
Reviews.Author: sockster
Reviews.Content: Our fifth trip to Barcelona, and our fifth stay at the Hotel Arts. All I can say, is the best gets better. I think when you've been to a hotel a few times, it almost feels like home, and the Arts does it better than most I've stayed in. From hotel employees greeting us by name, to the little touches found in the hotel this is one great property. I highly recommend the club floor, whose staff never ceases to amaze. WONDERFUL STAY!!

Reviews.Title: “Mediterranean Sea Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Marlos1
Reviews.Content: Large rooms and bathroom, the most comfortable beds, excellent staff and service in the Port Olimpic area of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: CassGeorge
Reviews.Content: After reading some less than glowing reviews of Hotel Arts, I was on the alert for any slip ups in service or amenities, but did not detect any during our 5 night stay. We stayed on a club floor and this is certainly worth it, the club lounge has a beautiful selection of food and drinks at any time of the day and free WiFi. Our check in was very smooth and every interaction we had with hotel staff was excellent. I felt that a lot of effort had been put into staff training, everyone was genuine and helpful. You could not stand around in the lobby for more than one minute without being approached and offered a glass of water or asked if you needed assistance. Our room was on level 33 with a great view and large bathroom. We dined in the hotel at Enoteca and had a great meal. The pool area is lovely, with towels and water handed out as you arrived. I had a facial in the spa on the top floor, and the whole experience was extremely relaxing. Our only gripe is that you had to pay for internet access in the rooms - when will hotels (particularly of this standard) realise that todays travellers expect this service to be provided without charge. We will be back to Barcelona (a great city) and would definitely stay at Hotel Arts again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - one of my favorites”
Reviews.Author: nyc82
Reviews.Content: I am very surprised by some of the previous negative reviews. We absolutely loved this hotel and would highly recommend to others. The rooms were extremely large, modern and luxurious. The location was excellent with easy access to the sights of Barcelona (either by taxi or metro). The pool was perfect with lots of nice touches (free water, plush towels, magazines, etc.). The service was very good and we found the concierge very helpful. The only slight negative was the check-in and check-out process was very lengthy and inefficient - but this is a minor detail in an overall excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Seb125
Reviews.Content: A very nice Hotel. Judging on the competiton the best in Barcelona. The Hotel is truly a piece of 'art' from the the outside and inside. The service was outstanding with every meber speaking fluent english and giving you personal tours if you request. The specific level i stayed on was the club level which has access to a private conciege, free laptop (internet) use, food and drink included at specific times during the day and a relaxing lounge to relax in after a busy day sight seeing. However on one occassion the turn down service decided to leave no towels and no flannels (minor problem). The pool faciltiy and fitness centre is state of the 'art' with helpful staff, free water and apples and also as many towels as you want. I would stay in the hotel again and i suggest you do to.

Reviews.Title: “Shoddy attention to basics mars otherwise decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkFritz
Reviews.Content: Good location and nice hotel but seems to have gone dowhill over the years. Staed for a few days in september and trip spoilt by power failiures (lifts, room lights, blinds) over mutliple days, consitently lousy repsonses to basic requests like turndowns and shoe shine. Process driven, unresponsive staff. I am no fan of W Hotels but I suspect that the W Barcelona is eating their lunch based on what I heard when I was there

Reviews.Title: “It's all about people”
Reviews.Author: ohashem1
Reviews.Content: This is my first visit to Barcelona, which was after a disney cruise for 10 days, I was booked at the club level for two rooms, they Immediately upgraded to a two bedroom apartment, which was amazing, At the beginning I was not sure Abou how would I rate the hotel, the staff are good, the upgrade was amazing, the lounge was wonderful. Unfortunately the second day, around the whirlpool, i slipped and had a bad injury in my foot, This ruined it for me, I was unable to walk, I was so frustrated from lack of safety around the pool, once I have informed the duty manager of my problem, the level of attention, and care I got was even more than what is great, every one was asking me if I was feeling better, they even offered me a limo to the airport for free. All in all great property, some small problems, mostly their very strange system of elevators, but the staff that work there are absolutely brilliant, real personal touch. I would definitely go back to this hotel, I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great building, very poor quality”
Reviews.Author: MexBel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Arts on a business conference. The location of the hotel is clearly spectacular with amazing view of the sea and wlaking distance to the city. This is unfortunately where it stops. The check in staff was poor at best, not able to identify I had to separate reservations for consecutive nights. The end result was that I was asked to stay in one room for the first night and another for the second one. After much back and forth and lenghty explanations they arranged for me to stay in the same room. Second, my room (I was nicely upgraded) had a connecting door. Whereas you'd never expect perfect sound insolation with a door, this is was unacceptable with the me being able to perfectly understand the conversations in the next room. Sleep quality was terrible. All in all, for the same price you could stay at the W or the Meridien. This hotel feels like a big hotel but the staff is not great and sound-proofness of the rooms terrible. I'm not staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best in Europe”
Reviews.Author: BusinessShipTrav
Reviews.Content: I stay in Arts 2-3 times a year and each stay is better than pervious. Staff is amazing. Everybody is taking care about your needs from the valet parking to the Manager. We got an upgrade and an amazing vue. The rooms are very spacious and completely full of accessories. Teeth brush, pro hair dryer for women, excellent and correct prices for bar products... Concierge as usual send us to the best restaurants and always succeeded the reservations. For the first time we used with my wife the Hair Dresser which was excellent. A little expensive but pro. The location, especially during hot days is great as a lot of BArs and restaurants are on the beach. Don't hesitate

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, good location but too expensive”
Reviews.Author: fatimaLuxembourg
Reviews.Content: Let me explain that I loved to stay at the arts hotel. It is beautiful, the location is good (close to the metro), the rooms are huge, the bathrooms big and well appointed, the staff is in general very friendly. What I didn't like: that our room was only ready at around 4 o o'clock so we had to wait for more than one hour (we weren't even offered a glass of water!). That is the first bad point: the check in services are too tiny for such a big hotel so everything looks like a mess. We got into the room after one hour waiting and because we asked (we werent called on our cells as promised). The luggage took another 1/2 hour and because we complained!!! We had booked a romantic package but the promised items to be delivered upon arrival (bottle of wine etc) weren't there so I had to call again! Another point: staff was constantly knocking on the door trying to deliver things we hadn't ordered! Very annoying for a 5 star hotel and such an expensive one. Arola restaurant was quite nice! Breakfast was delicious! When paying I was shocked to see the price charged for bar items (which were laying on the desk , diddn't have a price on so one doesn't know if they are free of charge or not and if not how much they are)! Otherwise lovely hotel (we didn't use the spa). Please to charge this price: upgrade your checkin service (staff could show the premises, offer something to drink in case of waiting etc!!!), modernise some items that need to be changed (for instance parassols need to be changed), add a pricelist next to the items in the room (water, chocolate bars etc), upgrade the roomservice (the day we were leaving the cleaning lady wanted to come in and clean at 10!!!! So she wasn't even informed that we were leaving (and we had the right to a late checkout).

Reviews.Title: “Arts hotel: a dream hotel”
Reviews.Author: leilataminelli
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very very beautiful, modern with all the services you need. Service perfect, staff wondeful, very very kind. Position perfect, near metro station. A dream hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quality”
Reviews.Author: PeterBrown72
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best of Barcelona. Excellent service and excellent room... all was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: juliam31082010
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Arts Hotel Barcelona for 5 nights in July 2010. It was a last minute decision to go to Barcelona, but we liked the idea of going to a city with a beach to mix up the sightseeing with relaxing by the pool, so the Arts Hotel was the ideal choice. We booked a Club level room, which meant that not only did we have an amazing view from the 30th floor, but we also had access to the Club lounge, which resulted in a very relaxing check in with a glass of champagne. The room was lovely, with a gorgeous bathroom and free Nespresso machine! The club lounge is excellent - the breakfast buffet is great, and on Sundays there is a chef making omelettes. There are various other food "presentations" throughout the day, so there's always something to eat if you're feeling peckish, including afternoon tea with gorgeous little cakes. All alcohol is included, so basically you have Laurent Perrier on tap all day long, which results in the club level being VERY good value. Service here was excellent, the staff would always come and ask if you wanted a refill even though it is theoretically "self-service". The pool is lovely, although it is rather small and as there were quite a few kids around it was a bit noisy. The staff around the pool are very attentive, and kept bringing fresh fruit skewers and little glasses of sorbet, yummy! The location of the hotel is excellent. While its not right in the centre of town, you can walk to many of the sights, and getting cabs is no problem, there's a constant supply of them at the entrance. It's also really nice being right on the beach, as there are lots of nice beachside restaurants. We ate in Arola one evening, and it was truly excellent, fantastic food, wine and service - highly recommended. The only issue with the hotel really is that some of the restaurants aren't open every day. Obviously you're in a big city so you'll definitely be able to find somewhere to eat, but it seems odd that in such a big hotel, the restaurants wouldn't be open every day. Only downside was we were considering visiting the spa, but the price of treatments was outrageous (compared to London) so we didn't bother. Overall a fantastic stay, would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The Room was Great/Awesome Bathroom/lots of add on charges”
Reviews.Author: TravelTop
Reviews.Content: Good service- easy to check in really early. Loved the room.decent view even thought it was a lower floor- best sound system in a room I've seen. The bathroom was awesome! Great shower, soaker tub......watch out for the mini bar. They don't post prices anywhere on stuff- so I was kind of sick to see on the in room bill that in one day I had racked up 185 Euros just with coffee and minibar snacks. They were tasty but man..that was about $230! Lots of annoying surcharges too. Far if you want to do the tourist things but the Tour Bus stops near by- one of those hop on hop off things.

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY REASON to go back to Barcelona THE ARTS HOTEL(Perfect Location,Staff,Staff,Staff,...)”
Reviews.Author: YassinParis
Reviews.Content: More then a Hotel A RESORT This Place make Barcelona look Beautiful Warm and Caring. If you have the chance to be checked in by MARC,MATA ...he will make it an unforgettable stay,such a caring and generous person(I am sure the others must be as well) Somebody respecting the True Value of the job done in a 5 stars hotel. Be Careful guys if the CEO of FOUR SEASONS HOTELS runs into him,you'll lose Marc for sure:) Being an Ex FOUR SEASONS staff member myself,I would have loved to have him in my team. and of course Marc is surrounded by his young and warm teammates(Carlos,Rafael,...), I felt they really working and communicating in such a smooth way. Even the Trainees were Great,especially I ran into Julia Quis...(sorry for the surname) A natural way of guiding you through the hotel,helpful without hesitating... I can go on and on... Thanks for Existing in Barcelona Dear RitzCarlton. Keep on the good work. Only Grumpy People could complain:) Don't change anything or maybe One Thing... The Service elsewhere in Barcelona :) Teach Them!!! PLEASE

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: letty318
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by the bell boy who immediately asked where and what we wanted for dinner. He then made reservations for us at a wonderful tapas restaurant. The hotel is quiet, the staff friendly and helpful and the hotel is is a wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Pool”
Reviews.Author: ModeTraveller
Reviews.Content: Loved the pool and lounge areas. Rooms are nice although weathered looking. Really enjoyed visiting the El Born area each day. Excellent restaurants and lots of little boutiques with fresh new designer looks. Did not enjoy the short 10 minute walk from the hotel to the El Born area because there is nothing to see along the way, you simply have to walk around the walled in Zoo and train station. La Rambla is overrated and dirty, if you like really commercial areas with MacDonald's and KFC then you'll love it, otherwise visit the designer district or El Born area. I didn't have a bad meal the entire time. The restaurants are exceptional: Origens, Sagardi, La Vinya del Senyor, Taller de Tapas, Mamaine. I recommend all these wine bars, cafes and restaurants. The hotel pool area is really beautiful; towel service, complimentary water bottles, apples and skewered fruit. It is best suited to those who want to enjoy the beach or pool while visiting the city. It is a short 10-15 min walk to the El Born area, which is full of restaurants and cafes. The designer area is wonderful for shopping and visiting the famous Gaudi buildings.

Reviews.Title: “A magical weekend in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: piggyrabbit123
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided on a last minute trip to Barcelona, and deliberated between the Arts Hotel and the newly built W. Despite hearing brilliant things about the W, we wanted somewhere a little rough round the edges, perhaps not so new and modern and sparkly!! Somewhere with a bit of character - hence we chose the Arts. The hotel was fantastic - just as i was hoping for. We were upgraded to a large corner room on the 17th floor, with amazing sea views - you felt like you were floating! Pure heaven. Room was spectacular - large and spacious, well decorated, clean and tidy. The hotel had booked us a restaurant for dinner at nearby Terra d'alta mar - which is essentially a very high up restaurant which you access by elevator - with excellent views across the city and bay. I had asked for something special and romantic, which perhaps Barcelona is not best known for - but this was certainly something! We had booked too late to get a table by the window, but settled for a table in the middle of the restaurant. It was pretty romantic, but would have been greatly enhanced by candlelight! Service was iffy, but who cares if youre having a good time. The food was amazing! Not cheap though! Thankfully my offer to pay was rejected! :) When we got back to the hotel a wedding was in full swing on the extensive grounds, and we sat by the bar absorbing the atmosphere and music, sipping cocktails in the balmy evening. (Must point out - excellent wedding venue! Def worth exploring!) Sunday was spent lounging by the pool back at the Arts hotel. Thankfully our hotel room afforded us an excellent view of the pool, so we could spy the deckchairs filling up and knew when to make a mad dash for it!! We reserved our chairs with sunblock and magazine, and then headed to the indoor Bites restaurant for breakfast - scrambled eggs with truffles, yum yum! Then quickly to the pool! I have to point out the pool was chock full off families and little kids running around. Quite sweet really, i didnt mind much. If you are hoping to avoid families then i would avoid this hotel, or at least the pool area in the heat of summer! Had lunch at restaurant next to pool - most amazing grilled tuna we have EVER had. I am still dreaming of it!!!! For our last dinner we had to try the acclaimed michelin starred restautant in the hotel, which name now escapes me (arollo?) anyhow, it was brilliant. we had the tapas tasting menu which was very reasonable at about €49 pp. (that was the price of a main course alone the night before!!!) great service, good bottle of wine, we were very happy. afterwards retired to the balcony for a drink and cuddled up in the sofa chairs while the DJ played love songs. it was if time had stopped. The next morning up early and back to reality.... what a wonderful trip!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Serge-Michael
Reviews.Content: Here it is, simply stated: the hotel dates from a few years and is, in some places, in need of refurbishment. But you can still love your house even if it needs some repairs ! This being said, the lobby, corridors and most of the commun areas look good. The true gem of this establishment is the staff: simply amaizing !! One of the best service we have had in our life. The different managers that we had the pleasure to talk with(M. Benjamin, and the Lady Manager at the Marina Restaurant) were outstanding and they certainly choose and coach their staff to their image. Oh sure, we had few minor issues...elevators that did not stop at our floor, for a while, key that is not working properly...but aren't these glitches the best occasions to appreciate the level of service? They were terrific: listening, caring, and fixing. And, even better, coming back to you to make sure all is o.k. Our room was on the executive level (30th) and we took plenty of advantage of the nice lounge on the 33rd: great food, beverages, views and, again, fantastic staff. The room itself was just perfect: views of the playa and MontJuic, Old Barcelona and Tibidabo. In room amenities included a superbe coffee machine, fantastic sound system, wonderful lighting, and the best of best...the bathroom: sooooo roomy and so well designed! Large area with 2 sinks, and around this area, one find a separated toilet and bidet, separated shower (and what a shower!) and bath. The hotel even sent a nice bottle of Cava and a birthday cake, to underline the anniversary of one of us. We have tried the Arola Restaurant and the Marina Restaurant: both very good, but our heart went to the Marina, for it is a simple but very cosy terrace and, of course, the staff and the lovely manager (who's name I so unfortunately forgot...). ...and Thank you all for making us feel like Stars !! oh - and keep playing the movies by the pool at night - such a nice way to end the day !!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, but some concerns about service”
Reviews.Author: Heleno84
Reviews.Content: First up, the hotel looks great and the food was excellent. The room was lovely (although 4th floor rooms like mine got a good bit of street noise) and the pool, garden and breakfast were excellent. But I had a series of niggles about the service. First of all, rooms had no price lists for anything - mini-bar, spa, room service - making me a bit worried that it was one of these, "If you have to ask, you can't afford it" sort of places - and that wasn't just my room but those of colleagues too (there was a brochure for boat charter services, also without prices, which was hardly reassuring). Service was iffy too: housekeeping managed to take away my robe and towels without replacing them for nearly 4 hours despite requests; the concierge managed to transfer me around 4 people and then hang up on me when chasing this. And in the bathroom, while there was a very good selection of things like combs, cotton buds etc, the toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, shower gel etc) were extremely low-rent: the conditioner was easily the worst I've ever used and left my hair feeling dreadful. Not end-of-the-world stuff, of course, but for the money and the star-rating, I'd expect better. So while I think the hotel looks and feels great, I'm not sure I'd recommend this to a friend who was planning to splash out. Too many small irritations.

Reviews.Title: “Very attractive with lovely rooms on the beach with great pool”
Reviews.Author: Fionasigg
Reviews.Content: Competitively priced inc. wonderful buffet breakfast where you can sit outside in a garden setting. We had lunch at the pool which was delicious. It is located in a little area called Barceloneta which has little shops and one outstanding restaurant which you can walk to, called Cal Pep. You must make reservations because it is small and very popular. They serve tapas, lots of little courses -very delicious.

Reviews.Title: “This is why Ritz Carlton Hotels are so well regarded”
Reviews.Author: Hank_from_Moncton
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for a week July 2010. The check in was flawless and on arrival they offered us a free upgrade to a suite. We were taken to our room by a staff person and our luggage followed shortly. The hotel staff are second to none and spoke to us by name each and every time we saw them. There is a concierge person or two that continually walk the reception area and just ask how things are going and what they can do for you. In the lobby they have candy dishes where licorice and other candies are they with little bags to help yourself along with water and lemonade. I had a problem with a phone call being charged that should not have been and when I brought it to the attention of the front desk the lady I was speaking to simply asked me to wait a minute while she got a desk manager and within 2 minutes she said not to worry that it would be credited. This was an 88 euro call to Canada and they waived it no questions asked with no debate. The rooms and services are excellent and this hotel is right down at the beach and across from the marina where there are plenty of reasonable restaurants, night clubs, etc Internet is pricy but they offer one free hour of wifi per day in the lobby and by the pool. I cannot give a hotel a higher recommendation than this one. We both agree that even if the price is a little high it is "location location location"

Reviews.Title: “It would have been the perfect hotel if I could have gotten one good night of sleep.”
Reviews.Author: joeymichalec
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at the Hotel Art's on a work sponsored trip that included extensive free time. We found the location wonderful for a summer vacation, located with the city on one side of the hotel and the water on the other side. Since we live in a large city with a large body of water we felt right at home. The area seemed safe with only minor reports of pick pockets around the boardwalk outside the hotel. If your looking to see the city the hop on off bus tour was right outside the hotel with a Metro Station one block away. If going out for dinner, options abound right around the hotel on the waterfront. The beaches outside the hotel were nice but if your sensitive to topless sunbathing you may want to take a pass. The only negative about the beach is the constant drove of people trying to sell you water, beer, soda ect. The hotel itself was extreamly nice however if your a budget traveler this may not be the best value, breakfast alone was 32 euro's per person but a short walk down the street found more cost effective options. Upon checking into our room we found the views breathtaking, the bed extreamly comfortable, the bathroom heavenly and large windows providing great light. So here's my only problem with our stay, after going out the first night we came back to our room sometime around two in the morning and the noise coming from outside made it difficult for me to sleep. Since we faced the water (remember our great views) along with many wonderful night clubs the bass beat right through the walls. At first I called the front desk thinking it was someone on our floor but once security came up it turned out to be right outside our windows. We live right downtown Chicago, but we don't have night club's open until six in the morning outside our door. If the cost is not a problem I would recomend this hotel for the active traveler. If you require silence at night request a room with a city view rather then face the water. We love to combine siteseeing along with relaxation and this location offered both, great access to one of the best city's in Europe and a nice pool or great beach right outside your door.

Reviews.Title: “too big for their britches?”
Reviews.Author: lookingfor28s
Reviews.Content: The Arts is a nice hotel, decent location near the beach and short walk to Barceloneta neighborhood. Our problem was with the staff. They are either too young, too busy, or both...but they consistently could not accommodate simple request. The concierge was top notch with their recommendations. The physical appearance of the hotel and the rooms are nice, but the carpets need cleaning BAD! I would stay again and just hope that I don't have to deal with the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “excellent rooms, great location, hotel layout not great”
Reviews.Author: Vermontraveler31
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Arts Barcelona for 6 nights this July. We were promptly checked in and directed to our room. We did need help finding it as the hotel is separated into two different sections with two separate elevators. Until you learn this, the place is confusing. There is also a separate elevator from these two mentioned to get to the fitness center and pool. Odd really. Someone did help us find the room once we asked. The room was to die for. Big, luxurious, spa bathroom- beautiful really. Had there not been so much to do outside of the hotel, I could have stayed in the room for a week! The staff comes in twice daily and leaves on music, replaces towels and remakes the bed. That was a really nice feature. We felt very comfortable there. The fitness center appears find at a first glance but then when you go to use it, you realize it lacked proper air conditioning, that the cool ipad touch screens for the treadmills really don't work or need to be recalibrated and that you can't really find towels to wipe your forehead anywhere. There was water provided there in bottles which was nice. It was a fine workout facility but certainly not the best I had been in. The pool had the best chairs and huge, fluffy towels. When you take the elevator to the pool, you feel like you have taken the wrong entrance as you enter through this back, undecorated, very service-feeling area. Very odd. Also, it was clear that this pool was not big enough for the amount of guests that it needs to accommodate. On our first day, the pool had each chair full and was quite and peaceful. On the weekend, it became a Disney World theme park. The pool was full of people and there was a waiting list to get chairs! They did come around daily with samples of smoothie drinks and with fruit skewers for no charge which was nice. But, had I been on a waiting list for the pool, I would not have been too happy. They clearly couldn't accommodate the number of people they had staying at the hotel. There was an area off to the side of the pool that had nice hammocks and a 'hot tub' or more like a smaller pool. It looked like a good place to rest while you awaited your room after a long flight. We did not eat at this hotel because it was WAY to expensive. 35€ hamburgers in one restaurant! The pool grill seemed a little better with 20€ pizzas and such but still expensive. And don't dare eat anything from the minibar in the room- 7€ chocolate bars and water, 6€ coke etc. There was free one hour per day internet usage in the lobby only. You could pay more for access in your room. The one hour was easy to access and suit us just fine. The lobby, although quite noisy at night, was comfortable. O' and the lobby served water daily and little bags of jelly candy- very fun. Overall, you will enjoy your stay but you will be surprised by how expensive everything is in the hotel and you will begin to wonder who designed the layout.

Reviews.Title: “city living with and without the city”
Reviews.Author: JB4
Reviews.Content: Visited Barcelona for the first time this July 2010 with my wife and teenage son.The hotel is lovely an oasis of calm in the city.Club level which offers private lounge,conceige facility and bedrooms on the higher floors is worth paying for.Service in the hotel,standards are all very high.The pool area is lovely too.The location is next to the sea and beach and there is a metro station across from the hotel.Why stay at a hotel in the centre of noisy,busy Barcelona while you have this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideas above its station”
Reviews.Author: rabbitman
Reviews.Content: There are many 5 star hotels in the world. Of these, some are a cut above the rest and are “world class”. Usually something differentiates these from the rest, for example that everything, from the room to service is perfect. And some of these therefore charge a great deal more, sometimes with some justification, and sometimes not. The Hotel Arts charges as if it is such a “World Class” hotel, but is in fact no more than an “ordinary” 5 star. Normal rates start at approx 450EUR per night (although our conference had been given a significant discount). Last minute rates were 600 and above, for a "base level" room. My own experience started upon check in. I requested an early check in and arrived at 11. The room was not yet ready. Fair enough, if they were full. The lobby itself was like a railway station, with hundreds of people milling around. It hardly felt like luxury. I gave in my bags and went for a drink, having been told I would be called when the room was ready. At that point I first experienced the hotel’s incredible appetite for extortionate charges. Beers (not very large) were about 10EUR each. After 3 hours and no call, I went back to the desk, or at least tried as the queues were long. A helpful attendant asked if she could help and eventually came back with a key for me. Apparently my bags would follow me to my room. No one showed me to my room though (a usual “world class hotel” feature). An hour later no bags, so I called. My bags would be with me shortly, apparently. 15 minutes later, one bag showed up, but one missing. The second bag's existance was news to the bellboy. Half an hour later the second bag showed. 15 minutes later I received a call that my second bag was still lost (it wasn’t) – chaos! The room itself was mediocre and full of gimmicks rather than useful things. There were many buttons, whose function was not obvious as the writing had worn off. There were stains on the carpet, a broken sink and a threadbare chair (see pictures). I was happy I was not paying 600 EUR for this. Luckily I did not help myself to any of the minibar items on display, as a 250ml bottle of water was 7EUR. Even the coffee in the room was 4 EUR, which is free in most hotels. Internet access for one day was 25EUR (although they would do a month for 475!). Breakfast downstairs was 30. The hotel itself was nice but hardly word class. An event arranged by the hotel for our conference was utterly chaotic, and involved the entire conference eating dinner at 1030 pm, clearly because the hotel had forgotten to arrange it (this was an event for 150 people!). The staff were often helpful, but seemed to think that they were running a world class hotel. At best this could be described as an average 5 star hotel with prices much higher than that. I have given it 3 out of 5, due to the discount on my room. If I had paid a rack rate I would give it 2.

Reviews.Title: “Good modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jramirez5
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great staff as mentioned by previous travellers. They do their utmost to exceed your expectations. Most of them are bilingual which is another positive thing. I enjoyed my dinner in Enoteca, who had great food & service. The Hotel has a wonderful location as well, and the views are nice with no noise when sleeping at nights. If you are staying there for relaxation, they have a Six Senses Spa which seemed to pretty fly! I would definitely recommend this hotel to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, modern building, not the best location for me”
Reviews.Author: PabloMun
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel on a recent business trip it was my second stay. The hotel is nice, a modern building, the room has great view either of the city or the mediterranean sea, the bathroom is excellent. The only thing I can say I did not like is that all the employees are from other countries but no one from Spain, being that my first language is spanish I would prefer people from Barcelona or at least Spain. The location is not the best for my taste you cannot walk from there to downtown, although very good for night life.

Reviews.Title: “Big and impressive!”
Reviews.Author: vbailey2
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Arts Barcelona is BIG and very impressive. We stayed here during early June 2010 for a conference my husband was attending. The room was comfortable, and when you closed the blinds it was so dark that no sun peeped in the next morning. Very good for sleeping if we hadn't been on call for meetings! We didn't utlize any of the restaurants, but meals were catered for the meetings and it was very good. The bars were beautiful and well-staffed. The pool was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Believe The Hype - AVOID”
Reviews.Author: HotelMavenLondon
Reviews.Content: Firstly the aesthetics of the hotel are disappointing. One of our party commented that the reception was like a cattle market and that was pretty accurate. There definitely seemed to be a pile 'em high culture which I guess is what comes with having 30+ floors of rooms to fill. Queues of scruffy looking package tours filled the first floor lobby area which was so small - who, gallingly, had probably paid only half the rate we had. The room itself was scruffy - probably a function of fitting so many said guests into the rooms - there were cigarette burns in the carpet and it didn’t look like it has probably been refurbished since the hotel was put up - and in general the room didn’t feel especially clean. Bits of the veneer on the furniture were chipped to reveal chipboard underneath. The general effect was fine - and as you would expect a five star business hotel to be, but on closer examination the façade was slipping and the room was due a decent clean and refurb, less ritz carlton more novotel. Definitely not what you would expect… To be honest these are all minor details but perhaps the most disappointing part of the stay was the reprihensibly bad service. On arriving we were informed that the room we booked ( 2 queen sized beds, as stipulated in an email at time of booking) wasn’t available and that we would have tostay in a room with a king size bed and a child's stow-away bed (and be moved into a room with 2 queen size beds the next day). That’s not exactly how I envisaged spending the first night of my holiday so we complained, apparently, according to the duty manager on reception the hotel was "Totally full" and there was nothing that could be done, only when we pushed the matter did a standard room with 2 queen size beds become magically available. I would rather that they didn’t lie about there being none available as an attempt to fob us off, and then sort the matter out when we became increasingly frustrated about the experience. Given we had to wait for an hour for this to become available we went to the champagne bar - I know hotels charge extortionate prices for drinks but EUR 20 for a gin and tonic just took away a lot of enjoyment from having said drink - especially when we were presented with a bill for the best part of EUR 150 2 drinks each (3 of us in the group) later. Perhaps the bill would be ok if the service was stupendously good but having waited 20 mins at the table to be served we then went into the (empty bar) ourselves to give the barman doing zero something to do, It wasn’t really acceptable. Same story the next day when we ordered coffee and it didn’t arrive for half an hour, that said we fared better than the next door table who got their drinks sooner but ended up with a bottle of water landing on their lap. The waitress was surly - and many of the staff seemed either disillusioned or gormless. The pool bar fared better - and the staff were charming but they still couldn’t get drinks to us when we ordered them three times. Each morning housekeeping staff opened the door of the room and came in despite us still being in bed and the do not disturb sign being on, and on the last day they rang the doorbell repeatedly which was totally unnecessary and obnoxious. The exception of this bad experience was Carlos at the concierge desk who was consistenly good throughout, but not even that could make up for the above. Overall I will definitely go to the W next time- the Arts seems to just suffer from the complacancy associated with being the "best" hotel in a city for too long - without healthy competition. At least the newcomer will have something to prove, and even if they do a deeply average job, it will undoubtedly deliver more than this fading star.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic??? what?! Or too much expectation???”
Reviews.Author: mayer_p_uk
Reviews.Content: We went in Barcelona for our 35th wedding anniversary, so we tried to book for a special place, really special… when you book in the Ritz-Carlton, something special is what you expect, isn’t it?
