But it wasn’t what we got, we felt like in a rush of a business day!!! Chaotic reception, check in like a industrial packing process… room, my goodness, dusty, with broken furniture, old hand towels in the toilet… well a bad beginning… I arrange with the reception an included romantic bath, but, when we arrived after the time that was supposed to be ready, we still saw that a housekeeping women was running out from the room with some plastic bags, magic??? Romantic??? We order room service, breakfast in bed (45 minutes, and we had to recall) we tried to rest after lunch once, and It was such a frustration, ambulances were passing every 5 minutes with the siren screaming!!! Bad luck?? Maybe, but enough NOT TO REPEAT.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has it all- wonderful service, wonderful rooms, wonderful views.”
Reviews.Author: Richmondluxurylover
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beyond expectations and lives up to the Ritz Carlton brand. Situated on the sea yet within walking distance of Barcelona it offers the best of both a resort and city setting. The service was wonderful, and the caring, unpretentious staff certainly enhances the overall experience. The rooms are beautiful as are the bathrooms. We cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Very great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ic99
Reviews.Content: I was truly amazed, this hotel was so good. It was cleen, and the room was quite big.

Reviews.Title: “€300/night to be rogered”
Reviews.Author: JoeLalor
Reviews.Content: The staff are excellent - good looking, multilingual, anxious to please - but little else about this hotel would tempt me back. The smoke alarm pulses red above the bed; the reading lights are in a strip along the bedhead and are all on or all off - so if one person wants to read, the other has to have the lights glaring at them; the window blinds are noisy mechanical blinds activated via a bedside switch; on your departure morning, the tv is activated remotely to wake you; there are no stairs other than the emergency exit stairs, so waits of over 5 mins are not unusual to descend 2 floors; reception is not at street level. There is a minibar, which we stayed clear of, and there are bars of chocolate, biscuits, bottled water, coffee, etc., on the dressing table. No prices are marked on these, and even a €50/night guesthouse supplies complimentary tea and coffee, so over 4 days, we had 4 coffees, 2 bottles of water, 2 biscuits and 2 bars of chocolate - about €10 worth at any of the stores in town. We were presented with a bill of €160, shoved under the door on our 4th morning. We decided to abandon the other 2 days of our intended stay, and when we itemised the items we'd consumed, we were eventually charged €50. One of the original items we'd been billed for was €40 for the champagne bar - a room we'd never been in. The "customer services" feigned upset at all this and asked what she could do to put things right - I suggested she ensure that we were not billed for the nights we were cancelling. Sure enough, €630 was billed to my credit card for those nights. The charge was refunded a week or so later after I complained. This hotel is ideal for the idle rich or those who like to be surrounded by pointless devices to accomplish simple everyday tasks.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely love Barcelona and this hotel made my trip even better.”
Reviews.Author: emgem121
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! I have been to Barcelona many times but always stayed in the El Bourne area of the Gothic Quarter which even though was close to many things could not compare to where Hotel Arts is situated. It was literally right on top of the beach bars and restaurants which is ideal. Surprisingly no noise could be heard from our room to the bussling crowds below. This hotel is great for anyone that loves luxury. Things are over priced but the hotel isn't exactly aimed for people the have budgets. All staff were very friendly and everything was kept very clean and tidy. There are even canters of water with either lemon, lime or orange slices in them placed around the hotel for guests to have free of charge. The room and bathroom was massive with state of the art amenities. The hotel does have a restaurant but we didn't eat there as there are plenty of other cheaper but just as tasty places on the door step.

Reviews.Title: “Just heaven!”
Reviews.Author: Percyone
Reviews.Content: This reminded me why I love staying in hotels so much. The staff, decor, food, bedrooms were all heavenly. I loved being here so much. Stunning garden where we had breakfast, amazing views from the bedrooms. Bathroom products were lovely. I never felt the hotel were trying to save money, in everyway they tried to give you things - sweets in the front hall, water to drink everywhere, products in the bedrooms. A real treat.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: doodoo999
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous place to stay - I couldn't believe how lovely and huge the room was - also how great the service was. Very luxurious...very plush...didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay...again”
Reviews.Author: sockster
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Arts continues it's wonderful ways. Stayed there for six nights and I have to tell you. The staff, led by new rooms manager Stephanie and the incomparable guest service manager Patrizia continue to wow us with incredible personalized service. The entire staff is so attentive and caring. This hotel has to rank up there with the great city hotels of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great Concierge Service”
Reviews.Author: travelernottourist
Reviews.Content: Loved the room and the service was exceptional from check-in, wait staff in bars and restaurants, and concierges were extremely helpful. Location is not easily walkable to Las Ramblas, however there is a train station close by. Beautiful sea views and close to beach and beach bars if that is important. Casino next store. Lots of great people watching...

Reviews.Title: “Top of the line hotel; location not convenient to town center”
Reviews.Author: ivanciment
Reviews.Content: I saw this hotel at its best. I got a very nice upgrade via Amex Platinum to a club level suite (i had booked a club level room). The room was good and the decor and in-room amenities were better than average (modern and artsy but yet functional and plush without being minimalist). A few lightbulbs were out but were quickly replaced when I complained. The club itself has a good amount of food on offer. Breakfast and the gym were pretty good. Views were quite nice from my seaside room. Dinner at the Bites restaurant was good. Meals in the restaurants were decent but not spectacular although Barcelona is not exactly my favorite when it comes to food. Concierge service was very good and the valets are particularly good at this hotel. The downside here is that it's not very close to a metro or to the city center; you need to take taxi rides of about 15 minutes and 8-10 Euros. If you want to get out of your hotel and walk somewhere in town, this is not the place to go. But it is a very nice address in Barcelona and excellent if you want to have the feel of the sea and a panorama of the city from the heights of the hotel. I suppose it also matters if you are into pools and being near the beach. Weather was cold and rainy the entirety of my visit so I didn't get a chance to see that part of things. I didn't get to the spa; I had limited time and it just didn't work out when I tried to get an appointment on short notice. Hotel is rather pricey but I think it was worth it, especially if you come in through something like Amex Platinum with all the extras included.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: JimD069
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel to celebrate our 10th anniversary. We stayed in a club level room with fantastic views across Barcelona, and access to the club lounge where you can get complimentary drinks (all day) and food/snacks (at set times). The hotel is very beautiful and has everything you could want, unfortunately it's all at extra cost! The staff are courteous, helpful and friendly. I'm puzzled by some of the other reviews about them being unhelpful and rude, this was not our experience during our 4 day stay. We ate in the hotel restaurants Enteca which we'd recommend and in the Arola which we wouldn't (but we're not fans of Tapas!) Excellent and expensive sums it up!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 and even 4 star!!! Maximum 3 star. Expensive hotel with awfull service.”
Reviews.Author: Antonclick
Reviews.Content: 1. after check-in I was waiting more than 30 minutes in my room for hotel personell to bring me my luggage 2. my rate included “romantic package on arrival” (wine & strawberry) but when I arrived there was no “romantic package” in my room. I did a call to reponsible hotel staff to remind and they promised to deliver package immideately. I was waiting more than 1 hour (for bottle of wine and 2 pieces of strawberry) but nobody came so we had to leave hotel w/o “romantic package on arrival” 3. At arrival reception told me that breakfast buffet is available untill 12:00 every day, but next day when I came to breakfast place at 11:32 breakfast staff told me breakfast is untill 11:30 and did not allow me to go in 4. Every day cleaning service knocked the door and opened it even when “do not disturb” plate was in place! 5. I went to the hotel bar to order and smoke cigar. First I was overchared with cigar in the bill more expensive than I actually took (I took Hoyo but was charged for Cohiba… Problem was fixed only after I asked for a hotel manager), secondly bar staff was looking for cigar knife about 40 minutes and finally told me that they do not have cigar knife in the bar and in all hotel as well so I was advised to cut cigar with kitchen knife… 6. my friend asked reception to buy special bunch of flowers from outside (he showed picture and reception confirmed possibility to take that bunch) but finally they just took regular flowers from reception bowl, put it in separate flower bowl and brought to our room. My friend said it’s absolutely not what he asked thus he will not pay for it. Hotel staff agreed but finally they included 139 EUR for that flowers in my bill and I paid for it as I was hurry to airport and had no time to check the bill carefully. 7. when i need any assistance from hotel reception it was almost not possible to get through to them by telephone: always no answer

Reviews.Title: “unbelievable!!!!”
Reviews.Author: daami1988
Reviews.Content: an excellent, faultless, unforgettable experience! the staff were incredibly helpful (pretty hot too!)... they gave us some great tips on going out. The room was fantastic and the view was GORGEOUS! we could see the whole of barcelona and the beachfront from our floor to ceiling window and thost blackout blinds that go up in the morning - now that is one brilliane wake up call!!!!! the bathroom was great....i have never seen a bidet before and initially thought it was supposed to be for your feet until my friend politely corrected me!!!! there was an audi conference going on when we were there - the hotel was rammed with brand new audis everywhere.....it looked like a bloody race track with cars flying around everywhere! went up to the spa....which cost a bomb but that massage left me smiling like a cheshire cat. the steam room and hte jacuzzi were nice touches! very pricey, but to be honest i don't regret it one bit, it was worth every penny! i'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel for people with more money than sense”
Reviews.Author: old_anselmian
Reviews.Content: Make no mistake the staff are friendly -they are told to be - and they are helpful but this hotel ranks as one of the worst I have ever stayed in. The pool was empty and despite the fact that I paid 400 /370 euro a night everything else was extra. The internet access in the room was 25 euro a night, the parking was 32 euro a night and breakfast was not included! I was initially charged 68 Euro for a breakfast for two. Our friends who were there at the same time had a better deal and were upgraded to a suite. None of the rooms had been dusted. But the worst of all was the noise. The first night we heard everything in the adjoining room and presumably that's why the TV volume was pegged low - hardly able to hear it. There are much better hotels for half the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully spoilt”
Reviews.Author: Rosa90
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel for its service, location and beautiful rooms. Definately the best choice for Barcelona if you want to splash out.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel ... but not top class”
Reviews.Author: pilou2
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel, but i think they are living on their reputation. Service is not top top quality. However, the price is. Lots of details which are not ok....

Reviews.Title: “Dream hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: GypsyLily
Reviews.Content: Although it is very expensive it is the BEST hotel we have ever stayed at. The rooms are wonderful with veiws to die for and the service is incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Top place to stay in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: AlGanda
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my honeymoon. I had a pleasant stay. The hotel was located close to the beach and marina area. This area was "dead" when i visited but i heard that it has become more lively since with many restuarants opening up in the vacinity. The rooms had very similar decor as that of Park Hyatt Milan. But the hotel in Milan was much better situated compared to the city and had more to offer. ( i know they are in different cities and are run by different hotel companies, but the decor is VERY similar...almost 95% the same..i have no choice but to compare them! ).. I would recommend it to others, but wouldnt come back again..

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique-style hotel, but wild moneygrabbing prices at every turn”
Reviews.Author: skimeld
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Arts is without-question utterly beautiful: The views from the top floor meeting rooms are to die for (ask them for a tour) as are most of the views and rooms across the hotel. It is a refreshing blend of a boutique-style hotel, but with lots and lots of natural light and none of the faux nightclub music pumping out of every corner. It's also a stone's throw from beach. Lovely. But asked "would you stay here again or recommend us to a friend", my answer would be 'definitely not'. The food was distinctly average and the prices for incidentals wildly over the top (a beer in room 8euros plus tax, 24hr internet connection 25euros plus tax, in-room movie - even something ancient like ET - 20euros plus tax, CD by your bed 25euros plus tax), and a feeling throughout the hotel that of course we can be of service, but only if you're paying through the nose. Interestingly the Ritz Carlton name - which operates the hotel and prides itself on customer satisfaction - was nowhere to be seen. I wonder if they too know this hotel is just in it for the cash and not their usual expensive-but-truly-five-star customer experience? (As an aside, in case it's useful, the pool is small, outdoor and unheated).

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience!”
Reviews.Author: kirbygirl
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed at the Hotel Arts for 4 nights late January and while I have read some the of negative reviews, I have to say that this was one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. The staff couldn't have been more attentive or professional. From the minute we arrived to the minute we left they made sure our every need was met. A complimentary tray of pastries was delivered to our room shortly after arriving as well as recommendations for dining and touring the city. Our room was immaculate with the most amazing views of the sea (We stayed in a double deluxe with sea views). Worth it!! They also provide a great turn-down service with chocolates, bottled waters and robes and slippers each night. The staff found out that we were celebrating our daughters 13th birthday and on the morning of her birthday delivered a beautiful (and delicious) chocolate cake to our room with a birthday card from the staff of the Hotel Arts. While the hotel is a 15 min walk from the center of town we found it quite easy to walk along the beautiful shore line walk and then cut up into town. We chose to use the taxi services that are readily available at the hotel for further destinations. Taking a taxi proved to be less expensive than taking a touristic bus which is also an option. 21 Euros per person for the bus per day or taxis which cost us about 25 Euros total a day for all 3 of us (thats taking multiple taxi rides per day). All in all, The Hotel Arts was a perfect 10 for us!

Reviews.Title: “All electronics stolen from room while at breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Glbtrott10
Reviews.Content: Shocking, but true. This hotel has a problem. We went to breakfast, where one provides the room number to be admitted to breakfast area. Whilst there, our room was accessed with a duplicate key and emptied of laptop, 2 cameras, hard drive, 2 cellphones, and the the high res pictures of our marriage and safari trip. Doesn't take much to do the math as to what exactly is going on. Upon notifying management of the robbery, no one - not anyone - bothered to come to see us in our room until we went down and demanded it, more than 20 minutes later. The event wasn't treated with the seriousness it deserved until Ritz Carlton corporate got involved. Eventually, we were compensated for our stolen items. But not our stolen memories.

Reviews.Title: “All Electronics Stolen from our room”
Reviews.Author: eventsRme
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and the staff more than gracious, while there on a company incentive trip, I had a complete electronics sweep done of my room - two laptops, cell phone, camera, etc and we are convinced it was an inside job - very sad. The housekeeping staff handled very poorly - didn't notify anyone of the stranger that entered our room... the saga dragged on. It was devastating to lose the belongings, a hassle to replace, and while hotel insurance covered the basics, not much else was done to compensate for lost productivity and "pain and suffering" if there is such thing for losing a laptop loaded with information!

Reviews.Title: “Food and beverage division could compete with a cafeteria”
Reviews.Author: acatri
Reviews.Content: I guess the hotel and the restaurant division in this company are two different entities. While most of the members of this site are praising the hotel, I had a very low experience at a private event, this past December, on the restaurant/events side. Being a great expectations party and being invited to what is known to be the best hotel in Barcelona, I also had very high expectations from the night. It started awkward at our arrival when my party and I were informed that the event was moved from the top floor where we all expected the breath taking view over the city (probably the location we paid the exorbitant price for) to the Ballroom, in the basement. Ok, no big deal! Service should still be impeccable, I thought… I bit my tongue when I saw how slow and unprofessional the wardrobe people were moving. Then again, prior to the event, in the lobby in front of the Ballroom where guests were having Cava and starters. My party and I never got a hold of the servers – obviously outnumbered by the already announced amount of people… Suddenly we were rushed inside for the five courses dinner, which turned out to have only three while we missed the first two in the lobby. At dinner we found it difficult to have wine in our glasses because the waiters were always busy with other tables. Again, I don’t understand why they didn’t have enough wait staff for such a large party?! Every time we asked them for help, the help was always late to arrive. When one of the gentlemen at our table decided to take action and manage to find a bottle of wine to fill our glasses, the floor manager rushed to our table and admonished the guest!?!? as if what he did was terribly wrong. Next thing I know, when the traditional cold soup was served, which has to actually be poured into the plate, the waitress also POURED it on my evening gown! I mean, come on!! I understand that this might happen to anybody, but this waitress did not even care to apologize. She just left the table like nothing even happened. Nevertheless, the waiters never smiled, fact that I find totally against the concept of hospitality! And then, as midnight rolled in and last course was served, the whole staff cleaned the tables and just chatted looking at us as if they wanted us out the door. Useless to say my party and I left before the evening was even close to be over, and that I don’t think of this location as a high class anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Still THE hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Doggy88
Reviews.Content: After spending 1 night at the Mandarin Oriental we checked out very quickly and headed to the Ritz/Arts Hotel. Whilst the MO was new, trendy and central, it was cramped, noisy and poorly managed (forgive them for that as they are new). The Ritz Arts was fautless though and the views from the rooms are AMAZING and far and away make the stay a memory in itself. We are runners so MO was also no good for that. But Ritz was on the water with around 4 different runs you could do. If your the type that likes style over trend then this is still the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A nightmare, a complete trainwreck of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: lezunip
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Arts a few days ago, and my list of grievances is too long to write here. If you don't read anything from my review, at least please retain the fact that this is a seriously understaffed hotel (both in number of people and in the quality of their training) and you should only go during low season / not during a busy time. I took my parents from Dec 31 to Jan 4 there so they can see Barcelona, paid top dollar for the rooms (no points, etc used here) and the hotel basically ignored us systematically. We arrived at 4 pm and made to wait until 445pm, without apologies, in fact, without even being offered a glass of water. The check-in person was positively patronizing. Because they were on a low floor (10th), the rooms creaked like a listing ship as the building moves with the wind. Not pleasant. One of the rooms was filthy as it had presumably not been used in ages, the other (a "deluxe" room with an admittedly beautiful view) lacked 25% of all the accessories it was supposed to have, like a remote control for the TV, which was turned on and could not be turned off. It took one hour and all 4 staff to find a remote control. The hotel lacked - a first aid kit - a thermometer - anyone who understood the english language except at the reception desk, which was unreachable by phone - any degree of coordination between staff. on one day you would ask for a laundry bag, nobody would come and then the next morning 4 different people would show up with laundry bags. absurd. And god forbid if you needed to contact reception. Lines would be busy and you would get an answering service. In Spanish. We clearly should have checked out and gone to the W but after my talk with the manager (and his generous offer to comp our first night there and move me to another room) we decided that maybe once crowds left, things would get better. We were. of course, idiots. The cleaning staff proceeded to throw out my camera charger (not expensive but impossible to replace in Barcelona because it is a Mamiya professional camera), water in the bath came out brown, cleaning staff continued to have no regard for the fact that my "do not disturb sign" AND my "do not disturb" light were on and kept ringing on the doorbell to offer me water, chocolates, etc. Once they rang for a full minute. Why they love ringing so much, I dont know but I suspect they think it s service. At the end of the fourth day I was constantly on edge, afraid to leave anything in the room (for fear not of theft but of incompetent housekeeping) and was extremely relieved to get out of there. The grand finale was the luggage handling. The porters courteously loaded all our luggage in the taxis, were tipped well, and we arrived at the airport with two extra suitcases belonging to some other guest who had left their things in storage! I had to call the hotel, explain to them the situation (in english, and when that failed, in spanish) and wait in the airport until someone came, literally nudged me (no hello, no thank you, no apologies), pointed at his ritz carlton uniform and left. I can only imagine the agony of the other person whose luggage they loaded in our taxi. ( i think it was room 2412) This is a 2 to 3-star hotel with a wonderful view. But it s not a Ritz Carlton. Not by a mile.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JollyGoodFellas
Reviews.Content: Great hotel on the Med Sea. Nice location and at a tour bus stop so convenient to get around. few minute walk to las ramblas or quick cab. everyone very nice and english speaking staff. Room was great as we had city/sea view from 21st floor Definetly a Ritz Carlon property with attentive staff

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking and very special - don't listen to those that moan!!”
Reviews.Author: sportychick1977
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have had the fortune to visit some great hotels in great places around the world and I booked the Hotel Arts as a surprise trip after a successful year for our business. We arrived via the train and metro from the airport, but returned in a cab. Definitely take the cab, it's only 10 Euros more but the convenience of not having to walk miles underground is well worth the cost. On arrival at the hotel our bags were taken immediately and we were shown to the reception where we were checked in. We were to stay in an Executive Suite on the 27th floor with a view towards the city and also the Olympic Hill. It was breathtaking and way above any expectations I had previously and proved to be the best surprise to my husband. Although we had the added luxury of an additional WC in the suite and a living room with great sofas and a second minibar, we did see a "normal" room and these were by no means small and were equally as luxurious, with the same fabulous bathrooms and huge windows. The bathrooms have double sink, walk in shower with additional massage jets [wow] and a seperate tub, as well as a WC in it's own cubicle. The bed was superb with very comfortable pillows and mattress and we really enjoyed the automatic black out blinds which meant we slept so well despite the sounds of the city occasionally drifting up. Breakfast was in a beautiful restaurant with an outdoor terrace and we were able to take breakfast on the terrace as it was very sheltered, the staff were equally as attentive out there as in the main room. The choice and quality of the food was fabulous. Some of the reviews I read prior to our departure said this hotel was in a bad area for seeing the sights and was too far from the main attractions. I really have no idea what the people who said these things did with their time there, because there was so much to do and the best thing was the regular buses and as well as the tourist bus came to right outside the hotel. Hop on a number 57,59 or 157, among others and the buses take you straight to Port Vell, past the Columbus statue at the bottom of Las Ramblas and straight to Parallel, which is the street from which to take the train up to Olympic hill. Grab yourself a T-10 and you can use it for everyone in your party for 10 trips, changing onto the metro is fine as one journey lasts 95 mins. We used this bus in the evening to take us the short ride to Barceloneta, which is the fisherman's quarters between Port Bell and the Mediterrean beaches. This area is a warren of streets and there are many same family run restaurants serving local food and half the price of the main tourist areas. Although we ate in Arola, the hotel tapas restaurant, we much prefered the little places in Barceloneta. Stay on the bus a little further and get off in the square near the Barceloneta metro station. There is a huge restaurant in a building on the port side of the square called 7 portes [7 doors]. This served fabulous paella and again was a favourite with the locals. From all of these places it was really lovely to be able to stroll back up the promenade to the Hotel. The seafront area was very well lit and there were always plenty of local people running, even in the dark!! The Hotel Arts is perfectly located to enjoy the ocean and beach front, yet still close enough to the main sights to be able to jump on a bus. We prefered the bus as you end up seeing more than being underground all the time. Both my husband and I used the spa and it was a very tranquil and relaxing place. The wet areas are seperate for men and women and there is no way round this, but on special request they can arrange a treatment together. The treatments are very expensive and the express menu cannot be used on their own, so your minimum spend will be nearly 100 Euro's. My husband had the Indian Head massage with mud and thoroughly enjoyed it. I didn't have such a great experience with my body scrub as the therapist seemed rushed and was a bit slap dash with applying both the exfoliation and hydration cream. It wouldn't put me off trying the same treatment as my husband though next time. All in all we couldn't fault the hotel. We never heard another guest outside our room and we were so well looked after by the attentive staff, that we wouldn't hesitate in booking again. If you are wondering about some of the reviews, then you have nothing to worry about and it there is a problem during your stay, make sure you contact the main reception and they will definitely help sort it out. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy hotel, but…”
Reviews.Author: strictlybettyboop
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at this hotel for four nights during our stay in May. This was a trip booked by his company as a reward for a good 2008 – so we didn’t pick the hotel. There were about 130 of us on this trip. We had a room on higher floor that faced both the marina & city view – very cool. The bed was very comfortable and I really did like the creature comforts – the sound system was nice, plus the Barcelona cd is still one of our favorite relaxing cd’s ( they charge you for the cd). The bathroom was good – liked the two sinks, the make up mirror was great, the shower was my husbands favorite – me not so much (too much power and hard to get out of the water flow without having to turn it off). My favorite part about the room was the window bench – great for the view, using natural light to put on makeup, etc. We had breakfast every morning at the hotel as it was included in our package – plenty to choose from – meats, cheeses, breads, salads, eggs, yogurts, cereals, etc. Had it not been included in our package we would not have eaten there – it was at least $40 USD per person. As we were with a group they kept us pretty busy every day but we did get do some sight seeing on our own. One day we walked back to the hotel from Las Ramblas – it was long, but worth it. We slept very well that night. If you want to be in the heart of the Las Ramblas area – this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Over Rated”
Reviews.Author: jetbluelou
Reviews.Content: This hotel is NOT worth Ritz prices. Stayed 7 days and it was like living on top of an office building in the middle of Manhattan. Concierge floor had a wonderful staff, but the accommodations were not of the caliber of a Ritz Carlton. The air quality in Los Angeles in the middle of the summer by the Union Train Station was better than that of this hotel. Save your money find a real 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: txump
Reviews.Content: This place is what you expect when you pay luxury prices. Beautiful hotel with the most helpful and friendly staff you can imagine. As a bonus, the hotel is walking distance from the tourist hop-on hop-off bus stop, and right across the street from the hotel there are a number of local restaurants. We're glad we splurged on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Great business stay!”
Reviews.Author: tikaye406
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Arts for 1 week for a business training and meeting. We planned an event with guests from all over EU, Eastern Europe, and the US. We received great reviews regarding the choice in venue. The hotel was fantastic and the service was superb!!...far better service than other Ritz properties I've visited. I stayed in a suite, which was very roomy (1.5 baths), had a great layout and fantastic contemporary features such as power window shades. My absolute favorite part of the hotel was the beautiful floral arrangements that are placed all throughout the lobby area. These arangements were stunning, smelled wonderful, and were frequently replaced every few days. A colleague recommended that we try eating at Arola, one of the restaurants at the hotel. It was a good choice - very chic, trendy and had delicious food. The only con about the Arts is the location. Although it is close to a few restaurants and the tour bus line, it's a bit separated from the main part of BCN. However, I'd stay here again...for personal or business trips. I know several colleagues who have returned to this hotel and enjoyed their stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic contempory hotel”
Reviews.Author: abroct
Reviews.Content: Having been here for a work meeting a couple of month's ago I decided to come back with my partner for a romantic sightseeing weekend. I absolutely love this hotel with its unpretentious contempory style and friendly service. You get very little complementary and have to pay handsomely for pretty much everything, but as long as you know that you can accept it or make other arrangements. I will definitely come back here as it provided a great venue for a fantastic weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Dangerous place”
Reviews.Author: ckgBoston
Reviews.Content: Do not go here - located directly next to a casino, port Olympic, prostitutes, all-night discos - it is dangerous and noisy. We were robbed - police never responded. Hotel was unresponsive and did not warn us not to go 100 feet across the street to Port Olympic. They accept the hoodlums as a necessary evil and a minor nuisance, repeatedly telling us "they are not dangerous"!. They did not assist us in any way, and locked us out of hotel room when our credit card would not work (we had cancelled it when it was stolen). They made no effort to communicate with us prior to taking this hostile action. It was our 10th wedding anniversary and it was memorable for all of the wrong reasons. And --- our massages were truly the worst we ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, but not a huge wow”
Reviews.Author: MTrav
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for a long weekend at Hotel Arts. The hotel was nice, but for the prices they charge, I honestly was expecting a little more. But that being said, the beds were extremely comfortable. The outdoor pool and atmosphere is great. However, I was really disappointed in the poolside service. The service was slow, indifferent, and inaccurate. And not to mention extremely expensive. Our sangria was very mediocre which would be disappointing at any highly rated location, not to mention in Barcelona. And another note on service, the rooms apparently do not come stocked with an iron. At least that's what the front desk told us when we said we only had an ironing board in our room. We requested one and it took over 30 minutes for someone to bring it up to us. Good thing we weren't in a rush. As to hotel location, if you plan on spending the majority of the time relaxing in the hotel, then it's great. However, if you plan on going out a lot to see the town and go to authentic bars and restaurants, then it's a bit out of the way. Be prepared to spend some good money on cabs. English is very widely spoken by all of the staff which is helpful for an english-speaking visitor.

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best in Barcelona.............”
Reviews.Author: JandLgoaway
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I stayed at The Arts from October 5th to October 8th. The Bar was set so high by this Hotel that nothing else in our trip compared to it. The Lobby, the public areas the rooms all Magnificent. The Staff were great they have vast knowledge of the area restaurants , places to visit and local transportation. Ozlem , Stephanie at The Club were incredible .........

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: VanessaR4
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at Hotel Arts Barcelona. The service is great and the hotel is in an ideal location, close to clubs, restaurants and most importantly, its close to the beach. It has a great architecture! Stayed on the 38th floor with a marvelous view. I definitely recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't give a second look...”
Reviews.Author: pink_orchida
Reviews.Content: We booked this on the understanding it was the best in Barcelona, extremely disappointing. It's the most ill thought out hotel imaginable. The room was dusty and for the rate it was shocking that the spa access wasn't included. They also only have seperate spa/sauna/jacuzzi facilities so if with your partner you cannot enjoy this together. The pool pictures look wonderful until you look over the side to discover a shopping centre downstairs and you are actually sandwiched between high rise buildings. The best beach front hotel right now is the W although the best experience we had was in the 3* Chic & Basic in Born and then the 4* Hotel 1898 on the Ramblas, both simply stunning, great value and deliver what they preach. The Art is highly over rated and I would only recommend to business people or possibly families that just want their kids to run around the pool all day. The quality of restaurants are much higher in the gothic quarter and 1898 comes with a stunning indoor pool and spa that is included for all guests!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: day2naman
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hotel Arts in Barcelona at the end of September this year. I absolutely love this hotel. This was my third trip to Barcelona and second stay at the Arts. I firmly believe it's my favorite hotel in the world. I have been fortunate enough to stay at the best hotels in the world including the Mandarin in New York to the Dorchester in London. I just love the style and modernity of the hotel. The service is absoultey the best; for a European hotel the rooms are also huge. When I travel to top hotels, I like to book our stay with American Express Platinum. We had 2 rooms with breakfast included and 120 Euros worth of food and beverage credit at the hotel. They upgraded one of our rooms to a suite which was on the 26th floor. The view was simply amazing as was the room. Our second room also had a beautiful view and was very spacious. There is something about this hotel and the service that makes it the best. The staff is so courteous and will accomodate mostly all of your needs. The breakfast is also awesome; a must have!! My only complaint is that the SPA on the top floor costs 40 Euros a day to use. I guess they aren't a part of the hotel but wish it was accessible to all hotel residents.

Reviews.Title: “Location great...rooms nice...service left something to be desired”
Reviews.Author: Ryan_and_Carolyn
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we waited a good half an hour to be checked in. The lobby was a zoo...and we had the impression that this was a normal experience. The room was nice and the view was amazing. The hotel is located right on the boardwalk. There's a nice hotel bar that we went to a few times. It was our honeymoon and the hotel staff did take care of us (rose petals on the bed that evening). Overall, the hotel was okay, but not what I would expect from the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “super ritz propery”
Reviews.Author: skhemka74
Reviews.Content: Super property from the Ritz Carlton - the massage parlour however sucks

Reviews.Title: “An Impeccable place”
Reviews.Author: avelautham
Reviews.Content: This truly is the best place to stay while in Barcelona. We stayed here for 4 nights and were lucky to be upgraded to a suite with an amazing view of the Sagradia Familia. Upon entering you can tell this place is maintained to the highest standard, it has a modern feel to it, with dark woods and flowers. There is a very crisp smell to it, if you are planning to decorate or refurbish your place, come and take a look here first, it will give you a few ideas. Staff here are very pleasant and accomodating but you shouldn't need to see them often, there should be no reason for complaints. Breakfast was by the pool, a very beautiful pool and very classy service. Sorry this is a short review but all I can say is book here, it is high end but it is also one of the best hotels around, treat yourself and stay for a few days! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service for a Price”
Reviews.Author: leondrataylor
Reviews.Content: First off, we used Marriott points for our 3 day stay. Otherwise, it would have cost 325 euro a night. The location was great for anyone who wants to be near the beach and the marina. It's also close to the train station and Port Veil. It's only a 6 euro cab ride to the center of town or a 20 minute scenic walk. For Starbucks lovers, the closest one is near the Cathedral and their prices are 50% higher with the exchange rate. This hotel charges for everything. A bottle of water from the minibar is as much as a coke for 8 euro. A martini at the lobby bar is 27 euro and forget about room service. 25 euro for a hamburger and 5 euro to deliver it. On the upside, the gym is complimentary and open 24 hours with all the equipment necessary for any workout. The pool overlooks Port Olympic and the grounds are beautiful. Our room had a nice view of the city and the bathroom was tastefully modern with a rain shower and porcelain sink bowls. The entire staff was kind and helpful. I have no complaints about the level of service we received at this hotel. Right now the Ritz Carlton is the nicest hotel in Barcelona until the W opens next month. We bought a two day pass on the hop on/hop off double decker tour bus and it was well worth the 27 euro. It took us places we would never have seen on our own. Barcelona is too beautiful of a city to spend your time on the subway. We also took the Fat Tire Bike Tour for 24 euro. No reservations are necessary and they meet everyday in front of Sant Juame (city hall). I would recommend this one over the others since I've enjoyed their bike tour in both Paris and London. The downside to Barcelona is the food sucks. They charged us 2 euro for each piece of bread we ate when dining. I can, however, suggest eating at the Gardunya restaurant located at the back of the La Bouqeria Market on Las Ramblas. They have a tourist menu which includes an appetizer, entree, dessert and drink for a reasonable price and the seafood is fresh. We took the AVE train to Madrid which only took 2 1/2 hours. It was direct, whereas the other one makes 3 stops. It was cheaper to buy the tickets at the train station rather than in advance based on availability. We were in Barcelona during the La Merci festival so the city was alive with entertainment, parades and activities.

Reviews.Title: “perfection”
Reviews.Author: roschauk
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fantastic ! The right distance from the centre, making it peaceful and beautiful setting by the beach. Whole ambience of the hotel very luxurious. Comes at a price however........ but for a special occasion definitely worth it. Got upgraded to a luxury apartment which totally delivered, sheer luxury. Bed fantastic and view out of this world. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chpoho
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very modern and the room/amenities are great. The free breakfast is especially good with a large variety and nice location outside to sit. One problem I had with the hotel is (a few weeks before our trip) my husband and I decided to stay a day longer so we had to add it to our existing reservation When we checked in we were upgraded to an apartment suite (which was a nice gesture) but for the second half of the reservation they made us move to a regular suite (we had been told we would not have to move). We were only there for 3 nights so moving in the middle was really an inconvenience. I would have rather just had the regular room and not had to move.

Reviews.Title: “Such a Disappointing Experience”
Reviews.Author: chawket
Reviews.Content: From the beginnning to the end, this is a below average hotel as far as service goes. Room booked was unavailable, unexperienced staff and concierge, very awkward way of receiving people...They sure don't deserve a 5 star category; highly overpriced!

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointing Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Tiz2
Reviews.Content: After being sold on the pool as an amenity a 12-year old would love, we were disappointed that the pool only stays open until 7 p.m. and was closed early for a private party the Saturday night of our stay. At every turn, when service was abysmal we were told that the hotel was very busy. And at $576 a night for a room, I agree with other reviewers that it is disappointing to be charged an extra $25 a day for wifi.

Reviews.Title: “unforgettable stay at club level”
Reviews.Author: Belgiantravellover
Reviews.Content: We had a room at club level, not cheap but highly recommended. You get much in return: free breakfast, lunch and snacks throughout the day, champagne, white and red wines, aperitifs (gin and tonic, whiskey-cola ect ..) soft drinks, spirits of international brands, koffie (nespresso) tea, cakes etc.. If you drink in the bar a glass of champagne, you pay € 14, at club level, this is included, so who like aperitifs is quickly earned. We came with an early flight to Barcelona and on 09.30 our room was not available but we had direct access to the club Where we take breakfast. Club level is on the 33rd floor (available via personal key in the elevator), the rooms are also on the upper floors. The staff is very friendly and helpful . The hotel is completely modern in design. The spacious and luxurious rooms have very good beds, B & O stereo and TV, Nespresso coffee in the room and a superb view of the city and the sea. Hotel is well situated near the beach and the sea, with numerous bars and restaurants. Metrostation on 300 m to reach the citycenter by foot is too far. Good but not too large swimming pool with beautiful chairs. There are a 4 restaurants from a good snack to gourmet cuisine. In short, not a cheap hotel but certainly recommended for the value seeker, especially if you love warm design. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here - Ritz Carlton Did Not Provide The Room I Booked - You Could Be Next”
Reviews.Author: nycinvestmentbanker
Reviews.Content: Although I have a written confirmation and a verbal confirmation for an 8 night stay, the hotel was 'fully booked' when we arrived after an 8 hour flight from NYC. I have never been 'walked' from a hotel in my life and I stay in luxury hotels 60-90 nights per year. They told me it was because of the Poker Tournament next door and because they were overbooked. I guess poker and mismanagement trumps a written reservation from central reservations. Is this really the way Ritz-Carlton wants to treat it's guests any time of year let alone during a recession? Do not stay here if you value trust in a hotel. You could be next - and fly from NYC to Europe (10 hours) only to find you can't check in to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No doubt the best hotel in Barcelona, but ...”
Reviews.Author: kceesse
Reviews.Content: This is definitely the best hotel so far in Barcelona, in terms of its location. It is located right above a beach and is probably one of the tallest towers in the city (other hotels probably have at most 10 floors, but this hotel had 45 floors). You can see the W Barcelona (yet to be completed) from the hotel, which I think will be very impressive, and it will probably boost 100% sea views from all the rooms. My review might be biased because I stayed at the Apartments, which is a top floor section of the hotel, with all duplex apartments, with personal butlers, private elevators, and all the freebies. So let's move onto pros and cons Pros - Apartments was the best I have seen - the view of the city and the ocean is to die for, especially, the windows span two floors - Great butler service - with introductory tours, baggage support,.. just everything you need they do it for you - Great Club lounge - I was surprised to see a dinner offering at the lounge, it wasn't hot, but it was good quality food - Evening chocolate and champagne turndown housekeeping with 2 maids! - The free 25 minute welcome massage was welcoming - Great location - right next to the beach and all the great dining places near the beach - Great concierge service - Free still bottled water, free chocolates, strawberries, champagne, chocolate almonds etc on a plate on arrival - Pool and gym 24 hours - Apple computer on desk - if you do the Spa, check out the outdoor relaxation area on the rooftop with sweeping views of the city, skyline and ocean - it offers the absolute best view of the city - All the customer facing staff are quite attractive Cons - Very expensive! Expensive would probably be an understatement - EUR 25 for internet is the highest I have ever seen. A 25 minute spa cost EUR 75 is just ridiculous. Judging by the room service menu, it was also really ridiculously expensive - highly recommend eating at the restaurants near the beach (only a 5 minute walk) - Don't go to the Spa - all the treatments are so expensive - I think a 50 minute massage is EUR 175! Thank god I was offered 2 free 25 minutes massages (but even so, the massage wasn't enjoyable at all - the skills just weren't there) - Small stuff that makes you go like "Is this really Ritz Carlton" - from dirty towels left at sun recliners, lack of air conditioning control at the second bedroom, window binds that don't really block the sunlight, bathtub shower nozzles that are positioned at the hip level - Very small pool with really cold water - and I agree with previous comment of not enough sun loungers - the jacuzzi is also barely lukewarm and quite a waste - Staff attitude and service could use some touch-up and proactiveness Overall, it is a great 5-star hotel with the best locations and views in Barcelona, but not without some flaws. Highly recommened

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull hotel but has some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: mtbisme
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel with superb grounds and amenities. Great view from spacious, modern and well equipped rooms. Buffet breakfast was a let down however as was the very small and busy pool area. The location makes a lousy walk to the main museums and sights through unkept areas. Really expensive for anything extra at the hotel, (example 13.50 euros for 2 cokes in really small glasses that I got myself from the outside bar)! Nice people however and good service at reception desk.

Reviews.Title: “Service was atrocious for such a beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: brodyfamily
Reviews.Content: In all our stays at top notch hotels never have we experienced such abysmal service - it was completely non-existent. We stayed in a suite and when we checked in the front desk personnel pointed us to the elevators and that was it - no tour of the room - no explanation of how things work - no directions to where the pool or work out area were. And for over 900 Euros a night it would have been nice to get a brief primer on the hotel. It was virtually impossible to get poolside service - they had plenty of wait staff - they were simply not interested in doing anything. We had to walk up to the bar every time to even place an order for a water. The concierges were unimpressive - the dinner recommendation for our first night was considerably sub-par (La Gavina - don't go) and they seemed put out when asked if it were possible to get directions to particular landmarks. Prior to arriving here, by contrast, we had a tremendous experience at the Hotel Ritz in Madrid - they were amazingly attentive and provided the type of luxury one generally expects at a Ritz property. The Rooms at the Hotel Arts were stunning and our view of the beach and city from our corner suite was impressive - but the service was less than we have gotten at stateside holiday inn's when traveling for children's sporting events. We would not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as I'd hoped”
Reviews.Author: 18ladyk
Reviews.Content: We managed to great last minute deal to stay at the Hotel Arts and after reading all the positive reviews we were very excited. The positives: great location, nice courteous and helpful staff. Nice breakfast and very nice surroundings worthy indeed of a 5 star hotel. Negatives: they messed up our order and tried to fend us off with a non sea view room even though we'd ordered the deluxe sea view room- this confusion was eventually sorted out, but it didn't leave a good first impression of the hotel. Also wireless internet we had to pay for, which i find amazing considering that its a 5 star hotel. Other hotels provide internet free of charge so I wonder why they don't offer this option.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience”
Reviews.Author: pelun
Reviews.Content: Stayed in club room 3102 and club suite 3009 Absolutely fabulous! Almost flawless! An experience far beyond anything to compare with in Barcelona! Most important: An outstanding service! A genuine concern and a full concentration on their guests! Always with a smile and no stiffness! From everyone starting at the entrance! Don’t know if it is because the number of foreign people hotel employs, but it is rare (read: impossible) to find this outstanding service at any other place in Barcelona. Bravo! We were very fortunate to stay at the club level which is an experience by itself. The immediate greeting with a warm and genuine care. The never ending smiles, the continued polite interest and the nice small conversations. The great service, knowledge and help. Fantastic! Excellent food and beverage in varied themes throughout the day. On top of this a magnificent view of the sea and the city on the 33rd floor! Thanks to all the club lounge staff for making a memorable stay. Rooms are large and very comfortable with fantastic views. Got upgraded to a corner suite which was even more fantastic. The view of Barcelona is one of the best in town! Restaurants are really good and service is excellent here as well. Again – always with a smile and very friendly! Didn’t try the bars, but they look great! Gym is perfect and well equipped. The spa is closest to heaven you can get in this hotel and the service is top notch! The view from their terrace is breathtaking! Almost flawless… yes some issues to think about. This is a hotel originally constructed for business people, so in the summer when tourists arrive, including many families, the pool area is far far too small. There are some 500 rooms and maybe 70 sun loungers. There is a grassy area as well where it is possible to lay down, but no sun chairs. If you arrive later than 10 o’clock on a weekend – forget about it! No chance! Furthermore there is ONE shower which barely functions. Not sure the size of pool area can be rectified at all, but it’s a pretty important issue to look into. Then, remember to brink a big wallet, most you pay for in this hotel is quite expensive. Example: Smoothie 13 euro, hamburger 22 euro, gin and tonic 22 euro, small bar of chocolate 10 euro, water from mini bar 9 euro etc. Fortunately Club level food and drinks was complimentary, which came as a bonus! Although had dinner at Arola which was excellent and not overpriced in my opinion. The lobster cob salad at café veranda is not cheap, but hard to beat with a glass of Albarino and the great view! Also, location is not in the centre of town. Takes about 15 minutes to walk to Born area, and 5-7 minutes by taxi to pl Cataluña. However, it’s right on the beach(es), and there are some good restaurants and great nightclubs right outside the hotel. Arts – we shall return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Home Away From Home in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: aaw380
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Arts is a fantastic hotel. We originally were only supposed to stay for 2 nights but ended up staying for 5 since it was so pleasant. The hotel is located near the Olympic Port, which is a few metro stops away from the major tourist attractions but we found that it was actually nice to be a little out of the hustle and bustle of the center of the city and it's really easy to get to (10-15 min) by metro or cab. The rooms were extremely well appointed and tastefully modern and the Bang and Olufsen TV and stereo were a nice touch. The bathroom is great and the shower probably the hardest part of leaving Spain! The service is good but not great, with the concierge being the biggest drawback. There were multiple times where the concierge did not seem to know what should have been basic information and it was even more frustrating since your experience depended on the individual you got and their competencies varied greatly. So basically, do your research so you don't have to rely on the concierge and stay at the Hotel Arts and you'll have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Anniversary Treat - and it was”
Reviews.Author: Suz39
Reviews.Content: My Husband treated me to a weekend away at this fab hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay with the amazing bathroom and shower facilities. The food was wonderful and the breakfast buffet ensured we were spoilt for choice. The pool area is beautiful, however but we had to wait a short time for a bed but in the meantime we lay on the grass at the side of the pool. The staff are extremely friendly and attentive, and the small unusual touches of pastries and drinks at reception added to a wonderful stay. We certainly would recommend this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not so impressed”
Reviews.Author: cuddly
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay in this hotel based on the fact that this was supposedly the best 5 star hotel in Barcelona but the hotel did not live up to my expectations. Very chic decor throughout, but the hotel seemed to be an upmarket hotel catered for businessmen and conferences, rather than for leisure holidays. Good location by the marina and beach, not within the hustle and bustle of the main city tourist sites. Had to commute everywhere by taxis which were easily available. Stayed in a room on the 22nd floor with good view of the city and marina (see photos). Modern and functional but somehow lacked character. Despite closing the vents on the windowsill, I could still hear street traffic, and sometimes music from local bars disturbing my sleep. The washbasin tap was designed in such a way that water splashed everywhere unless you kept the flow to the minimum. The bed was heavenly but the pillows which came in all various sizes were not so comfortable (tried all of them). Enjoyed a great meal in the Michelin-starred Arola restaurant which offered contemporary tapas selections and good Spanish wine. Spa treatments were expensive, over £120 for an hour's massage. Got a great window view of the city sitting inside the sauna!

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cool31
Reviews.Content: This hotel is now at the top of my list for where to stay in Spian, the suites are huge and beautiful, the views from every window in our room were outstanding. Look it is worth the high price tag, I love free bee's and boy do they give it to the sweets in the lobby they supply bags with it my kid's went wild. Ice blocks by the pool not to mention our morning checkout there was a trolly by the front desk with tray of pastries and orange jucie no charge. The staff friendly and attentive no matter who you are and there was U2 and LL cool J staying there at the same time the place was buzzing the pool fab some days you would have to put your name down and wait an hour for a chair but they have a large grass area where you can lay your towel. the only thing that let it down was the stians on the carpet in the room but the give you slippers thank goddness.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: champ27
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (2 boys 6 & 8) stayed here for 5 nights in July along with another family with small children. We absolutely loved our stay. Rooms - especially the bathroom - are wonderful - shower is amazing. The breakfast buffet was included in our price, and we looked forward to the fantastic food each morning. Concierge made restaurant recommendations for dinners and they were excellent each night. The pool area is beautiful - although it gets busy throughout the day so we found it smarter to hit the pool earlier before going out for the day - impossible to get a chair on a sunny afternoon. Only downside - and it's not a big deal - was that our ocean facing room was on the 5th floor, so in the wee hours of the morning we could hear the blaring music of the nearby disco. Very minor issue - I think b/c of our jet-lag from north america we were waking at that time anyways. We still rate this hotel 5 stars. In fact, we moved on to a cruise after our stay here and felt a bit let down and spoiled after our stay at Hotel Arts. Barcelona is such a wonderful city to explore - enjoy your home base at Hotel Arts!

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: ellenStateCollege_Pa
Reviews.Content: A truly fabulous hotel. Checked in at 8am from a cruise, room was ready. Large, spacious and very well appointed w/ sea view. Shower is 3 x 5 feet w/ bench and rain shower. Also a soaking tub, robes and slippers provided. Bang and Olufsen media. Only about 14 rooms per floor, very quiet and private. Right on the sea though not a private beach. Great area to walk around in and we walked to La Sagrada and Barric Gotti from hotel and took metro back. Food in hotel is pricey but excellent. We liked the buffet breakfast, amazing options and good service. The Marina bar by the pool was good too. Nice views, great chill music. The pool area has cushioned loungers and lots of staff for drinks, food. They will get you a chair, bring water and frozen marshmallows! I think this hotel is worth every penny you spend.

Reviews.Title: “very nice but”
Reviews.Author: theflattyre
Reviews.Content: for this price you need to know a few things:- 1/ rooms facing the dock. You will be awake all night with the constant hum of the ferries as they unload and load. Double glazing is not enough. Give them their due they moved us. 2/the pool is tiny. Call it a dunk pool. 3/the bar and restaurant very businessy and expensive. This is not barcelona. 4/not too far to walk to ramblas etc but this hotel is out of the buzz of the city. (this worked for us but might not for some) ask me questions if you wish on: theflattyre@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, stunning sea views, very disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: AggiUggi
Reviews.Content: Rooms were beautiful: spacious, elegant, luxuriously appointed, I think I was on the 21st floor and my view was fantastic. Limited interior public areas. Housekeeping (the rooms) was excellent, but very disappointing service from concierge/conference services/Arola Restaurant I had 8 guests there for 3 days: welcome gifts and cava failed to appear in rooms for arrival; tasting dinner at Arola was superb ... well, the food was superb (... and it’s a funky, happening, fun venue) but none of the matching wines arrived with the food - I will say that Arola made some effort to make amends on the night and that did help. I had to spend quite a lot of time around the hotel over the 3 days and concluded that the staff are very young and enthusiastic, not to mention utterly charming - but frankly, enthusiasm does not compensate for training and experience, especially at a 5 star hotel. I complained then and afterwards and all I got was ‘oops ... sorry’ - not good enough. 5 stars, but only because the hotel itself is a fantastic product

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel i have ever ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Truggers
Reviews.Content: This is without doubt a truly beautiful hotel. The staff are everywhere and bend over backwards to help. The service is top class and the location is perfect. This was my second stay having been for a few days at the end of May. This time round it was much busier but this didn't affect the level of service. I stayed in a suite on the 32nd floor with what must be the most breathtaking view over the city and coast line. My room was again without doubt the most beautiful I have ever stayed in. The decor very clean and trendy and with a fully decked out B & O sound system. The highlight for me was being on the same floor as Madonna who was starting the first leg of Spanish tour! It is of course expensive but at this hotel you really do get what you pay for. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it, but it's not perfect”
Reviews.Author: tmukau
Reviews.Content: I spend one night and two days here as a guest of our client. It is without doubt the most expensive hotel I have ever stayed in and from the quality of the rooms, food and service it's easy to see why. Almost everything about this hotel is wonderful. The helpfulness and friendliness of the staff - at every level - is outstanding. If you're a UK hotel manager and you want to train your staff in customer service just send them for an overnight stay at this hotel. They'll learn all they need to know AND leave inspired - all for less than the price of a dreary London training course. The room was spacious, luxurious, cool and calm. The food (breakfast and buffet lunches) was superb and the environment supremely relaxing. After a very early start to get a 6.00am UK flight, it was a joy to get shown to the room on the 4th floor with an hour or so to unpack and freshen up. I was immediately struck between the relaxing effect of the cool, quiet room and all that space. "This" I thought "is what wealth buys you". Everything about the rest of the stay matched that first hour's experience and was a real pleasure. It was great to return on foot later after a humid, long walk around the city. What a pleasure - and what a safe, colourful experience. And... like the title suggests, it's not perfect. Why? Because when you've paid so much for a room, it feels wrong to find everything with a huge additional price tag on it. Everything. To the point that I even worried that the pretty cellophane-wrapped bar of soap I used in my bath was going to show up on my bill. I don't drink, so wasn't tempted by the alcohol in the mini bar. But I was hellishly thirsty - until I saw the price tag for a small bottle of water. 7 euros? And a 24 hour WiFi pass cost 25 euros. There's an old saying that if you're worried about the cost of servicing your Ferrari, you clearly can't afford to be driving one. To be honest, this hotel left me feeling the same way. Whether or not the hotel is deliberately trying to price itself out of the reach of people like me is anyone's guess. All I know is that treating yourself to luxury only to be reminded at every turn that you can't actually afford to be there isn't a good feeling - and it's why I've given this hotel 4 out of 5 stars. And that's a real shame, because in just about every other way, The Hotel Barcelona Arts is the kind of place I'd love to be able to take my partner to for a special getaway. The only question is - does it really want me back?

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Flashy Clientele, High Guest Turnover”
Reviews.Author: ap_globetrotter
Reviews.Content: The hotel has what one would expect of a higher end property: modern rooms, pillow-top mattresses, comfortable pool lounge chairs, nespresso machines in the room(4 euros per capsule) , rainfall shower heads, etc.The staff are friendly and do the best to accommodate requests, but the frequent guest turnover makes it nearly impossible for the attention to detail at 5 star properties. We were celebrating a birthday here which was noted in the reservation, but missed by guest relations for the entire stay. As you know,most high-end properties write a note, and some leave little sweets/treats in the room on occasion. Many guests were staying one night in transit to a cruise ship, and the lobby (small) was always crowded/somewhat chaotic. Quite an international crowd here, with many novice American travelers complaining about small things that were "not like home". Pros: clean, nice views, comfortable pool area (though small) Cons: outrageously expensive pool/room service, too crowded with cruise ship guest turnover, felt impersonal vs. other high-end properties, didn't feel like we were in Spain, more like Miami. If you want to experience wonderful Barcelona, find a hotel in the heart of the city. If you want a sea front promenade and like to party (clubs til dawn), this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “RC Club Level is the discerning choice”
Reviews.Author: Priv_Dis_Lux
Reviews.Content: Aside from the room on the 28th floor that come with regular toiletries that were upgraded to A di Parma ones after conversation with the Lounge manager and the style of the rooms that is average for the Standing..The Lounge manager and all the people working in the Club Level all make you feel at home.. AAA Service ...view and kindness and availability.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - but....”
Reviews.Author: Rwag
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Arts is one of the nicest hotels I have stayed at. The people that support the place are uncommonly friendly, knowledgeable and accommodating. Whether its the bellman getting you a cab or taking care of luggage or the pool attendant getting you towels and water, these people are there to help and help they do. The rooms are beautiful. Our initial stay with 10 people got us the apartment on the 36th floor and it was spectacular. The breakfast buffet that comes with the room at a fairly stiff rate is nonetheless a feast. Served from early morning 'til 12:30 it has something for everyone and then some. Eggs, bacon, sausages, ham, cheeses of all kinds, fruits, juices, champagne and good coffee. The lobby has a display counter of cold waters with lemon or lime as well as jars of various candies that one can help themselves. A very nice touch. On the negative side and the reason I did not give this review 5 stars is the reception and their wifi arrangement. The rooms are simply never ready on time. We were there on 2 separate stays and in both cases we needed manager intervention to finally get to our rooms well after the 3 pm ready time. Annoying to be sure. WIFI is doled out for 1 hour a day in the lobby only unless you sign up for an outrageous amount for 24 hour coverage which includes one's room. We did get them to waive the charges on our first visit but were not successful on the second visit. Today with lesser hotels offering free computer access and access to free computers, the Hotel Arts needs to change their policy. I took away one star for these reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Setting standards”
Reviews.Author: Fomych
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. Having heard that we just arrived from Villa Padierna (Ritz) in Marbella they immediately changed the room from 6th floor to 24th with a city view. Awesome! Window-sill is soft and wide, so one can sit or lie near the window and enjoy the view with a glass of something, especially after sunset. City view or combined view is the best, as guests can enjoy the view overlooking the downtown, Barceloneta or the port, when the sea view turns into a black hole. Rooms are very comfortable and equipped with all amenities, suitable both for business and leisure travellers: Nespresso coffee machine, B&O high-end complex, iron, ADSL internet connection, central control board to manage light, etc. Shortcomings: 1. too many people using the venue for conferences etc. The pool area resembled Nikki beach - all sun beds were busy in the first evening with people with iPods, iBooks etc. 2. prices for room services aren't indicated anywhere, so you may only guess how much is a cup of Nespresso (EUR8) or some Hediard delicacies; 3. once we awaited the lift for about 10 minutes to go upstaiers to Spa. Apparently they switched off some out of 6 lifts at day time; 4. At sauna area at Spa it is simply too hot and the area is tiny. Once you come out of sauna (though with a magnificent city/port view, as it has glass walls, and tranquil melodies) you need to cool down the temperature, but air inside the main area is warm, shower is not cold enough, and jacuzzi is simply too hot, so nothing leaves but going out to the open terrace or using all ice from the ice fountine. Facilities are slightly old and pipes are rusty somewhere. In general it is a very nice hotel in a great location, close to nightlife (LCDC, Opium, Catwalk and Casino) and the beach area with numerious restaurants and cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! High end all the way”
Reviews.Author: Sangria2009
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right on the beach, and is a short walk to the metro. The grounds of the hotel are lovely, with a great view of the port & beach from the pool and an outdoor restaurant. Check in was a bit chaotic. The room was supposed to be ready at 3:00, but I had to wait until 5:00pm. Having said that, the hotel staff was extremely helpful and professional. All spoke good English. There were young women positioned in the lobby with the sole role of customer service (greeting, answering questions, directing, etc). This is a really nice touch. Once I actually got in the room, I was blown away by the view (21st floor) and the amenities. High end all the way: the stereo system, mini bar, huge thick towels, big closets, and the features of the bathroom. Even the hair dryer was nice (not one of the small cheap ones). The bed was comfortable. Housekeeping provides a nice evening 'turn-down' service, which includes complimentary water bottles with ice, a small chocolate, and soft music accompanied by serene photos on the flat screen TV. A negative would be the cost for internet access. They have a Business Center, and the charge to access the internet is 5 euro for every 15 minutes. Very pricey. Given the high end nature of the hotel, at least the first 30 mins should be provided free. They also offer internet service from the room for 25 euro per day. The hotel is located in 'party central' and I did hear some music and noise from outside later in the evening (11pm - midnight), but it wasn't enough to be a nuisance. Lastly, the carpet in my room was pretty dirty.

Reviews.Title: “This is a 5-star in Spain!”
Reviews.Author: nbm5b
Reviews.Content: I spent nearly 3 weeks in Spain traveling w. my 2 young children...we went to 7 different cities. Overall, every hotel we stayed in was at least 1star less than its "official rating" with the exception of Hotel Arts - this is really a 5-star hotel in Spain! We were a bit concerned about the location, but we found it worked anyways - the metro was a close walk away, and it was quiet except for the sirens from ambulances that passed by in the street outside. We ate in the Bites cafe for breakfast and dinner, as well as pool-side. Food was excellent. The kids loved the candy treats every day, and I especially appreciated the water! It was very hot! The hotel offers 1-hour of free internet access in the lobby, so we skyped w. my husband every night. If you're a light breakfast eater as we are, you may wish to eat in the cafes on either side of the hotel. The only complaints I had were the inability to check in early (our flight arrived at 7 AM but we couldn't check in until 3PM!), figuring out how to operate the shower (it was a bit tough to figure out all the spouts), the cold pool water in the outdoor pool, and the bed which sagged a bit in the middle. The concierge staff were very, very helpful and provided excellent directions and recommendations. Compared to all of the other hotels we stayed at in Spain, this one was by far the best!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel offered the best in service and ammenities.”
Reviews.Author: Outnumbered2009
Reviews.Content: We were in Barcelona for business, but stayed for leisure. We enjoyed every minute of our stay at the Hotel Arts. The ammenities were first class and the service was wonderful. There was always a staff member close by to help with any question or need that arose. We traveled with our two daughters (16 and 12) and they were treated equally as well. It is nothing less than expected for the nightly rate that we paid, but still we were impressed. Two tips, 1) We did not eat at the hotel except for at the pool. If you are looking for lunch, it is much cheaper to go to one of the many cafes right next to the hotel. You can leave your seats at the pool for up to 1 hour and they will keep them for you, so I would suggest you go to a nearby cafe to eat or bring a snack back. 2) The beach further down, past the marina is much less rocky and much more comfortable than the beach in front of the hotel. It's a short walk and worth the extra steps.

Reviews.Title: “Eye Candy!”
Reviews.Author: sgaleburns
Reviews.Content: As an Interior Decorator, I am always so happy to see a hotel go the extra mile with decor. This one had so many strikingly beautiful areas. The service was wonderful, and the food, outstanding. The selection of restaurants inside the hotel itself, were so varied and offered a great sampling of catalan food. I also thought the prices for the rooms, were very reasonable. I'm a very difficult customer to impress, but this was a wonderful oasis to come back to each evening, in the stunning city of Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Arts offers excellent view of Marina”
Reviews.Author: Srikg
Reviews.Content: Arts hotel offers wonderful cuisine and enjoys proximity/view of the Marina. Rooms are extremely well made and the staff service is truly world-class

Reviews.Title: “A Beach Get Way from your City Vacation”
Reviews.Author: hi3655
Reviews.Content: If you have a week in Barcelona it makes sense to take two nights at the beach and treat yourself to the Hotel Arts. Don't make this hotel your base if you want to stroll to the tourist sites though. Too far out of the way. The hotel is pure Ritz. Service is excellent. The problems I had were addressed immediately. The managers sought me out at breakfast to discuss them with me. Here are some tips. Don't take a sea view room on the lower floors. In fact avoid them altogether. The music from the clubs can keep you awake. The higher rooms with south views are excellent and are very quiet. Get your eggs made to order in the morning. Avoid Arola. Overpriced and overhyped. Great service not great food. Don't be fooled into thinking that the Spanish eat at midnight. Get reservations for 9:30. Kitchens there close at 10:30.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel with Terrific Service”
Reviews.Author: l-globetrotter
Reviews.Content: It is difficult to fault this superb hotel. From the moment one steps in one is assisted, looked after and pampered. Floral arrangements everywhere were amazing, beating Hotel Cavalleri in Rome, and that is saying something.The views from the room over the marina and the harbour were superb, the fit out cosy, despite modernity of it all, one actually felt welcomed and look after.
