The constant efforts to check that you are ok and happy by hotel staff may be disconcerting for some, but it does come across quite genuine. I had an uncharacteristic headache one day and called reception to check re nearby pharmacy, they offered to go and get it for me, which they did, in time for me to trot off to my next meeting, and just added the cost of it (with receipt provided when panadol delivered to the room) to the invoice. Fabulous hotel, cannot wait to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Unique in Barcelona , one of the best hotels in Europe”
Reviews.Author: ClaudioVeeGee
Reviews.Content: Arts is definitely one the best hotels we've stayed at in Europe, it deserves its 5 star rating for the superb rooms and amenities,the location,the incredibly efficient and friendly service at anytime. This is extremely well managed and well maintained hotel ,we have rarely seen such a professional ,caring and helpful staff (that includes spanish and international students from hotel managements schools), at the restaurants or around the lovely pool and garden areas. We have just returned with my partner from a long week end in Barcelona. Despite the recession the city remains extremely busy and touristic.Some infrastructures from the 1992 Olympics date a little . The city keeps on growing ...and remains as dynamic as ever ! Arts is the perfect place to relax, meet friends or do business in Barcelona It has the outside space, the gardens and facilities that few other hotels have ! Food is superior and comparatively good value for money in Barcelona The views from the hotel are breathtaking. We were lucky to have an amazingly spacious apartment on 2 floors,on the 36th floor, overlooking the beach and ports .Views are truly spectacular from the 19th floor onwards preferably towards the beach/ports (corner as noted in some previous reviews) The boardwalk and beach area in front of the hotel are very lively at this time of the year , with restaurants and bars worth trying . We enjoyed walking from there to the old port (15/20mn) and even to the Ramblas (where the hotel warned us of pickpockets mostly at night). We will certainly be back at Arts, a must in busy Barcelona ! Claudio VG London ,May 25th, 2009

Reviews.Title: “We were simply over-booked and asked to go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Darklangel
Reviews.Content: We had booked two double rooms in Hotel des arts through expedia for a 3 night week-end and on our arrival on a thursday night at 23pm, the manager simply told us that our rooms were not available. They made up 3 different excuses (first a pregnant lady had given birth unexpectedly and had to stay in the room, then it was a client who had been taken to hospital, last after 30 mins they admitted they had simply over-booked us). They offered to transfer us to the nearby AB Skipper, allegedly a 5 star and simply refused to guarantee us any rooms in Hotel des Arts or upgrade us or offer any form of compensation. It was the Skipper or nothing. That week-end, it looked like there was a huge conference in the hotel and there were at least 3 other couples waiting in the lobby with us who also seemed victims of this over-booking. I do not know how many people overall got affected by this organised scam. The worst part, is that we already had paid for our stay through expedia and couldnt turn around as they already had our money. The managers on duty who made up these excuses were Aurelien de St-Gall (night-manager assistant) and Nicolas Kassab. In the end, we had no choice but to go the AB Skipper, which was nowhere near a 5 star (more like 4), was definitely cheaper on expedia (Hotel des Arts was the most expensive option by far) and was undergoing some refurbishment (works on the swimming pool) that week-end. The DVDs players were not even properly plugged in to the TV sets in the rooms ! There are no words to express one's anger and frustration when the managers made up excuses and refused to tell the truth and then refused to either upgrade us or offer a suitable compensation for the damage inflicted. Notwithstanding the fact, that it was 23pm. This is not Ritz-Carlton and this is certainly not 5 stars. I read reviews here about the staff supposedly brilliant, but we have experienced the dark side of them. Would I have been with my wife and my daughter rather than some mates, I would have simply called the Barcelona police for outright theft. Be warned if you re planning to stay there and double-check especially if there are conferences scheduled.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: AZ_Sunshine33
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here April 19-24. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms spotless and our ocean view was amazing. We were most impressed with the hotel staff, however. No matter what time of day or night, they were always helpful and friendly. We were warned by numerous staff members about pickpockets in the area surrounding the hotel, especially on the beach and pier at night but we personally didn't have any issues. The hotel is pricey, but lives up to its 5-star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: SuroAB
Reviews.Content: Infrastructure: great building and impeccable infrastructure, truly five-star rooms. Metal room keys seems like an anachronism in this ultra modern scene, but it is not a big deal (even though it is a lot easier to lose than a card). The room was clean with sober but modern and delicate decoration. Just as the metal key seemed a bit out of place in an ultra modern infrastructure, it also appeared a little out of place a Tube TV (ie not flat) in the sitting area of the suite. SPA: wonderful facilities, with spectacular views. Staff was very cordial. Due to the exceptional views it is probably one of the best spas I have enjoyed in my life. Fitness Center: Excellent facilities. Service: The first thing that impressed me was that upon my arrival the staff knew my name before I mentioned it. In general the staff is very well trained, showing great warmth in the treatment and great care. It was also clear that the days of maximum occupancy the services were at the limit of their possibilities, (ie, many people waiting for the concierge, etc.). Problems: 1. TV: it is inconceivable that a hotel of this category has such a poor range of TV channels, only 23 channels of which at least 7 were in Arabic and only 4 in English (all news or business). Even within the range of pay-per-view channels the offering was bad. 2. Internet: While I understand that as a policy of the hotel and as an additional source of income internet access may have a cost, 25 euros per day seems to me like a ridiculous high price. It is not that guests are not able to afford it, but it's a bad sign from the customer point of view that we are charged per day more than monthly cost of the service 3. Finally it should be noted that although it is not the fault of the hotel: the constant sound of sirens from ambulances (hospital sits beside the hotel) makes it difficult to rest even on upper floors (I was staying on 27th floor). Personal drawbacks: 1. On arrival to the room we noticed that one of the electric curtains was not working, we call the reception for this to be resolved. Soon came the engineer to fix it, but apparently because of the lack of a spare part the 2. At departure from the hotel we asked for help with luggage and check out by phone to the operator. This was done in 18:15 pm, bell captain did not appear so we decided to go down to the reception with no luggage. At the desk we asked again for the bags. Finally we go down and ask at the entrance for the collection of our luggage. 19.10 pm Finally the bags appeared almost an hour later than our original request, while we were nervous for our trip to the airport. 3.During our stay and in 2 or 3 opportunities we were interrupted by the room service staff who knocked on our door by mistake. These minor inconveniences discolored an image that otherwise would have been impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: nytraveler60
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel Arts with my family. I was told it was great and I have to confirm it. The suite was incredible!! the views to the sunny Barcelona were just beautiful. The weather was also excellent. We love football and specially mi children are Barcelona supporters. We asked to the concierge if the could buy tickets for us, and they said that they will do their best in order to get the 5 tickets together. They bought the best tickets ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!! We were next to the Barcelona president, MR. LAPuerta. I don't know how they were able to find these tickets, since I've been looking in differente agencies and they were overpriced, so I called the hotel and was able to arrange the tickets. Mery and Carlos were extremely efficient. We had a great time at the match. The swimming pool area was beautiful, the chaise longues are so confortable and we loved the Marina restaurant. We tried Arola also and it was great too. I will really reccomend it to all my fiends.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Facilities But CANNOT handle all the customers”
Reviews.Author: August10001
Reviews.Content: The facilities are beautiful and the rooms are great, but the hotel doesn't work. There are simply too many people staying there with too few and often poorly trained staff. It takes ten minutes to catch an elevator, the club floor is cramped and at peak times, the hotel is painful to return to. The hotel feels like a very well appointed bus station. I won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: cconst
Reviews.Content: Arts hotel is one of the best hotels I' ve ever stayed. The rooms are modern and bautiful. The views from the higher floor rooms are just spectacular. Our teenage children loved it. The personnel is extremely pleasant and make staying in this really big hotel a very personable experience. The location is very convenient, as it is not in the center, but very close to it and the ride to the center is very easy.

Reviews.Title: “"great except a huge disappointment with the pool”
Reviews.Author: thepandas
Reviews.Content: we stayed at hotel arts for 7 days. the staff at the front desk was friendly and courteous. We were taken care of by Mark, who i have to mention by name due to his exceptional PR skills. Room was ok had views of the ocean and the old city. Some noise pollution with police/ambulance sirens at night. Housekeeping was excellent. Got wake up service and was very prompt. Now for the pool, it was astonishing that a hotel of its class wouldnt have a heated pool. We tried to get in the pool twice, the water was ice cold. I love to swim and it was a huge disappointment! We ate at bar marina, loved the experience the waiters really took care of us. The food was great, the atmosphere, sunny day overlooking the marina...couldnt ask for anything better. watch out for the cocktails $$ 21 for a margarita! caparenna is also very good! Bites, staff was really obnoxious. The salad i ordered was not fresh. Very bad service. Would not recommend this restaurant Bar was expensive...bottle of corona $10 we frequented the barnebieri, which is a local restaurant/bar across the street, they had bottled hogaardens for $3...a steal ! Can Majo: exceptional paellas! Have to try their catalan cream (their version of creme brulee) Gavani in port veil : Great food went there twice, nice view of the marina. Try their fish with garlic vinegar exceptional. Also their paellas are good! Great catalan cream. Couldnt get into Cal Pep so tried the next door tapas bar called longa de tapas: try their green salad delicious! deep fried shrimp, beef with foie gra, potato meat balls... Comerc 24: Hated the experience! we got the 6 course festival menu! it was ultimate tortured with horrible food...i stopped eating after the 3rd course as I wouldve hurled...the only thing i liked there was the recreated egg...everything else was disgusting! service great . Navarro on the rambla: forget the tapas go for the steak which are done very well. Highly recommend montserrat trip through Hotel arts byJUlia travels our guide was JORDI highly highly recommend him... we had a group of 11 on a charter bus...the views to the mountain are amazing... $53 per person... the only problem was that the 1st day they cancelled the trip as only 6 people were registered...they need a minimum of 8...make sure you have ample days left in case of a cancellation when booking your trip The other site seeing tip: make sure to book with barcelona city tour not barcelona touristica... for hop on hop off as the barcelona tours aka barcelona city tours is not jam packed like the other one....and both tours go to the same places... Highly recommend: Sagrada familia, Park Guell, Placa Catalunya, MNAC Shopping on the la pededrera i think thats what it was called and avenue diagonal

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Beautiful Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cmunar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a five-day stay at Hotel Arts. I was very impressed with decor, size of rooms, and location! Not so happy with hotel concerige; On one occasion, they sold us two tickets to the soccer game with different seating! They also highly recommend for us to drive up to a few towns north of Barcelona that had very little to see and do, and were not in good, safe areas!! We also asked about wineries and were told they were all closed when a few of them were actually open during holidays!! House keeping was not great either but everything else was good. The Spa is excellent - tight quarters but really good services. The restaurants on site also very good. The gym is fine and pool area is amazing with views to the sea. I would go back but not rely on hotel concerige and assume my room will not be fully cleaned every day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, impressive service”
Reviews.Author: mobo333
Reviews.Content: We stayed during the extended Easter holiday. Overall we enjoyed our stay. Rooms - Deluxe room with side views of the city and the sea. The room was spacious for 4 people (2 children) and clean. The bathroom was large with separate areas for the shower and toilet. The bathroom also had a large tub. Dining - we only ate at the Cafe Veranda for their breakfast buffet. They had extensive choices of cereals, fruit, bakery products, and hot food. Overall, the food was okay especially given the high price of the buffet (32 Euros for adults and 16 Euros for chiildren). Room service - Excellent room service. They were very attentive and prompt to our requests. They make 2 rounds daily (morning and evening for turn-down service). Staff - The staff was helpful and attentive. Almost everyone called us by our name (Mr./Mrs.) and they made sure that we didn't have to wait on long lines. The concierge staff was helpful in making restaurant recommendations and setting up last-minute trips. Location - This was the only negative part of the trip. This was our first trip to Barcelona so we wanted to see the sights. However, the hotel is located far away from the sites of Barcelona. For example, the hotel is about 1 mile away (20 min walk) to the aquarium. Barri Gottic (the old part of Barcelona) is at least 1.5 miles away. We found ourselves walking a lot or taking a taxi. However, if you go during the summer time, the beaches are just outside the hotel so that's a plus. The hotel is located in Port Olimpic. There are many bars and restuarants in the area. We only tried Gino's - across the street from the hotel. My daughter got food poisoning from eating there. Be warned! Overall, we would highly recommend Hotel Arts for its service, spacious rooms, and cleaniness.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Fault this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: llamacalmer
Reviews.Content: I stayed for four nights over Easter with husband and 15 year old daughter. We had a room on Club Level which I would highly recommend. Included you have 5 different foods on offer during the day. From 7am - 11.30am there is breakfast, which is cold meats, salmon and omlettes cooked to order, as well as the normal cereals and fruit, then there's salads and cold meats for lunch, cakes and biscuits during the afternoon, cold meats and salads again early evening, and then cakes and biscuits later in the evening. All day you have access to soft and alcoholic drinks including champagne. The food is more than sufficient to keep you going if you didn't want to eat out at restaurants. There is also free wifi in the Club Lounge, as otherwise it's 25 euros for 24 hours. The room was large with two double beds and decent size bathroom. Everything was immaculate and housekeeping staff very friendly. All the hotel staff are extremely effecient and helpful, and the hotel is in an ideal position for the port, with it's large choice of restaurants, and about a 30 min walk to Las Ramblas. When we go to Barcelona again, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Service, Location good depending on your needs”
Reviews.Author: TravelPitt
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Arts for 4 nights for a conference. They have an army of staff and if you show the slightest bit of confusion, they are right there to help. Check-in was good although just a little confusing because you enter on the street level and then have to get in the elevator to go up one floor to the main lobby. After that, it's another set of elevators to get to the rooms. Speaking of the elevators, they are very slow. My room was large and had a view of both the city and the Med. Sea. Bathroom was large and well-equipped. There was a converter built into the plugs above the desk so I could just plug my laptop or cell phone charger in with no trouble. The location is nice as it's right on the beach but if you want to see the sites, you have a pretty decent walk to take. There is a double-decker bus tour stop right outside and I highly recommend taking the tour to see the entire city in a short amount of time. One other slight complaint is that you have to pay, I believe, 25 Euros per night for internet service which at this type of hotel should be included. Overall, a very nice hotel with great service and ammenities. Would absolutely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay...!!!”
Reviews.Author: Louferris
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Arts for two nights and had an amazing time. The service is impeccible and the staff are very, very friendly. Beautiful rooms, everything you needed and very spacious. Breakfast was lovely. The pool and hot tub looked great - although didnt try them out. Location is fab with tonnes of restaurants and bars within easy reach! Walk down to the Marina past all the mini clubs etc and there are some gorgoeus Spanish restaurants especially if you love your seafood! Will def return and sad that i had to leave it all behind...!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: BearsFanChicago
Reviews.Content: We recently spent four nights at the Hotel Arts and it is beautiful. The decor, sculptures, layout -- all great. Further, the standard room we stayed in was well-appointed and was probably the biggest standard room I've ever stayed in. The bathroom was large and included a huge bathtub, separate shower, and two sinks. The location is good, depending on what kind of vacation experience you're looking for. It is right on the Mediterranean, so if you like the Marina/beach feel, it's perfect. However, it is not convenient for walking to the major sights of Barcelona -- a walk to any of these sights will take at least 30 minutes. The people at the Hotel Arts were friendly and often helpful, though the service did not entirely measure up to Ritz standards in terms of going above and beyond to ensure a great experience. The fitness center is one of the best I've ever seen at a hotel and the pool area is absolutely beautiful. As for the restaurants, we only ate a couple of times at the hotel because it is very expensive, though Bites (the snack cafe) was very good and Enoteca is good and very upscale. There are some inexpensive eating options right near the hotel, also. I was surprised that the hotel charges so much for internet access and for using the business center. Overall, this is undoubtedly a beautiful hotel, but it is important to consider location. As our trip included visiting the famous sights, the Hotel Arts was not convenient. However, if you're looking for a great hotel near the beach, this is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: aliNewJersey
Reviews.Content: we spent 4 nights at the Hotel Arts and it was fabulous. the hotel is 5 stars by all standards, great bathrooms, bedding, amenities galore and service. we were upgraded to a corner suite upon check in and the views are heavenly. the location is a little off the main walking areas of barcelona but we knew that in advance. however, you are on the Mediterranean and you can walk to fabulous restauarants and along the beach at your leisure. you can always grab a cab into other parts of town. the only issue we had was we were on a no smoking floor but smoke came through the vents of our luxurious corner suite and we were subjected to that 24/7. the hotel brought in an air purifier but it did absolutely nothing. i assume the smoke was coming from above but that should not be my problem which it was! the other hotels i stayed at in Spain did not have that issue as well as they should not.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: TravelersWith1Child
Reviews.Content: Beautiful decor and friendly staff. Rooms are spacious and have lovely decor with Bang & Olufsen TV and stereo. Pricey but worth every penny. The breakfast buffet is lovely, and they even serve Cava - everything your heart desires and more! The hotel even has two restaurants that each have a star in the Michelin Guide!

Reviews.Title: “really great servise, great brunch”
Reviews.Author: Red1230
Reviews.Content: love all the options for desert and the fact it is all you can eat

Reviews.Title: “Perfection encapsulated in 40+ floors of superb luxury”
Reviews.Author: vanessamunnings
Reviews.Content: We went to the Hotel Arts with clients and a group of consumer journalists from UK glossies and everything was perfect. Yes, it may look a little like an office block from the exterior and yes, it is not two minutes' walking distance from the Barri Gotic or Las Ramblas, but on a sunny day, sitting at Opium at the Port Olimpico, with the hotel towering behind you, sippng a glass of something chilled while the Catalans do what they do best - promenade and look beautiful - it is difficult to imagine a more fantastic place in Europe. The staff were so ridiculously attentive, one wonders if they are given a daily checklist to fulfill in terms of how many people have they said 'Good afternoon' to that day and how many children they have entertained. We extended our business trip by flying our families out there. They were made to feel equally as welcome. The interior is perfect. The fresh flowers at every turn are a fabulous, fragrant touch. The spa was a haven on the 43rd floor. The food is excellent (if a bit costly, along with the drinks). The views from the rooms are to die for. We stayed in corner suites that had sea views. Sublime. It will be interesting to see what the hotel is like in the summer when it is a lot fuller. I think I will just book and find out.

Reviews.Title: “A First Class Trendy Experience”
Reviews.Author: SheilaWestYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel and initially great location, if you want nightlife. The hotel sits majestically on top of a very busy casino in the Marina area of the city. This is ok as long as you don't need to get in our out by car, after about 8 pm. The congestion was mind blowing. Getting from the hotel into the city, centre and sites requires a fair old walk, or taxi ride, but these are absolutely the only down sides to this magnificent hotel. The service was faultless, friendly and very efficient. The food was varied, beautifully presented and delicious. Our room was a two story suite on the club class level. I could have lived in it quite happily; spacious; spotlessly clean; fully equipped ( even the optics bar ); and the views from two sides of the hotel, from our corner suite, were to die for. Expensive ? yes Worth the cost? Yes Yes Yes

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JillyMcWilly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent some time at The Arts Barcelona in July 07. It is a beautiful hotel. The room was fabulous, very modern and the views were amazing. The lobby is nice and there are a few different spots to hang out down there for a drink or a snack. The pool is fabulous as it the poolside service. It does get pretty busy, so it is a good idea to get down there early to secure chairs. Room service was very good. We had a really good pasta and dessert. It was quite tasty! The hotel is in a great location because you can walk along the sea and check out the beaches or you can walk in the other direction and check out all the shops and restaurants. There is a little strip mall type thing right across the street where we went for snacks, magazines etc. Overall, this was a great hotel, what you would expect from Ritz Carlton. I would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: bobd72
Reviews.Content: I have visited Barcelona many times and I always try to stay at the Hotel Arts...It is a great city for a long weekend...Good weather, great architecture, amazing food and a beach in the center of town...To top it all off you have the Hotel Arts to top it all off...It is just outside of the center of town but close enough to the main attractions...It is a modern high rise hotel with great views of the sea and with an amazing pool...Rooms are nice but nothing special but have great views...Best of all, it is right across the street from the beach...You can enjoy the city or relax at the hotel...Your choice, that is why it is such a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Needs cleaning and updating”
Reviews.Author: Sterlingtravelgal
Reviews.Content: The hotel exudes snob appeal from the moment we arrived with our rented car that we were looked down from the staff. For the prices we paid, I expected the service to be so much more and to lose the attitude. Our first room that we stayed one night was in need of much improvement. There were dust bunnies falling from the popcorn ceiling and cigarette burns through out every upholstered piece in the room. Our view on th 14th floor looking out to the Mediterrian Sea was breath-taking and priceless. After choking and getting quite disgusted with the filthy room, we complained to the front desk. The staff quickly tried their best to resolve the problem and did so. We were moved to a far better and more suitable accomodation on the 24th floor. We appreciated the grand jesture and smart move by the staff. Yet some burn marks were still evident and the room looked worn. There were great products from natural sea sponges, body lotions and wonderfully scented soaps to enjoy. A fabulous tub as well to enjoy a wonderful bath with fragrent bath salts. Our stay included daily buffet breakfast which was very good. The ham selections complete with fur and bone was priceless to look at. We did not sample the ham offerings;we enjoyed the fresh fruits, pasteries and hot beverages. There were some guests that touched everything, even one poked his own fork into dishes. Quite disgusting. We had tappas one afternoon at the hotel and it was very enjoyable, both service and food. Barcelona is a fantastic city and we enjoyed exploring it. In my opinion, the hotel could be a more positive experience and clean if everyone could attend to their jobs and make sure the guests come first in the hospitality business that is what its all about!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience in Europe”
Reviews.Author: Frenarena
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights using Marriott Rewards points and it was the best decision that I could have made. We took a taxi from the airport which was 25 euros and the bellman grabbed our bags and had them ready to go to check in before we even got out of the cab. When we checked in the offered us water and treats, and were very accommodating with our room preference. We had a deluxe room on the 22nd floor, with a view of the city and mountains as well as the Mediterranean Sea. The room was very spacious with tons of amenities. The bathroom was amazing, and had every toiletry possible in case you forgot something. There were 2 robes for use while we stayed there. The lights in the room could be turned on after entering the room on the wall or from the night stand in between the beds. The tv/radio/cd player was fantastic and the maid came in every night to put bottled water on the nightstand and turn the beds down. The service, especially the concierge was above and beyond any hotel I have ever stayed at, including some 5 star's in NYC. The metro stop Ciudat/Olympico is only 2 blocks from the hotel and can take you directly downtown in a few minutes. There are some touristy places to eat right near the hotel but I recommend taking a cab or taking the metro down to Barrio Gotico for some authentic food.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: hollythetravelgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an amazing experience in everyway! The staff was more than excellent, friendly, always smiling, to be honest I felt pampered in every way. The food was excellent with a great assortment everyday. The rooms were clean, very comfortable and with everything you would need to be more comfortable. They has a dvd player.. comfortable linens.. even sea salt to put in the tub!! The location can't be beat. Its right in the port area where all the restaurants are and clubs. Walking around the hotel is amazing as there is art everywhere you look.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: Holmegate
Reviews.Content: Just spent two fabulous nights at the Arts with a 17th floor deluxe room. The room was immaculate with beautiful furnishings and a spectacular view over Port Olympic ... watching the sunrise over the med from the comfort of your bed is just something else. We travelled with our two children aged 9 and 5. The room had two queen size beds and was perfectly equipt with all requirements. The bathroom was stunning with double sinks, marble bath, separate toilet and amazing shower room. The hotel is truly beautiful and the flower arrangements and Christmas decorations were gorgeous. The staff were extremely attentive. My children particulary loved the 'Cookie Man' who greeted our return to the hotel one evening with a tray of the most delicious cookies. Booked this break for my 40th birthday through lastminute.com and got a really good deal. We have visited Barcelona on a number of occasions so were aware that the Arts is a good 30+ minute walk to the centre. If you want a cheaper family room in the centre of Barcelona try the Tryp Apolo. If you want luxury and enjoy a walk along the beach with good restaurants on your doorstep, look no further than the Arts. We didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on the food. Barcelona is my favourite destination and having been in both January and December this year, it is the perfect winter city break. This weekend saw clear blue skies with a pleasant temperature of 20 degrees. Love Barca, love The Arts .... enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & staff, not so clean room”
Reviews.Author: rhp-travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel just recently. The hotel look luxurious and the location is close to the beach, though it's a bit far from the city centre ( Plaza Catalunya)but taxi is abt 5-6euro.The hotel staff are all great and helpful and they always greet people, very nice. However there are several things that thehotel can improve in terms of room cleanliness; the bathrobe was dirty, there were some black spots on the one hanging inside the bathroom, I put it down on the floor hoping that the maid will replace it the next day, but no..they actually re-hanged it. Inside the room, I also found the wall was not properly done, there are a hole on the wall inside the bathroom. When i came in the 1st day, they didn't clean the rubish bin. It's not so 5 stars... Also be careful with the nespresso coffe machine, though it looks tempting, you will need to pay 4euro to use the cafe capsule. I thought it was one of the hotel cofe & tea facilities. I will choose another hotel next time in barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely magnificent”
Reviews.Author: AbuDhabiUAE
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel, for a (2 day) conference, somehow Hotel Arts feels different than the other major chains, I guess it was the interior design, or the finishing quality, I cant point my finger at the exact reason, but I was overall impressed. Service was very good, staff were friendly and helpful. Taxies are available right outside the door, casino is right next door & the hotel is 5 minutes walk to the Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Comprehensive business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luxrus
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we found out that the hotel is completely sold out. This showed clearly on the first night's level of service and food. But besides that, the staff tried their best to keep all happy. The design and architecture is great and the location is very good, especially for those who'd like to party all night. But for families, it is a bit noisy and a little far to most popular Barcelona attractions. Make sure to close your window's airvents before you go to selpp as the noise of partying will keep you up all night (like my first night). Food is average and TV entertainment is also just ok. From what I hear, there will be a few more competitors for this market in the city very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Busy and impersonal”
Reviews.Author: THREOslo
Reviews.Content: We`ve stayed in Barcelona many times before, this time booked the Arts hotel as we didn`t know this side of town. The hotel is vey big and very busy. Our room (togther with many others) wasn`t ready at the time it was supposed to be. After four hours waiting it the hotel bar I demanded some solution. After many phone calls we finally got to our room. The view was fantastic, but the room wasn`t quite what we expected. Compared to many smaller boutique hotels in Barcelone it is not quite five star standard. The rooms are slighly worn, cigarett marks on the carpet, the bathroom needed washing and the drain in the sink was stuck. Top service and an extremely patient staff especially when it comes to Arab boys spitting chewing gum everywhere and playing football in the corridors. Renata from Oslo

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel Architecture Top of it Class”
Reviews.Author: bespoketravel
Reviews.Content: The design of the hotel is world class. My room faced the Frank Gehry gigantic fish sculpture outside the hotel. The decor of the hotel is amazing , unique and stunning. A very modern, elegant and spacious room. Fabulous views of the Mediterranean. The bathroom was huge , marble with a multi jet shower stall that I loved. Great amenities and fluffy towels. This is a truly exceptional property. I have stayed here every time I go to Barcelona and cannot wait to go again. One of the best most interesting hotels in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, but overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: erinly
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I stayed at the Hotel Arts Barcelona for a long weekend (Sept. 12th to Sep. 15th ). After staying at a business hotel in town for the prior week, it was a welcome change. The room is very spacious and comfortable. Having said that, I’m glad that his company paid for the stay because, if I had had to I would have been disappointed. We arrived around noontime on Friday, and were shown to our fifth floor room overlooking the city. The room was very large and comfortable, with a wonderful view. The bathroom had a bathtub and separate shower (ok, the shower was fantastic). The room was obviously made up when we arrived, but within an hour, we were asked three times if we wanted the room to be cleaned. On Saturday, the room wasn’t made up until 6pm, and on Sunday, it wasn’t made up at all. I can't comment on the food, because we didn’t eat in the hotel, but that was only because we couldn’t justify paying so much for our meals. The location was fantastic; right on the beach. There are wonderful restaurants right outside that serve outstanding, reasonably priced dinners and have plenty of outside seating. Further down the beach there are numerous shacks that are great for grabbing a quick lunch and a few beers. The hotel has a pool, open 24 hours, on the roof of the second floor. The pool is fantastic. There’s plenty of beach chairs, and you can get towels, ice water, magazines and apples for free. There’s a bar/restaurant at the pool, but, again 20 euros (almost $30) for a pita sandwich is not something I could justify. If you show your room key at the casino across the driveway, you will get in for free (usually 4 euros). The casino is small, but nice. The hotel is a tad out of the way, but there are plenty of taxis, and a bus turistic stop is right outside. All in all, the hotel is nice, and we had a wonderful time. It was probably the nicest hotel I’ve stayed at, but if I was paying for it, I would have expected a lot more for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: marissa2c
Reviews.Content: Our stop in Barcelona was going to be part of a 3 week European vacation and we decided to splurge for the Ritz Carlton. You can definitely get a 5 star experience if money is no object and you have low/average expectations. But as someone who stays for free in the biggest suites in Las Vegas and has experienced service at the highest levels, the hotel was nice but definitely not worth the money. The staff was friendly but rather useless. If you pose something to them that they haven't trained for in their employee manual, you can see their head about ready to explode. The prices of the food in the restaurant were about double the prices of the very good quality food you can get outside the hotel. The only food that I ate within the hotel was the breakfast buffet. Very good and high quality but definitely not worth the $50/pp price tag. You can get a very nice eggs/bacon/toast breakfast at the deli next door for about $9 + bev. The area around the hotel is nice. The beach is right behind the hotel about a 5 minute walk and there is a boardwalk with about 5 restaurants along the beach. Across the street there is a mall with a pretty good Chinese restaurant, tapas bar, ice cream stand, mexican and italian restaurants, sandwich shop, and a souvenir shop where we stocked up on soda and waters and a great chicken salad sandwich for $4. There is a Touriste bus stop about 2 minutes from the hotel that will take you to all the sites around the city and will take you to the city center and you can walk down Las Ramblas, the main drag. Definitely worth a stop is the Boqueria which is an open air market and has the freshest and best tasting fruit I've ever had in my life. In summary, the Ritz is a nice hotel, but you'll definitely overpay.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Spain”
Reviews.Author: jorgins
Reviews.Content: After a hectic seven day tour of Spain this place was a welcome oasis. The staff were the best, the food was superb and the accomodations wonderful. Our corner room overlooked the sea and the beach. It's a little away from town, but taxis are easy to come by and you can always go for a walk along the beach. I can't say enough good things about the staff - my wife lost some jewelry and the hotel went way above and beyond to help us - the most friendly and considerate hotel staff we encountered during our trip. 11 out of 10!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: materialboi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is owned by the Ritz chain of properties so you know you are going to get top notch service, and we did! Saying that, this hotel really is overpriced for what you are getting in terms of the room and the housekeeping needs to step up its game... the room would usually not be made until 6ish and products were rarely replaced. The pool is fantastic and the general feel of the hotel is nice.. no free wifi though which was kind of odd for a hotel of this caliber. On our return to barcelona before our flight home we chose to stay in another high-end hotel that had a more central location which was much more reasonable priced and wished we had done that from the beginning... nice hotel but not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic contemporary hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Dublin_IrelandMac
Reviews.Content: We had a great relaxing and very enjoyable stay in this fabulous hotel. The rooms were of a high standard, we got one wth a city/sea view and it was exactly as described in the website. Very modern hotel, contemporary in feel throughout. The staff withou fail were both very friendly and accomodating. They genuinely were committed to their guests enjoying their stay. we travelled with a 4 year old girl and she loved the pool and was treated like a princess. The Michelin star restaurant in the hotel is excellent and the hotel is on one of the tourist bus routes so you can get to see the city very easily from it. There is a taxi rank outside with taxis always available. Opposite the hotel is a marina and the restauraunts are fast food and family restarants. Cheap but also not of great quality. We got much better meals at the back of the hotel on the beach where their is a wide variety of more upmarket restauants with a good buzz. We loved this hotel and will be back. If this is the 41st ranked hotel in Barcelona, the rest of the hotels must be out of this world. This place is a real treat, ideal for a special occasion, a weekend away or a business trip where you want to impress.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Frank70
Reviews.Content: It was one of the best hotel experiences I have had in a long long time. The staff was great. They treated us like a royal family. My son 8 yrrs old. Had a ball. The view of the city was great. The food and bar was great. It is bit outside the city, but it is well worth it. The train ride to ramblas is just a few stops away. In short, food + decor+ room + staff were all great

Reviews.Title: “Pretty great, bit tacky”
Reviews.Author: EuroLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August, on holiday in a standard deluxe room. Paid €345 for room and breakfast. This is a pretty nice hotel, as I guess you'd expect. The lobby is on the first floor, which is a good safety measure, I think. Décor is kind of neutral and expensive-looking - lots of beige, grey, cream etc. Some parts of the hotel are showing minor signs of wear and tear - e.g. carpets - but very minor. Check in was fine - arrived about noon and they were able to give us our room straight away. Reasonably high - 14th floor, with decent views of the beach. I did notice later that some of the rooms on the (I think) 2nd floor seemed kind of dark, with windows looking out onto the rear of the pool-level café- I'd try to avoid them if I were you. Great B&O sound system and LCD TV in the room. Also a Nespresso machine, but the hotel charges €4 per capsule, which is kind of crazy. I know it's a top-end hotel, and you expect to pay more etc, but €4?! That's a markup of around 1300%. Watch out for the €45 CDs too. Very comfortable beds, great linens and towels. Large bathroom with separate shower cubicle and toilet cubicle. Breakfast was pretty good - standard hotel buffet in the ground floor restaurant. No eggs cooked to order though, for any egg fans out there. A lot of people have noted that the hotel isn't in the centre of town, but it's only a short taxi ride away. It's within walking distance of the Museum of Catalonia and the Maremagnum shopping mall, though. Both are pretty rubbish, actually, so don't be too upset if you don't include them on your itinerary. The museum has the worst rooftop café - recommended in the Time Out Barcelona Guide - very unfriendly service and poor aircon, so very hot. The Maremagnum mall has very few shops, and of those there are very few you'd actually like to buy things from. The pool was great - decent enough size, not massive though. A lot of children and families around - more than I had anticipated. Lots of attendants to help you find a lounger etc. Plenty of little Spawn of Satans running around, belly flopping and splashing. Tended to get busy by late morning, all the way through to mid-late afternoon. August is very hot, so there's not much point going out until later, I guess. Although it's a very nice hotel, it's got a sort of tacky/trashy feeling at times. It's built on top of something called "Casin-Oh!" and the whole Olympic Port area is a bit cheesy - a lot of naff-looking bars and restaurants around and underneath. That said, we did eat at one place - Bestial - which was very nice. Guests at the hotel are a mixture of Europeans (Italians, French, Germans - some topless by the hotel pool, watch out), and the stereotypical well-preserved cruise ship guests waiting to embark or having just disembarked. A lot of tight faces wearing sunglasses to breakfast (indoors as well as outdoors) - you get the picture.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable with great views!”
Reviews.Author: americanexpat10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in June, 2008 and we loved our room - we booked a standard room, but we had views of both the water and the city. The bathroom was large and the room had all the comforts that a Ritz should (large comfortable King bed, large marble bathroom with bath and shower, huge closets with plenty of storage room, bang and oluffson TV, stereo, etc, automatic window shades, wifi). We ordered room service a lot and the food was expensive but worth it because it actually tasted good. The pool is very nice, but get there early to reserve a chair because the pool area is not very large considering how large the hotel is. Only problem was that the safe was broken in the room and they could not fix it...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Annie92
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in a location we liked a lot - some complain that it is a bit removed from the center of things, but for us this was a positive, and cabs are easy and relatively inexpensive since most everything in Barcelona is quite close. The rooms were very large with great views of the city and beach. We appreciated the light and openness, as compared to most standard European hotels. We had a club room and the lounge and food offerings were excellent. So, in terms of the room, comfort and location the hotel is highly recommended. However, as other reviews have mentioned, the service was not up to par for a hotel of this caliber. I will say that most everyone we encountered was very nice and appeared to at least try, but...for example, we had connecting rooms with the rest of our family and it took two hours (several phone calls, plus my husband going down to reception twice), before someone finally showed up with a shrug to unlock the doors between the two rooms. On several occasions when calling the front desk or operator the phone would ring endlessly with no one ever answering. We were not there for the pool really, but it is very small for a hotel of this size and the couple of times we walked by it was very crowded. A few times we overheard very angry guests who had arranged for things that were not done properly (one person was left at the airport without the ride the hotel was to have arranged for her). For our purposes, we were very pleased with the comfort of the hotel and it was just for a couple of nights. But, if you are looking for someplace with great service that you can depend on, not sure if this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “High tech nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mandy007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights waiting for our cruise ship embarkation. The lobby is pretty and the room (deluxe double) had a nice view of the beach, was very high tech with automatic blinds, music throughout the room and a beautiful modern bathroom. Decor was neutral, and attractive. We arrived from the airport at 10 in the morning and had to wait until 3:00 for our room to be ready. This is our only complaint. Eventhough check out was noon. They had a nice welcome lounge with free food and drinks and we were given a nice tour of the amazing spa (didn't use it) and access to the pool and changerooms. The art/sculptures throughout were attractive. We paid less than 300 euros/night for the room which was reasonable. There was one 15 metre pool (nice large hammocks and loung chairs surrounding it) as well as a smaller almost like a wading pool. The atmosphere was relaxing with green apples and bottles of water available at the pool. We had to wait for a lounge chair in the shade one day. The food was excellent especially the buffet breakfast. Nicely presented and huge selection including asian choices for breakfast. It was near the beach and many restaurants and not too far from shopping (short taxi ride). Staff were very helpful although the front desk was a little snooty. The concierge were helpful in suggesting restaurants and calling for us. They have greeters who show you to your room and how to use things in your room. It was a nice touch. We enjoyed ourselves and if we went to Barcelona again we would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “5 star room, 3 star service and pool”
Reviews.Author: TwoHavlesofCoconuts
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Arts for vacation. The room was very nice and very clean. 5 star room by US standards. The food at the restaurants was very good, but not excellent, and very expensive. The wine selection is very large. The staff at the restaurants however, were superb. The hotel staff on the other hand missed the mark. Here is where the hotel lets you down. I asked for two types of pillows in the online request. The front desk receptionist confirmed my request. When we got to the room we found the request not met. I had trouble working the phone (I don't know if it was me or the phone). I called for help 4 times and each time I was told help was on the way. No help arrived. I requested a birthday cake for my wife to be delievered at a particular time in writing and recieved confirmation in writing. The cake was not delivered on time. It took a lot of work to get it sorted out. I made a reservation at one of the restaurants in writing and recieved confirmation in writing. When we arrived at the restaurant, they had no record of the reservation. When I needed help printing a boarding pass the floor attendant was worthless and gave me the wrong information. Another issue was the pool. There is only one pool which is outdoors. The pool was icy cold so if you go at a time other than high season, you may be in for a shock. The view from the pool is poor. The pool is small and there is not enough lounge chairs. Bar service ends at 5pm (I think) or at least way before I thought it should. There is a casino next door which brought in some guests you would not normally have at such a hotel. Reminded me of a sceen out of the movie "Swingers". The crowd around the casino is a bit annoying outside as well. The hotel is not on the beach, but very close and the closest I saw (about 100 yards). All and all, I would not stay there again because the hotel simply lacked the service one expects with a 5 star hotel and particularly when you are paying 5 star prices. However, if service is not important and all you want is a 5 star room close to the beach, then I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Omakok
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely stunning hotel, great architecture and decor. The welcome is very friendly and polite, makes you feel like a valued guest. The rooms are spacious and beautifully decorated, had a stunning view towards sea and city (12th floor). The bathrooms are like mini-spas. The linen is really nice quality and the cleaning is up to the standard. Some wear at the furniture, though. Several cosy restaurants, make sure you book a table well in advance if you want to dine at Arola! The main restaurant is a bit sterile but Enoteca is cosier and the food is good. The garden is very small, the hammocks by the pool are a good idea, they even take 2 persons! We really enjoyed our week-end and would recommend this hotel for honeymoon or a special week-end.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Experience”
Reviews.Author: mbgandco
Reviews.Content: Yes it is expensive and yes the lifts are slow, but do not let this distract you from staying at the best hotel in Barcelona. A few points to know:- Position The hotel is about by the Olympic Port about a 25 minute walk from The Ramblas. Some people have complained on this site saying it is out of the way and it is true that it is not in the middle of the shopping and business district. However, it is right near some very good restaurants (Can Majo is especially good) and the main sights (Gothic Quarter, Park Guell, Familia etc) are spread out so where ever you stay you would not be able to walk to everything. There are some clubs nearby and a casino underneath so in the evenings at weekends it is very busy (but perfectly safe) around the area. Club Level The Club on the 33rd floor is fantastic. Food and drink free all day (including continental breakfast with an egg station) and excellent service (even arranged for us to have beds by the pool ready for when we got down there). With breakfast in the hotel costing €39 each (€29 for continental) and drinks so expensive, club rooms are actually good value. Rooms The standard rooms are large by European standards and well appointed with B & O TV and sound system. Large walk in shower with separate bath and 2 sinks and very comfortable large bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room”
Reviews.Author: Eric168
Reviews.Content: Selected Barcelona as a destination and then looked through the top rated hotels and decided to go with the Arts - I expected top service given the price and the association with the Ritz and I was pleasantly surprised. I had a corner room with ocean view and I just couldn't get over how big the room was when I saw it. The decor is slick and modern but still warm enough to feel cozy and comfortable. Comfortable bed, great TV, excellent water pressure and rain shower with side jets, 2 toilets and a funky little living room. I have rarely encountered more efficient and courteous concierge staff - if you need any help finding your way and any advice on what to see you should use them. The pool is smallish and it gets crowded on the weekend so if you prefer the pool to the beach you should probably find a spot before 11am. The mojitos by the pool are the real deal made with real crushed lime. If you prefer the beach, get a towel at the pool and walk out - the beach is right there. I tried the "degustation menu" at restaurant Enoteca and it is an interesting experience but you have to be into trendy "molecular" cuisine. They were very generous with the wine and it was a good experience overall. There was a banking conference during my weekend and the hotel was full and yet the service I received was never impacted. excellent experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz Carlton of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Gustavas
Reviews.Content: THE ARTS HOTEL, BARCELONA The Arts Hotel is a Ritz Carlton property directly on the Mediterranean that stands like a monument to modern luxury. High tech and chic, this hotel is stunning in a multitude of ways. Uniformed, professional courtesy and meticulous attention to detail reside in every square foot of this marble and glass masterpiece. The men and women working there all look like Vogue ads or GQ models but act like true professionals. The service, amenities, attitude and property are all truly first class with no exceptions. The high-rise suites (we were on the 28th floor) are phenomenal, extra huge and very pricey with sweeping views of the city and the sea. A large living room, two TV’s, dressing room, two separate bathrooms, a wide hallway leading to a massive corner view bedroom, a full bar and more high tech buttons than anyone requires. From the marble and polished granite master bathroom (you could park a car in this one with plenty of space to spare) to the mood lighting and push button electronic curtains and drapes that covered the massive floor to ceiling windows, these suites and this hotel will definitely please. I was informed by pool attendant and the bellman that several film stars request this suite as well. We decided to enjoy a little pool side time and then the beach before a late afternoon nap and ultimately, dinner. The pool here is five star. Attendants escort guests to their choice of designer lounge seating and welcome you with several lush towels, designer umbrellas and bottles of water. On the beach however, don’t be surprised to see several topless bathers. With the horrible value of the dollar in Europe, cash goes quickly here also. Two cocktails at pool side amounted to a U.S. conversion of $56.00. It’s all relative when one considers that a suite at the Arts Hotel runs $1000 a night, plus, plus. Later that evening, while enjoying a state of the art shower system than can best be described as a private cocoon of marble with multiple and powerful water jets, (LBJ would have loved it) we were getting prepared for our evening on the town before the cruise the following day. We had reservations for a late dinner that night as we enjoyed the glittering lights of Barcelona from 28 floors beneath us. While getting ready, the extensive surround stereo sound system (even in the bathroom) lulled us with Andre Bocelli from CD’s provided ensuite. The concierge desk rang politely to tell us that our driver was downstairs and ready when we were. There were frequently so many black and midnight blue Mercedes S-Class sedans with suited drivers waiting outside this hotel that you’d think it was a diplomatic location. Admittedly, being driven around Barcelona in this manner is a great convenience and goes hand in hand with the culture of this hotel. After a 20 minute ride past the Ramblas into the buzz, sights and nightlife of downtown Barcelona, we arrived at a well established and popular restaurant called Botafumiero. A busy, elegant, old world seafood paradise. Reservations a must. Passing wall photos of famous former diners including politicians and actors, we were greeted warmly and escorted to our table. I had noticed that among the photos were Bill Clinton, Robert De Niro, Cuba Gooding and even King Juan Carlos and Queen Sophia posing with the owner. Apparently the Spanish royal family keeps a place in Barcelona and eat at Botafumiero. In a word, excellent. Had a wonderful shellfish broth, a great Cabernet and the Mediterranean sea bass. Slightly brisk but professional service with truly fabulous food. Highly recommended. Later we were driven around the sights and ended our evening at the large and busy casino next door to the hotel. The following morning we indulged in a memorably delicious breakfast amidst the gentle sea breeze surrounded by lush floral gardens and delightful service at the garden terrace of the hotel. This is one of many beautiful locations to eat at this hotel. In a matter of a few hour it was time to embark the Oceania Insignia for our Med voyage. Checkout was seamless and with our car and driver at the ready, we were off to the pier terminal for our Mediterranean cruise. The Arts is a stellar hotel with stellar service.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Do it - Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: newdigital999
Reviews.Content: Hotel has problems: Some uncleanliness, elevator problems, staff not helpful, but most of all not safe to leave hotel. There is only one entrance to enter hotel so makes it diffifult to enter or leave. Reason for this is theives and streetwalkers outside. No police to be seen at all outside. Had a sales conference here and had 6 thefts on street or room Professional thieves throughout the city. Be afraid or don't come.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, service and staff”
Reviews.Author: riaserre
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was excellent....... The reception staff and concierge were exceptional!!! We arrived around 11 am (before the designated check in time), and we were treated to a complimentary drink and breakfast buffet. We even had the concierge pass by and give us information packs about Barcelona. Our rooms were ready well before check in time. Despite being an expensive boutique hotel, the mood was very down to earth, and everyone was very helpful. My daughter enjoyed the kids club on site (additional fee), and Alicia was an excellent carer. The rooms were lovely and quite big for European standards. Bathrooms were amazing, with excellent showers... Food in the hotel was very good as well. We will definitely stay in Hotel Arts next time we are in Barcelona, despite the expensive rates. It was worth every penny spent....

Reviews.Title: “Consistently terrible service - not worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: alcocoxy
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't normally write reviews, however after having such a stay at the weekend I feel compelled to recommend to others not to waste their money and stay at this hotel. Having stayed in a fair few Ritz Carlton's and other 5* hotels around the world and in Spain, I must say the standard of service was a complete let down. Many events happened during our stay (no room available, lost bag, no cleaning of room, lost drinks), most staff were incompetant and blamed the hotel being busy, to be honest I didn't want an excuse each time there was problem but a route to solve it. At the end of the stay we were offered a free breakfast for our inconvenience, which they forgot to apply, another example of overslack behaviour. Definately would not stay in this hotel again, very suprised with the usual high standards of ritz carlton's that the resort was ran so badly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent concierge service”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoFrank
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Arts with my wife for 3 nights and all I can say is it was a bliss! Rooms are very large for european standards, astonishing views of the Gaudi church from our 22nd floor and very comfortable bed. Concierge service is the best I have ever experienced. Delta lost our bags and Mery was extremely helpful and kept us updated. After several calls we had our luggage sent to the hotel, which was a relief! Carlos was also terrific and his restaurant recommendations were great. We were booked at Enoteca and Botafumero. He also arranged tickets for Palaue, which is a beautiful opera hall. They both remembered our names during our stay and made us feel like celebrities. On our last day we decided to take a train to Sitges for a getaway and it was really nice. I have always believed that concierge service makes the difference between a good and an excellent hotel and Hotel Arts concierge is definitely outstanding. I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel unexplained charge after checkout”
Reviews.Author: rkboca
Reviews.Content: excellent room, facility and service. located on the water with a great view, but 10 minutes by taxi to central shopping and museums. charge of 6.5 euros for a small bottle of water at pool restaurant seemed excessive. unexplained charge of 52 euros appeared on my credit card bill after checkout. 2 requests to hotel for explanation have been unanswered.

Reviews.Title: “super hotel”
Reviews.Author: BBU
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Arts for a romantic weekend. At arrival we received an upgrade (without any cost) to a sea view room with the most astonishing view (we booked a normal city view room).They said it's the policy of the hotel when they have rooms available. We travel a lot but this was the first time we received an upgrade without asking! This hotel has it all : nice food, swimming pool (not huge but as located near to the center of Barcelona more than big enough), amazing views from the rooms, superb furniture in the rooms, super spa. It's an ideal hotel for a city trip to barcelona as you can combine the visit to the busy city with an relaxed moment at the pool and a diner on the beach just one minute outside the hotel (try the carpe diem restaurant ).

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars Not Enough”
Reviews.Author: Nancy_and_Dennis
Reviews.Content: It is hard to do anything but add praise to Hotel Arts Barcelona. It is the finest hotel we have ever stayed in. Our 26th floor suite overlooked the Port Olympic Marina, and the Mediterranean Sea. It wasn''t until we checked out that we were even told about our upgrade. 5 Stars were not enough to describe ouir experience. Service was amazing. We were there for 7 days, and after the second day, many of the staff knew us by name. On our second day without luggage thanks to Iberia Airtlines, the young lady in Guest Relations took pity on us, and sent a complementry bottle of Cava to cheer us up, followed up the next night with a selection of tapas. We only had breakfast at the hotel, which was outstanding. The rest of the day we were out and about enjoying Barcelona, the most vibrant city we have ever been to. One block walk takes you to the Metro, and from there, you are minutes away from everything, or you can stroll to Las Ramblas in 30 minutes, mostly along the beach. There is also a plethera of fine restaurants and clubs of all types and at the hotel doorsteps.

Reviews.Title: “YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR”
Reviews.Author: danny_morgan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not cheap but it is worth it from the moment you arrive to the room service top pool and the spa on roof unreal tv and sound system in the room bang and olsen I have stayed in a few in Barcelona nothing comes close to this. Nice area also and the view unreal.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brauna
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this wonderful hotel. From check in, where we were greeted by a delightful man named Gabriele, to the room, where we were upgraded to a magnificent suite, to the furnishings, the views, the food. My only disappointment was the spa. I had a good massage, but the facilities were being renovated, so no access to sauna etc. Also, it is quite complicated to get to the spa, but no real worry. Very nice fitness center. We ate dinner at the Arola Restaurant, which is quite good. The main restaurant of Sergei Arola is in Madrid, and this is a sister restaurant. The staff was fantastic. We had help when we needed it. I will definitely stay again at the Hotel Arts if I am back in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive hotel...”
Reviews.Author: barcelonabrat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Arts for two nights before our cruise. The hotel is the best one can get in barcelona. We had three rooms all next to each other....all great views. The service at the front desk was slow but all went ok.If you are american bring your money (alot of it)...everything costs a fortune. If you leave the hotel it will be less but not much. This hotel compares with a south beach type of hotel...open doors, european feel. ENJOY!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: legend16
Reviews.Content: From the moment I check in to the time I left there were a number of problems in the hotel and the service from the staff was extremely poor. Since I booked a club room I had access to the club lounge where I checked in and there I was told I had a no show the previous night although I had a booking confirmation showing the correct dates. The staff promised I wouldn´t be charged but of course they did and after several telephone calls they refunded my credit card. The club lounge was the only good thing about the hotel, located at floor 33, where delicous food five was served times a day along with french champagne and a large variety of wines. Later the same day the water stopped running in my room and after a long discussion with the staff I got a new room but not at the club level which meant constant problem to get to the club lounge even though the staff promised the new key should work to get to floor 33. On my last day I was going to see football and the tickets were delivered to the hotel 3 days before my arrival but the concierge found them a few hours before the game started after having searched for them for 2 days!! Do I need to say that I don´t recommend anyone to stay at Arts Hotel Barcelona?

Reviews.Title: “Utter luxury!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: EssexBarnes
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights in April and i have to admit this is probably the most comfortable hotel i have ever stayed in. If you can, go for the "Club Class rooms", truly amazing size with the the best bathroom/ shower room i have experienced. Club class gives you access to your own lounge with food & drink etc - Very comfortable. Great service and food for the late night snack i had in the 1st floor restaurant. Also excellent service from the bar staff who served us drinks in the garden area beside the swimming pool. Its the Arts every time for me!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ZMR
Reviews.Content: What a hotel. Excellent service. Excellent Rooms. The views are stunning as well. Best hotel in Spain by far. Will recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Bliss”
Reviews.Author: shinds
Reviews.Content: After having to move from another hotel int he city that we found inferior, it was a joy to arrive at a proper 5* hotel, where the service was impeccable and the whole experience enjoyable. The views from the rooms are magnificent, and worth being further out of town for. Also, the lcoation on the beach allows for walks along the beachfront on wide walkways. Hotel facilities as you would expect from Ritz Carlton, will definitely stay here again on return. All restaurant recommendations were excellent. Only downside was that they gave us an incorrect suitcase on departure that wasn't noticed until we arrived at the airport, but they immediately sent the correct one in a car and it did not delay our check in

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JamesL.
Reviews.Content: Wow, what an amazing hotel. We had a suite on the 19th floor (1901) overlooking the water and it was one of the nicest rooms we've ever had. Every detail, from the check-in, room service, concierge and restaurants were top notch. Obviously the location is the only drawback if you are looking to spend time in the city. The beach itself is just ok, with not very good sand. Plenty of restaurants nearby, easy walk to Born and Barri Gotic, Bus Touristic stop is right across the street. Yes, the price is steep but it's a clear case of "you get what you pay for"

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: schellgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband attended a conferece held at the Hotel Arts and my daughters (then aged 9, 7 and 3) tagged along. We stayed the first few nights at the Gran Derby (quite a deal) and then 5 nights at the Hotel Arts. The Hotel Arts is owned by Ritz Carlton and it just what you would expect from a Ritz Carlton - fabulous service and amenties and expensive. We had two connecting rooms, covering the corner of a floor. The view of the city and water was wonderful. Staff was very cordial and helpful. The hotel isn't centrally located, though. It is right on the water. As we went in February, there may very well be much more to do in the surrounding area in better weather. Also, the hotel pool looked amazing but again, we were there too early to enjoy it. Excellent amentities in the bathrooms, as well as large tubs and soaking showers. The girls loved the bath salts and child-sized robes. I would definitely recommend the hotel. If the price is too high, and you are traveling with your family, consider the Gran Derby.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very Stylish.”
Reviews.Author: JonnySLondon
Reviews.Content: But you do pay for it. If value-for-money is important to you, then you shouldn't be looking at this hotel. We stayed in a club level room, and it was sumptuous. We have stayed in some nice places over the years and I don't ever recall my wife looking so impressed at the standard of the room as she did here. The bed was so comfortable. The bathroom was very smart, dual sinks in the middle - one side had a separate room for the toilet and bidet, and a separate wet room for the shower. The other side had a recess with the bath in it. My wife now wants the same arrangement at home..... Staying at the club level gives you access to the club lounge. They have five different buffet spreads on per day, nothing substantial, but enough so that you don't need to eat elsewhere if you don't want to. Plus there seems to be an endless supply of champagne. The service in the club lounge is very attentive, but not intrusive. It was unfortunate that we were in Barcelona for the heaviest rain that they have ever known, and the hotel was not geared up for it. Water was leaking into the club lounge. As a result of the leaks into other parts of the hotel they had to turn the water to the rooms off for most of Saturday afternoon / evening while repairs were conducted. This was incredibly inconvenient if you were there at the time but I doubt that that is a regular occurrence. The location is a bit far from the centre of town, it is at the very boundary of walkable, and that is only if you have a lot of energy. There is a metro station nearby though, and the concierge at the entrance have a button for summoning taxis. As for the noise, we were on the 30th floor and from there we could hear the sirens of emergency vehicles, and the whistle of the policeman directing traffic outside, but not too much else. In summary, I would only recommend this place if you want to spend a load of money on a treat. You can expect to see some celebrities while you are there too.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service”
Reviews.Author: slaviucindolBG
Reviews.Content: It is the worst service i have seen in a five star hotel. they could not read our visa in the club level so we have to pay cash. after that "due to unexpected maintenance work" we stayed without water a whole saturday! can you imagine - without water in ritz carlton property!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but watch your wallet”
Reviews.Author: Flunie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 4 nights at the Hotel Arts in Barcelona as part of a corporate conference. At first I was uncertain about the location, being next to the pier and Marina as opposed to the centre o ftown. However, it turned out to actually be a plus, since the weather was gorgeous and it was really a pleasure having access to the pool, beach and pier. Getting to and from the city centre was never a problem, either by taxi or subway. I would say, though it´s key to get a room with a sea view. Apparently there is construction and scaffolding for all rooms below the 8th floor, and we complained at the front desk so a very nice young man upgraded us to the 9th floor with a beautiful sea view. The room was very nice, not huge, but with a large bathroom and one of the best showers I´ve had. In general, the hotel was great. Very nicely designed, great food and excellent service with terrific concierges. BUT, it´s a good thing our company was paying the bill since prices were outrageous. We were charged 18 Euros for a sangria in the bar, and my wife was going to have her hair done in the salon before a black tie dinner until she learned it was 120 Euros. Outrageous. The only other thing to mention is that the hotel was very busy and noisy, perhaps due to a long holiday weekend in Barcelona. Finally, out of our group of about 65 couples, 5 or 6 people were either pickpocketed or had purses, cellphones, bags stolen from them, 2 incidents happened in the hotel. Although the hotel dealt with it quickly and sympathetically, you got the feeling this was extremely commonplace. It´s a real shame that people had their trips ruined like this. I can´t believe why such a beautiful city and country can´t do something to better protect its tourists. So, enjoy Hotel Arts and Barcelona, but watch your wallet on both counts.

Reviews.Title: “5 STAR HOTEL 3 STAR STAFF”
Reviews.Author: karenStockport
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 5th-9th April to celebrate my 40th birthday.A very speedy checkin, as we were whisked off straight up to club lounge. A warm welcome in club ,but noticed almost every guest after us were greeted with a chilled glass of champagne and we weren't!! Ok we just assumed a slight oversight on their behalf and maybe they didn't have time before our arrival. Anyway ,room was what we booked, 2 doubles on club floor with a view of the beach and the city. But considering we were in Barcelona for a birthday celebration there were no extras in the room, such as a cake, or some chocolates or a bottle of champagne to add a little special extra touch. But we had booked a romance package which included a butler and breakfast the following morning but unfortunately concierge on club level FORGOT to arrange it for us!!!! O.k then, another oversight!!!! Next, my daughter was told she couldn't take her cookies to the room as all food was to be eaten inside the club lounge. Which was fine and we explained to her that if these were the rules then fair enough, until, less than 5 minutes later another guest simply waltzed out of the lounge holding a glass of wine and a slice of cake,while watched by a member of staff who simply smiled at her. At this point we were beginning to get the feeling that this was not a very child friendly hotel, and different rules applied to different people.And we have stayed at 3 other Ritz hotels, all club level and never experienced anything like this strange attitude to younger guests at all. Obviously, we did complain to management who did apologize but they didn't make up for the forgotten romance package, we didn't even get a complimentary chocolate, never mind a bottle of champagne. My overall opinion of Hotel Arts is that it is a beautiful hotel, in a nice location although slightly noisy because of the hotel's position(part beach, part city). Food is nice but not much choice on club level, drinks a plenty though. But staff, who need to work experience in the USA to learn how to meet the levels of service that Ritz Carlton guests truly expect and deserve alongside their children, who possibly are their guests of the future. One final comment which we found EXTREMELY IRRITATING was regarding the lovely flat screen plasma in the club lounge which only played dvd's ALL day. But to add to this misery it played only CHARLIE CHAPLIN dvd's ALL DAY. Please change this Hotel Arts if you read this review , to a watchable T.V before it drives all your guests insane or sends them to sleep.ZzZzZzZz

Reviews.Title: “Class act”
Reviews.Author: PIno32
Reviews.Content: Great Service throughout the hotel. Oasis in the city, Very central, great views over the coast. Fantastic floral displays. Was there with my 1 year old daughter, she loved it and the staff were so nice to her. Rooms were huge with bang and olefson (if thats how you spell it) TV and stereo system with ipod connectivity. You can also bring your own DVDs and watch them, again great for kids, my daughter was able to watch her Barney and friends DVD. Breakfast was a bit costly, but worth every penny.
