You can also eat breakfast al fresco, with champagne and all sorts of culinary delights. OK have a few gripes. First of all, they should include all taxes in everything they charge for, particularly on room service where they charge you for the service, despite charging quite highly on the items being ordered. Could have better toiletries in the bathroom, my wife hated the conditioner. Otherwise had the most fantastic experience. Definately am back in my wifes good books.... until next time. Adios.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent views, top service!”
Reviews.Author: quattromonti
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in Barceloneta just 3 minutes from the L4 metro line and just behind the best beach in Barcelona. Rooms are huge and have B&O TVs and CDs. Bathroom is very big. In the evening a lot of bars/restaurants nearby!

Reviews.Title: “Arts for Arts sake!!”
Reviews.Author: SentosaDubai_UAE
Reviews.Content: Difficult to start the review for this particular hotel. The arrival and greeting on formal name terms is endearing and the friendliness of staff genuine almost relaxing after a long journey. Reception is a dream area with the abundance of fresh flora and fauna. I stayed in room 1414 with sea and city views. It was pretty noisy being next to a casino and lots of sirens from police and ambulances all night. The room though was just a perfect size and one of the most comfortable I have stayed in. Bang &Olufson sounds and TV were superb and bathrooms divine. Now the downside of the place. The mini-bar prices are totally outrageous and the most expensive I have ever seen. A beautiful coffee machine was there, work of art but users beware that each and every tiny sachet you use is 4 Euros, each small bottle of water is 5 Euros and each can of Coke 7 Euros, totally outrageous on the VERY expensive rates they charge for the room. Breakfast runs at 30 Euros per person and BEWARE they have IVA (VAT) on everything! So if you want luxury it comes at a cost and this place costs., believe me! At the rate they charge free bottled water and free tea/coffee would be small change for the hotel. The Six Senses Spa on the top floors again is a 40 Euro entrance and includes no extra treatments. The booklet they leave in your room has no price list which begs to make one think if you need to know the price its too expensive for you? To eat in the hotel or use the bar well be ready for really high prices, but fantastic presentation. The area around the hotel has pleanty of excellent local restaurants and bars with great atmosphere, The Agua restaurant was fantastic food and ambiance. Barcelona is a great place and really upcoming. They profess that the Rolling Stones stayed here. Might be nice to see a TA Report from Mick or Keith ..??? To me though the Arts hotel is more business like than leisure but who knows I may return, never say never! Happy travels! Ciao

Reviews.Title: “not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: welltraveledA
Reviews.Content: its an expensive hotel in a beach front location far from downtown for me will be first and last visit mainly because of price and location pro:good size room,nice view,modern decoration,room full of amenities con:big hotel,little charm,low value for the price,location if you will stay in summer and like beach location far from heart of the city maybe its ok if price is not an issue for you,even is far from downtown you have pto olimpico restaurants downstairs with something for every budget and taste also walking to ramblas with nice weather is something will never forget :beach,barceloneta,port,maremagnum,colon,ramblas,mercado,gotico,plaza :its a 2 to 3 hours walk that really worth it

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: AAflyerSeattle
Reviews.Content: A beautiful and modern hotel in Barcelona. The things we loved included, our beautiful room with very modern features, flat screen TV, large bathroom, with a wonderful, large shower. Shower had multiple shower heads which is rare in most hotels. There was a great coffee machine in our room..we made espresso each morning. The privacy screen completely blocked any light coming into the room. Definitely ask for a wake up call. Staff was super friendly and helpful. Most spoke perfect English. We had a King size bed and it was super comfortable. Some comments for anyone considering visiting Barcelona and this hotel: I definitely want to comment on the pick pockets..it is a big problem and happened to one of our friends on the same trip. Watch your wallet and purse, no matter where you are. There is a casino next door and on the Friday night, we could hear the disco music until 3 am in the morning, so I would book on a higher floor next time. There is some traffic noise, but not terrible. Breakfast buffet at the hotel is great. Also ate at their small snack restaurant, I think called Bites and it was just ok. But with plenty of restaurants in the city, this wasn't a big deal. Finally, you do need to take a Metro or cab for shopping in the old section of town. If this is important, I would stay closer to Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive if pricey”
Reviews.Author: johnpoulson
Reviews.Content: Stunning hotel, exceptional quality, attentive polite staff who were always extremely helpful. No point writing about how superb the hotel is, all been written before, but some negatives: - very pricey, don't use ANYTHING in the room until checked if there is a charge, the cute coffee machine in your room is NOT free, £4 a cup. Drinks in the very nice bar, 6 people drinking half beers, water and local house wine x two rounds = £160!!!!! Breakfast starts at approx £32 and goes up to approx. £80. I don't mind spending but this is very expensive. some noise from traffic, not much. be very careful of personal belongings around town, two thefts from our party! FANTASTIC hotel in a gorgeous city, can't wait to return to Barca, would like to stay at the Arts again, but seems a waste when you spend so much of your time out and about, which is what this city is all about!!!!! ps in front of the hotel, on the beach is a great bar called The IceBar, guess what? Its made from ice, went on two consecutive nights, first time bout 8 of us then turned with about 120!!!!!! check out full photos on myspace and serach for me, john poulson in uk

Reviews.Title: “Superb getaway in top luxury”
Reviews.Author: FastFreddy
Reviews.Content: For my wife's birthday, I joined her in Barcelona for a lovebirds week-end in Barcelona. As we have experienced the Ritz Carlton experience in quite a few hotels, we wanted to try the "best hotel in Barcelona". What can I say: - The views are outstanding, either to the sea, or to the city (sunrise on the Sagrada Familia is a must) - Rooms are large and very well fitted (some lack of noise insulation) - Spa is an absolute must, the view of the city from the 43rd floor is simply breathtaking and sitting in a sauna with Barcelona at your feet, through a window is simply something to live once. - Pool is small, not tried as too cold (january!) but close ot the beach and cafés. Did not try the restaurant (went to the Gorria - Basque Restaurant and Butafumeiro). All in all, fantastic hotel, a must, even for a couple of days... We even visited the appartments on 32nd floor and up to 42nd... simply unbelievable... Superb deco, Bang&Olufsen everywhere... One of the best we've been lately... Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Special City Property”
Reviews.Author: travelingmom526
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel prior to a cruise and loved it. The hotel is very modern with a great location and view of the city. We were escorted to our room by the front desk person who checked us in ( a nice touch) and the room was unbelievable. Floor to ceiling windows with an awesome view. Electronic everything from lights to window shades to music, to door locks...all at the push of a button. The room was very spacious by European standards and well accomodated our family of four. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was great. The pool was very nice and inviting but skip the breakfast buffet, especially if you are an American. It was not very appealing and was very overpriced. We did eat in both of the hotel restaurants for lunch and dinner and both were good. It was a very nice beginning to a terrific vacation. You will love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious But Missing Warmth”
Reviews.Author: tw92
Reviews.Content: We heard so much about this hotel and frankly, were underwhelmed. Checking in was an ordeal. Hotel staff members were courteous but impersonal. The elevators were always full and waiting for them could be interminable. And there was just some key feature missing that would set this hotel apart as a true luxury lodging choice. I would say, it did not have a soul. There were benefits, admittedly. The best aspect of the hotel for us were the terrific beds: so inviting and sleep-inducing! The legendary shower was a fun experience although trying to set all the shower heads to the right temperature was a challenge!T he room views were amazing as well. We greatly enjoyed the nearby restaurants and beach. (Stay away from the restaurants with beckoning waiters. The eateries we liked best were the ones outdoors with awnings/ tent roofs.) Our kids liked the outdoor pool (still warm outside in Oct!)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views, amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: trellism
Reviews.Content: I've now stayed here 3 times and it's always been a pleasure. The first time I came here, we were upgraded and had access to El Club, with free food and drink on tap any time. That was brilliant, but the clubhouse itself was inhabited by bored American teenagers who spent most of the time sulking because the hotel's policy means they won't serve alcohol to under 21s. The thought that they could leave the hotel and drink never crossed their minds. However. The hotel is very elegant and we have always had amazing views of the sea. The service is very good (the concierge was very helpful in finding us interesting restaurants) and the breakfast on the terrace is fantastic. We had one minor niggle, once, where the air conditioning in our room began leaking. This was fixed very quickly while we were out. We noticed that the sand in the ashtrays by the lift (this is Spain after all, where smoking is a national pastime) were stamped with the hotel's logo. As a test of the hotel's service standards, we dibbled in the sand and timed how long it took for someone to come around and re-stamp it. Not that long, as it turns out.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous but stupid”
Reviews.Author: LA310
Reviews.Content: What a pity to have such a beautifully designed hotel only to let it rot away in its own filth and fill it with dim staff. Stayed in a huge corner suite with beautiful views of the sea... if you can get past the dozens of forehead prints in the windows. The bedding is luxurious but the headboard full of handprints. The Bathroom very large but is moldy, the marble is unfortunately stained, and the toilet disgustingly dirty upon arrival. The maid didn't come for the first 3 days of our stay. We complained over and over again only to have the manager tell us to take it up with Ritz Carleton. Called the RC group only to be told I should have taken it up with local management. The pool area was very comfortable with free fruit, thick towels, hanging beds, magazines... and nons-stop honking and sirens from the city below. I was there on a corporate awards event and was surprised to hear that our problems were not isolated or bad luck. Many people couldn't find their maid, and one colleague had a laptop stolen from his room. The catering of the actual evening events was almost inedible. I do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Back Street Boogie”
Reviews.Author: awsculli
Reviews.Content: This is a state of the art hotel on the beach at Barcelona, catering for both business and pleasure. Probably one of the top hotels, although as it is the only one I have stayed at I cannot compare it to others. Room was excellent, and the bathroom would be classed as luxury. Service was second to none, although the set up of the entrance and the reception being on separate floors is a bit odd. Location is great, with beachfront restaurants in easy walk. The old town is easily reached by either bus or metro, for just over a Euro. If you want to see Barcelona and want to be pampered then stay at the Arts. We shared our stay with some celebrities, so there were several fans waiting outside to catch a glimpse of the band which made for an amusing time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MauiWorldTravelers
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at this beautiful hotel, which is central to the Olimpica Metro stop, and directly across from Port Olimpica, which is full of restaurants and bars. We were greeted by name upon arrival to the front desk on the second level. Very impressive, as they probably radio from valet to the front desk, letting them know who's coming up in the elevator. Check in was fast and very professional. The interior design of the hotel is so us. Very contemporary, clean, straight lines, and gorgeous floral arrangements. The view we had was of Port Olimpic. The room was so relaxing, yet upbeat. A beautiful flat screen tv, along with a cd/dvd player/home theatre sound is there to keep you company. A master power control center (located bedside in one of the night stands) can control all the lights in the room, as well as the power curtains. The bathroom is to die for. Travertine is on the floor and climbs up the walls to the ceiling. Huge shower and separate tub. The sinks were the double "bowls" that sit atop the counter (while striking in design, it's not very user-friendly in the sense that water splashes everywhere with the design of the faucet and bowl) . Taxis are lined up and are very easy to get. We had 2 huge suitcases and couldn't wait for a large taxi to arrive; we paid 20 euro and had the chauffer drive us to our destination in an S-class.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: louiseLiverpool
Reviews.Content: was a bit concerned after reading mixed reviews but would highly reccomend this hotel, we were upgraded to sea front view and as it was my 30th birthday they had a complimentary cake waiting for me in my room!! the hotel staff could not do enough, very accomodating. The breakfast was amazing and it was lovely sitting out in the early morning sun to eat it. Rooms very spacious, comfy beds and the bathroom was out of this world, only problem we did have was we did have to ask for the room to be made up after returning as it had not been done, but this was then done immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Pretzellogix
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 2 nights. The property was very nice, though a bit far from the major tourist attractions and sights. We stayed in an executive suite with incredible panoramic views of the city and water. Probably the best view we've had at any hotel room. The furnishings were modern and of high quality, as was the bathroom (with Acqua di Parma products). The hotel staff were not very service oriented, and seemed overwhelmed by the amount of guests, and the everpresent celebrities. Our room was not ready until 4 hours past check-in time, and the staff seemed completely indifferent to this. We ordered various tapas from the room service menu and they were all delicious. In summary, a beautiful property, with very nice rooms and gorgeous views. Just needs an improvement in staff service levels in order to merit a full 5 points.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view”
Reviews.Author: crystalladybug
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my husband and his family. We had a really nice room with stunning ocean view.very very nice room. but it took us very long to check in . so many people were waiting.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed at much nicer hotels...”
Reviews.Author: SeasonedTraveler73
Reviews.Content: Everything from unseasoned staff to lack of cleaniness made our stay less than impressive. This hotel has seen better days. The decor was ok, it reminded me of the W in San Fran, but without artwork in the rooms and other little touchs...in fact the furniture was beat-up and worn-out. The shower, which I'm sure was nice when it was new, was gross and was in serious need of bleaching...I don't care for bathing in a moldy shower (something I would expect from a lower tier hotel perhaps). During our seven day stay the floor in the bathroom was never cleaned. We had an incident where the staff enter our room while we had the privacy light on and when we questioned it, the front desk stated they were having difficulities with their system and perhaps we didn't leave the red light on...which was not true, we we returned to our room the staff person was in our room and the "do not distrub" light was clearly on. We inquired about a private tour around Barcelona and were given a brochure for a bus tour - hmmm, I believe they missed the boat on who their target audience appears to be. They also directed us to a closed train station...it appears the rest of Barcelona knew the station was closed for repairs. Another stunning display of customer care was when my husband and I left early to go sight seeing. On our way out of the room, my husband mentioned to me that we were out of toilet paper, we agreed that there was no need to call and request more as this would be taken care when the staff came to clean the room. Upon returning later than evening, we were welcomed to a room with no toilet paper...I guess the cleaning staff and turn-down service were out of it each time the tended to our room. When I called to request a new roll, it took them over 30 minutes to bring us new ones...I wish I was joking. Later in the week we requested two extra pillows and that took over an hour and two calls to be delivered. Interestingly enough, we had just spent the previous week at a Marriot in Vienna were the service was incredible and the room was clean! If you are looking for Ritz Carlton service, I would not recommend Hotel Arts...they truly don't match the stays I've had in Maui or Palm Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Quality-men
Reviews.Content: Both I and my partner spent the most wonderful of weekends recently at the splendid Hotel Arts operatedby Ritz Carlton in Barcelona The service from staff stands out as being one of the best levels of service we have ever experienced! Staff members inclusing Juan and Carlos stand out for us in terms of their expertise, professionalism and sense of welcome This commenced from the moment we arrived at the lobby through to the check in experience. We also had the privelage of an upgrade to one of their suites on the 29th floor! This along with the Ritz Madrid stands out as one of our best yet and is a definate return for us R and R

Reviews.Title: “Just Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: lmcruz07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Arts Hotel for our summer vacation and we could not have asked for more! A bit expensive but I would recommend this hotel over and over. If you can afford it get it!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Arts has had its day”
Reviews.Author: SwissWish
Reviews.Content: Cracks are clearly appearing in the Arts and it is in need of an overhaul. I have stayed here a few times. Last time in January with my wife and this time on business. In Jan we went for it and booked an expensive Club Room for a romantic weekend. This gives you access to the Club floor with breakfast and drinks thrown in. Or should do. One morning they effectively kicked my wife out of breakfast because they thought she was not from the club rooms. Despite apologies and rose petals on our bed we decided not to go back. However, I have just been again for a business conference. And that is what the Arts is all about - business conferences. They don't need to be good on service as most people are not paying the bills and won't even appreciate the service anyway. Everyone gets drunk in the bar until 3am and the hotel makes money. Even for business conferences it is a rip off- the amount they charge for basic business items is criminal. In fairness some things don't change. The design of the hotel, the rooms are holding up amazingly well, the food is very good, the conciege very good and the location is nice. ( beware of the many pickpockets in the area) But the arts is neither trendy nor high rolling and there are many better hotels in Barcelona nowadays.

Reviews.Title: “Services not impressed”
Reviews.Author: breezy111
Reviews.Content: It's a gorgeous hotel overall. The hotel is modern, the view is amazing and the room, especially the bathroom, is out-of-this-world. However, beware of the hotel service, which is definitely sub-standard for its class and price range. The hotel is unbelievably stingy! The housekeeping would not refresh the toiletries or towels every day. In fact, they took away towels and toiletries, like second roll of toilet papers, we requested the night before. We have to keep asking for additional toiletry day after day. There is also no complimentary coffee in the lobby in the morning and you are expected to pay 4 euros for an expresso pouch and some more $ for water to make your own coffee in your room. The hotel staff also did not seem to be familiar with the affiliated third-party tourist services the hotel provided. The concierge sent us on a few wild goose chases because they did not know where the tour bus stop and restaurants they recommended were and their hours of operations. It's extremely frustrating when you paid so much and expected to depend on their local knowledge to explore and enjoy your stay in a foreign city.

Reviews.Title: “Great ambiance, shocking service”
Reviews.Author: Vanluxe
Reviews.Content: Great setting, fab decor, nice rooms and fun pool, but just about the WORST service i've ever come across.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible horrible horrible service, great view, wouldn't send my worst enemy”
Reviews.Author: tvarich
Reviews.Content: Dirty, two sorts of staff, Mildly disinterested or downright offensive, for Euro 2000 a night we stupidly expected someone might carry our bags, the shower might work and there wouldn't be a pile of dirty dishes in the room - the apartment suites are very tired, quite grubby and deafeningly noisy. turn down service only works on the day you arrive, breakfast sucks, the doormen run away if you're lucky enough to make eye contact, and complaints are dismissed with fairly brutal accusations of lying. The Butler who greeted us on arrival,04/10, Peter, marvellous friendly helpful - though unable to lift bags - after that the unemployable took over - there are several much better places to stay in Barcelona, including the benches in the railway station.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view but too costly”
Reviews.Author: Cyclenirvana
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Arts is an absolutely beautiful hotel. The suite room we had overlooked part of the ocean and the city. The service staff was above average. Glad we stayed here but would not do it again. There is absolutely nothing here that is complimentary which is amazing considering the cost. In room coffee costs 6 euros/pod. Internet access is 20 euros/24 hours. The best restaurant recommendations we received was from a friendly taxi driver. Don't get me wrong...this is a nice hotel. But I have stayed in better and far more unique hotels for less than 1/2 the cost of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “too expensive”
Reviews.Author: sepos
Reviews.Content: I had a corporate rate of 230Euro which is about half the going rate. I still think it was a ripoff. Hotel nickels and dimes you for everything, They even charge you for coffee in your room. Bathroom in room is magnificent. The shower is second to none. For heaven's sake, enjoy it with your SO. Gym is fantastic. Hotel location is a bit far from any site except the beach. The immediate area around the hotel is SLEAZY! It is so ridiculous it is worth looking at the male and female pole dancers right next to the hotel. I was totally taken aback. Overall, considering everything, i would stay at a hotel in a more central area.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in my life”
Reviews.Author: andyrossjohnston
Reviews.Content: If you are fortunate enough to take a trip to Barcelona and its beautiful city, be sure to stay at this amazing hotel. It has 28 fabulous apartments which have views second to none over the marina, beach and city, as well as standard rooms. The décor is modern and extremely comfortable with fresh flowers daily around the Hotel, its corridors and rooms. The restaurant is atmospheric with fine food. It has a very comfortable relaxing lounge area with modern fire place, to relax before your meal. It has a beautiful pool area with lounge furniture and hammocks to relax in and also a hot spa tub. By far the staff at this hotel make your stay very memorable. They are courteous, friendly and cannot do enough to make your stay comfortable. We had our anniversary here and would not hesitate to recommend this as a very special place to stay on your special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but beware of groups”
Reviews.Author: goodmannersUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 23/08 until 29/08. Having read some of the reviews we were a little apprehensive about staying - would we get a good room, etc. We were given a stunning room on the 27th floor with a view of the city and the beach. The hotel is truly beautiful and as it was summer we took great advantage of the pool and jacuzzi. Except for the last day, we had a good time. The only downfalls were: a lot of very bad mannered teenagers use the jacuzzi and ate ice cream in the tub with the consequence that a lot of empty glassware was left around the side. Also the children placed serviettes and plastic cups in the water. Apart from this, the staff were very helpful and the hotel kept very clean. Our last day was spoilt due to a group, MetLife, reserving at the last moment the whole of the hotel - consequently the pool was closed at 6pm (very early for summer) with very little notice (the notice didn't go up until 10am that day) and some of the staff from the group not very polite as they were already milling around guests trying to relax. Several other guests complained as well but as the hotel was short of staff, some of these were placed to assist the group and as a result the service went down a little. I would still highly recommend the hotel despite this disappointment but would strongly advise you to find out if other groups are booked at the same time or not. Groups need to understand that individual guests go to the hotel to relax and not be stressed out by so many people milling around and as it was our wedding anniversary we felt doubly cheated that day.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: Howie69
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights on our 22nd wedding anniversary in September 2006. Booked through AMEX an Executive Suite with club lounge access as under their programme you may get a room upgrade on arrival. Sure enough as the hotel knew it was our anniversary we were upgraded to the Japanese Suite on the 30th floor. This suite is fantastic, it is the complete length of the hotel with views over the sea, 1760sq feet. It has Japanese-inspired contemporary design, Spacious lounge area with built-in bar, Dining room with adjacent kitchen, Large marble bathroom, King-size bedroom located on the corner with views overlooking the Mediterranean with floor to ceiling windows. Bang & Olufsen TV's and stereo. My wife and I were 'blown away'. The staff were the best I have ever seen and the few assigned to the Club lounge always remembered your name. The Club lounge situated on the 33rd floor was fantastic with their many 'food presentations' per day and unlimited drinks. The early evening chocolate dipped strawberries went down very well with the wine!! The pool area was very good with excellent attentive staff placing your towels out for you and ice cold (free) bottled water. Several times the pool bar staff brought around free cocktails to try - a nice touch. We did have lunch at the poolside on one occasion which was very good. We only ate once in the restaurant, (as the food in the club lounge was adequate for our needs....and included!!) the quality and service was excellent. There is plenty of night life opposite the hotel with plenty of bars and restaurants. The Hard Rock Cafe is a must and much cheaper than London's! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and if you can manage the extra cost of a club room you will not be disappointed with the food & drink on offer. Have a great time

Reviews.Title: “Lazy, poor service”
Reviews.Author: mbprincess
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and the location is wonderful. The views from all rooms are unparalleled since this is one of the tallest buildings in the city. The rooms are nice and the linens on the beds are very comfortable. The service at the hotel is appalling and no amount of asking for help actually produced results. Some examples of basic requests that we were never able to get during our fours days there: having the room cleaned every day, having a coffee maker in the room (that was supposed to be there already), asking for a do not disturb on our telephone line as we tried to sleep of jet-lag (they would do it for outside callers but the mini-bar people and other staff would ring any way). We had also asked ahead of time for reservations in the restaurants in the hotel, were ignored and then not given much help in finding places to dine. The airlines delayed our luggage and even when it was finally delivered to the hotel, they didn’t give it to us. When we insisted on seeing their luggage room (since the airline claimed they had delivered it) they did admit they had bags they couldn’t identify. The bags had our names six places on the outside and two on the inside. There is no gift shop in the hotel where you can buy even the most basic toiletries and no help from the staff getting so much as an extra tube of shampoo.

Reviews.Title: “Yes!!!”
Reviews.Author: Brid
Reviews.Content: We had two interconnecting rooms, city view. Wow it was great to watch the light changing and see every sight from our 14th floor windows. The rooms were immaculate, beautiful bathrooms, seating areas and such comfy beds. Not sure about overall food quality, my only slight problem. There at the same time as The Rolling Stones, they were OK but their bodyguards were a bit heavy with one or two guests wanting photos from a distance which, in a public place, is a bit naughty.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ekartash
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Arts. I am trying to find flaws, but i am having a very difficult time. Yes the extras are very expensive, but its the Ritz. You should expect that going in. The rooms were amazing. We had a suite on the 28th floor with a double exposure. One side overlooking the city (facing Sagrada Famiglia), and the other the sea. The service at the hotel was top notch. From the bell boy to the concierge, to the staff at the spa. Everyone was at their best. The restaurant (aurola) was fantastic. We had the tasting menu, and 9 out of 10 ( i think there were 10) plates were exquisit. Next time i am in Barcelona, i am staying at the Arts. happy travels to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JASNorthbrook
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Arts is in a great location. It has some wonderful aspects to it... comfortable rooms, the bars, the pool, close to metro, easy to walk to the Gothic Quarter and El Born area. But, mind the sloooow guest elevators! The extras are pricey, but it is a Ritz, so what does one expect. The rooms are lovely and the staff is very nice and helpful. It's also right off the beach and the Marina area, which has lots of restaurants and clubs. One thing that is annoying, is that the lower entrance area is always full of cars and taxis. This is problematic when you're trying to walk out to the street and you have to meander around vehicles and dodge cabs.

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms, extras way overpriced (here is a sample price list!)”
Reviews.Author: travel_addict14
Reviews.Content: Giving it 3 stars, because for a 5 star property, the hotel did not live up to expectations. The rooms are wonderful (5 stars), the staff OK (4 stars), the restaurants I would not recommned (1 or 2 stars). When I plan trips, I am always wondering what the "extras" cost at the hotel, so here are a few prices for you so that you can better plan your budget/trip. 50 minute massage = 120 Euros + 16% tax 50 minute facial = 115 Euros + 16% tax Coke from mini bar = 7 euros + 7% tax Water from mini bar = 6-8 euros + 7% tax Cup of coffee in room = 4 Euross + 7% tax (No, the coffee is not free!!!) Room service breakfast = 29-35 euros + 6 euro delivery charge + 7% tax. Room service sandwich = 22-24 euros + 6 euro delivery charge + 7% tax OK, you get the idea! To get a sense of what things cost outside the hotel, a coffee and croissont at the cafe outside the hotel was 2.4 euros and large bottle of water usually costs 1.5 o3 2 euros. A bottle of coke was 1.40 euros. A sandwhich is between 3-6 euros usually. I would mind paying so much at Hotel Arts if I felt like the quality and service met the prices, but sadly it didn't (I could even eat my main course at the Marina Bar restaurant, it was so bland and tasteless and my friend hated his appetizer and could not eat it) Also, while the hotel is near the beach, it is a bit away from the other sites. A taxi to La Ribera/El Born (great bars and restaurants) is about 5 or 6 euros, about 7-10 to Las Ramblas. The metro is 2 short blocks from the hotel, so I used that a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: loopyloo2
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend staying at the Arts. I booked this hotel for our 10yr wedding anniversary and had been very much looking forward to our stay. Our flight arrival was 9am and although our room was not to be ready until 3pm, we checked in and left our bags with the bellboys. The hotel called at 2pm to say the room was ready so we headed back. I had booked an executive suite and not 1 of the staff explained anything about needing to use the key in the lift to access our room on the 31st floor. The suite was very nice, a little worn in places, it was a non smoking stuite and there was a bad cigarette burn on 1 of the sofas and some bad stains on the carpet, but all in all the views were magnificant and we were happy with the accomodation, lovely bed & pillows and beautiful bathrooms but watch out for the mini bar - very expensive 8€ for a bottle of beer! The service in their Bites restaurant is appalling, the staff just generally ignored us and we had to keep asking to be served, the food was OK but on other occasions when we just wanted coffee, by the time it arrived it was cold. The service in their bar is quick, but they forget what you have had to drink and ask you to confirm what you had when you get the bill!! Not 1 of the staff informed us of the executive club lounge that we had complimentary access to, we found this out too late on in the stay. Nobody told us anything about the hotel regarding the spa or the pool and we just generally felt that after spending a great deal of money that the service really let down our stay and although we loved Barcelona we would not stay at the Arts again.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton Service”
Reviews.Author: carpetdave
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights in a sea-view room 25th floor although the rooms are beginning to look marginally tired the facilities are fab-bathroom excellent and room quite spacious We had our 4 year old daughter with us and the staff were really first class-food was good tho expensive If not with family would probably stay in town but all in all a great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hotel Arts”
Reviews.Author: princeharry
Reviews.Content: We just spent three nights at Hotel Arts. It is a great hotel. The service was extremely attentive. Every request was catered to promptly. We did not eat there except for breakfast but the breakfasts were very good. We spent time at the pool which was beautiful although a little small for the hotel. The only negative is that the hotel is a little out of the way. you are about a 2 miles from the good restaurants. But you are close to the beach

Reviews.Title: “A Very Average Stay - Overstressed Visit”
Reviews.Author: bhackehs
Reviews.Content: After our recent trip to Valencia down the coast from Barcelona, we decided to take a visit to Barcelona and to stay at the Hotel Arts. It was a modern-luxury hotel, which was fine, but the hotel and the conferences they hosted were out of control and mis-managed. Note About Our Stay: A MASSIVE business conference was going on in the hotel. The attendees were extremely rude, all yelling on their cell phones, conducting meetings in the hallway and elevators, and from what numerous staff had told us, many weren’t even staying at the hotel, but were taking up pool chairs and all the seats at the restaurants, which made all the paying customers extremely angry. The Hotel: The 42 story tower was built in occasion for the 1992 Barcelona Olympic games, and with its sister, are arguably the most visible landmarks in Barcelona. Entering the hotel from a busy street, the porte-cochere had fountains and waterfalls on the right hand side, with a small lobby, with a decadent food store there. Lobby: Going up the elevator to the main lobby, the doors open and we cant even see the floor because of all the bankers and the girls sending them off to their next appointment. However, check-in was fast and easy, with a personal tour of the property with the check-in manager. The lobby, from what I could see, was nicely laid out, with check-in and concierge in the front, with some deep seating toward the back. Room: Taking the elevator up to the 27th floor, we arrived on our floor and to our room overlooking some beaches, the port, the old city, and Montjuic; a very pretty view! In exploring my room, we noticed all of the high-tech touches of the room. Everything electrical in the room can be controlled from the bedside and door side console. The room was of average size and average furniture for a Ritz, but one special thing was a seating area near the panoramic window, which had a heavy lowering shade to keep out the sun and sounds. The bed was very comfortable and had very nice sheets. The bathroom was huge with a separate bath, separate bidet and toilet, and a great separate shower. Very nice indeed. Fitness Center and Spa: The fitness center is located on a lower part of the hotel, after a tricky trek. I never used the fitness center, but saw it, and it looked of a relatively small size for the hotel. However the Spa is located on the top three floors of the hotel, and is brought to us by The Six Senses Group. In a tour of the Spa, a very nice locker room and relaxation area with steam rooms and balconies overlooking the Mediterranean. I imagine it was very nice, and a plus, rarely had any conference attendees. Dining: We dined only at the restaurant off the lobby, because we could never find a seat at a restaurant at the hotel. The restaurant was nice, again the work staff was very short of people, but the food quality was very nice and tasty. Tip: the shops at the Port Olimpic (right next to the hotel) are extremely nice to dine at and are a great way to see some of Barcelona. Cost: For the cost we paid, I should have known something was going on, for a high-200 price for a deluxe room, which seemed to good to be true for a Ritz, and now I see why. Otherwise, like everything else now-a-days, most food were in the high 20 euros. Service: This is the only thing that would bring me back to the hotel. During our stay, we met the Director of Rooms, Sandra, and she was very gracious, insisting to meet us and get our input on the conference situation. She further assured us that the hotel has not invited back many of the conferences for next year for the reason many other reviewers have noticed. Very similarly, Stephanie at the front was very assisting to our stay. This would be one of the only reasons I would return. Overall: A very average stay, while we had some horrible times, we also had some great times and were treated with decency by many people of the staff, who were visibly tired from the conference, looking like many of the over-worked and yelled at airline employees. Now I feel their pain. The service and the rooms would be the only reason I would return. It is very different than many Ritz-Carlton's.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, needs a little work”
Reviews.Author: bmarric00
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Arts for 2 days at the end of June 2007 before a Mediterranean cruise. First impressions: The hotel and its grounds are beautiful. While the lobby was almost always busy and crowded, as other reviews have noted, my check-in is was fast and efficient. The staff at the front desk were very courteous and professional. We were even offered ice water with mint as we checked in. It was a little noisy, but only in the lobby. I did not notice any noise in my room or anywhere else on hotel property. The room was clean and very well maintained. The decor is very modern, which may not be to everyone's taste. I thought it was very well done. You can definitely skip the hotel breakfast buffet. Service was almost non-existent there, and the food was below average at best. However, service in the lounge was excellent. I still give this hotel an Excellent rating based on the beauty of the hotel, the excellent staff and the unbeatable views.

Reviews.Title: “hotel out of contol”
Reviews.Author: JJK58
Reviews.Content: stayed for three nights.had booked a suite and a room at 750 and 680 euros per day respectively.definitely not worth it.what a huge disapointment. quality is just not there.hotel is bursting at seams with a constant train station atmosphere and noisy queues in the lobby.it was clear that the hotel was filled with clients on discounted packages .food quality is bad,room service awful and the breakfast is really more of an unpleasant three star experience.check in completely inefficient and way too long and the club floor staff is frankly incompetent,young and inexperienced .bathroom towels are a disgrace as they are shredded and should have been retired a long time ago.in general housekeeping is poor and you get an impression of unfinished cleaning. it is now obvious that ritz-carlton does not play in the same league as four seasons!

Reviews.Title: “Sadly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: annuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel a few weeks ago and were so looking forward to this top rated hotel .Unfortunately it was over-run by conferences, and as a couple on holiday for 3 nights felt a little swamped by all the delegates-200 of them!!. The rooms were big, and had beautiful bathrooms, Breakfast were cold.. (ask to see the menu for alternative eggs!!)! The pool was lovely, especially the double hammocks!. Complimentary water and fruit, and pool service excellent. On a negative side check in was poor, and no facs for a late check out! This hotel is well situated but makes its money on delegates from banks and other companies etc..There were some really loud "bankers" whilst we were there.. on a "freebie" no doubt...the hotel seemed well out of their league!. On our return the hotel contacted me for feedback, and then the manager who was very apologetic,this was impressive. This hotel is fully booked apparently till Sept!!.. no doubt with even more bankers!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Arts Lovely Hotel But Service Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Karen1769
Reviews.Content: Spent last weekend at the Arts Hotel for a special occasion. For a deluxe 5 star hotel, I was disappointed at the service. When I arrived, the conceirge took my travel case for me which would be delivered to my room after check-in. However, an hour later and a telephone call to the conceirge desk, my case arrived. I just wanted to throw on a bikini and grab my suntan lotion! For the both days I was there, I had to call housekeeping to come and clean my room. On the first day, after spending a busy day, I just wanted to jump in the shower. When I returned back to the room, all the towels had been left on a pile on the floor and the room remained untouched. Needless to say, a maid did come to the room after I had been told that they were busy doing turndown for the evening. I just wanted some fresh towels nevermind about turndown!!. That evening we asked the conceirge to make a dinner reservation for that evening and also one for the Sunday evening as it was a special occasion. On the Sunday, we didn't have a clue where we were going so asked the conceirge desk, which restaurant we had been booked into only to find to our dismay, that nothing had been booked. The lady on the desk then started to ring some restaurants only to find them booked (no surprises at such short notice). By the third restaurant she had called, it was then discovered that a reservation had indeed been made for us but the lady who handled our request the previous evening had failed to tell anyone about it. On returning back to our room after the fiasco with the restaurant reservation, the room had not been cleaned again. Once I can let it go but for a second time, I was annoyed as hell only to be asked that was I sure that I left the light on the door for the room to be cleaned. For those who haven't stayed at Arts before, they do have a simple system. By inside of the door, there are two switches - one to clean the room, one for privacy. Not rocket science but when I complained to the check-out desk that all was not well with our stay, I was told that the switches can be confusing!! Our room was on the 6th floor which you could hear a lot of traffic noise - probably not a problem if your room was higher up. That being said, the rooms are fab, the spa is good with great views from the 43rd floor but expensive. The service round the swimming pool is good. Remember to take ID if you go to the casino next door Its a real shame that we had the problems that we did otherwise probably couldn't fault the hotel but for the money we paid and the reputation of this hotel, it was rather disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly beautiful and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Enjoythemoment
Reviews.Content: This is my kind of hotel. Helpful and very friendly service from the moment I walked in through the stay. The rooms are very, very compfortable, high tech, beautifully designed. Our room was a corner room with a view of the city, cathedral and marina on the other side. This and Portrait Suites in Rome were the top hotels in our trip to Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Arts: South Beach Wannabe”
Reviews.Author: Name_Taken_2
Reviews.Content: I was really disappointed with the Hotel Arts. It seems to be over-run with a strange stream of both party-ready tourists and business conventioneers. As a result, my room was worn. The shutters were broken, the carpet stained, and the wall coverings faded. While the room was “modern”, it lacked both distinction and ambience. The service was really haphazard. The staff appeared overwhelmed with guest demands, which to be fair, were constant. One had to be really patient to get service. So often, the phone bounced to other areas. When contact was made, the staff was very, very nice and tried to be as helpful as possible. The pool was small, but very trendy and nicely placed overlooking the sea. The hotel has a “hip” factor. However, my colleagues and I agreed that “cheesy” was a more apt description of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great, great, great”
Reviews.Author: KerryLondon
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights - negative and positive points listed below: Positives. 1) Great size rooms with huge bathrooms overlooking the city and beach - try to get a room high up overlooking the beach. I liked the fact that each room had it's own iron and iron board (not many do). 2) Beach is on your doorstep 3) Pool is small but very charming with great sun beds - staff provide towels, water and fruit and walk around serving all day 4) Lots of choice from the breakfast area 5) Reception staff very helpful 6) A few nice restaurants located along the beach front and some nice bars Negatives. 1) I got a very good rate but I wouldn’t pay the normal price which I think is too expensive 2) Breakfast wasn't included and was €28 per person - very expensive 3) It's a bit of a walk to the old town but only 2-3 stops by metro and costs €1.25 for a one way journey 4) Mini bar can be expensive (ie, €8 for a bottle of beer) 5) Some of rude Americans who look down their nose at anyone wearing flip flops Overall I would def stay at this hotel again (even with the rude Americans). I really loved it. It’s very clean, staff are very helpful and has a good location on the beach – I really couldn’t of asked for a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but expensive compared to Grand Marina”
Reviews.Author: czaway
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, stayed a couple of times now. Really like the executive floor with the Club Lounge.Club lounge offers good range of snacks and drinks Rooms very nice but just starting to show a bit of wear and tear. Value OK for 2 people looking for luxury. Stayed with 4 kids and needed 3 rooms which gets pricey. No real negatives except lifts which can take ages when hotel busy. Thought Hotel Grand Marina was 95% as good for 50% of the price as had better value larger rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MangoLondon
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, beautiful views of the marina. The reception staff are very helpful and friendly. The concierge was rude and unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “wow the view”
Reviews.Author: jonesinthedam
Reviews.Content: This is a simple review.. I rate this as one of the best hotel experiences i have ever had... We got a room up high in the tower and th e view was fantastic...... The best service i have every found. and the staff were both efficient and beautiful. not much more that that!

Reviews.Title: “Best in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: agro
Reviews.Content: Having been previously at the "Juan Carlos" and "Majestic" in Barcelona, and in many other 5 star hotels in Europe, I can safely say the "Hotel Arts" is the best choice in Barcelona. Modern interiors, spacious rooms with sea view, amazing gym and spa, this hotel is faultless. The only problem would be, of course, the price! I went there for a business trip, so my employer paid for it. but I would still go if I could find a good offer on internet.

Reviews.Title: “spectacular choice”
Reviews.Author: hobbesmanc
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful spring bank holiday staying at the Arts. Maybe we were lucky because the hotel wasn't that busy but we had an amazing stay and were treated like royalty by all the staff we encountered. From the limo pick-up at the airport to the final check-out all the staff were super friendly and professional throughout. The location is a bit away from the traditional Barcalona sights but they are easly reachable by taxi in 5 mins or a shortish walk but there are attractions around the beaches and marina themselves including some great restaurants and bars. The hotel architecture is quite brutally modern but the post-industrial chic of the exterior is softened inside by stunning fresh flowers, copious amounts of art and lots of water features. Our room on the 26th floor had amazing views over the Med and was furnished in a cool, contempory way. The bathroom was great with the best power shower I have used. Breakfast outside was a simple but high quality buffet although there was a shockingly priced a la carte menu. As usual in Spain the bacon was crap and the toaster pathetic though!! For this level of service and price though it would have been nice to have eggs/omlettes etc made fresh. The pool area was great with the most fabulous two people hammocks to slumber in the sun whilst the gorgeous staff all in black bring you chilled lime sodas and fresh fruit. Great experience. The only problem was that we loved the hotel so much that we really didn't get to see a lot of the city!

Reviews.Title: “Faboulous rooms&view”
Reviews.Author: hedonisticepicure
Reviews.Content: Glad we booked this place, because it is a fabulous hotel, very modern and clean with friendly staff in all areas and we did get the requested sea view floor. Room was excellent; large and airy, huge bathroom. It was described as a superior room but I think a superior room is their basic room. The Olympic harbour and the beach(allthough there is a great swimming pool) is right next to the hotel and the city centre(avoid the Ramblas!!) is a 20 minute walk(or 5 minutes by taxi).Overall it was a fabulous weekend break and we wouldnt hesitate to stay at the Arts again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, some weaknesses”
Reviews.Author: Musken
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long week-end with family in April. Had booked an executive suite which was great, though the bed was far too soft and the prices for drinks from the minibar a joke even in a 5 star hotel (the latter solved by bringing stuff from outside supermarked which we placed in the minibar). Some service weaknesses (very slow delivery of suitcases to room after arrival, distubing us even though do not disturb-sign was on etc.) but very good concierge-recommendations. Breakfast buffet very good, though some more variation from day to day would have been good. Need to make sure that something is done to lights in breakfast restaurant. I want to wake up and see some light not fall asleep in a very dark room at this time of day.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great”
Reviews.Author: SDParis
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for a long weekend. In the past we have usually taken the cheap pension option in the centre of town and I have to say having tried a five star option, I would sincerely recommend the pension downtown. You are a bit detached from the buzz of the city in the harbor and you don't really get a feeling for a place as alive as Barcelona in a five star luxury hotel. The goods are, the place is nicely decorated, Bose sound systems etc. The staff at reception are very nice. The restaurants are a bit pricey but excellent. Just what you would expect form a top flight hotel. The bads, we had a couple of issues with them messing up our room service lunch and brining the wrong dishes. They eventually replaced the wrong dishes but it meant we had our starters after our desserts. At 120 Euro for lunch a good hotel would have taken the whole thing away and delivered us what we asked for. Finally, they did not replenish the coffee making facilities for the 3 days we stayed, had to keep phoning them for coffee. All in all nothing major wrong or right but I just didn't click with the hotel like you do with others.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, but a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: MalachiWilliams
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a three nigh stay at Arts. The room are excellent and I love the bathrooms. My only complaint in the room was the tea and coffee making service. There were no prices listed on the minibar list and I thought that it was complimentary (and I was not the only one to think this) - it's not! So be careful as they will charge you and it is not that great and not worth the charge. The pool area is amazing and they have new furniture for the summer. A great spot to hang on, but lots of 'suits' walking around and lots of messing about with moving pool furniture around. The hotel is now managed by Ritz Carlton and I think the big boys in suits spend far to much time strutting around and getting in the way of the staff. The result - poor service levels as the team seems more worried about pleasing the managers and this means they spend less time on looking after those of us that pay. Lunch by the pool was awful. My starter and main arrived at the same time. My guest did not get her starter and then it arrived with her main! They only had one bottle of olive oil and balsalmic so they kept moving it from table to table - very poor for a five star hotel. Even in the restaurant the service was slow - 30 minutes for a starter. The spa is great. It was wonderful views and is worth a visit, BUT too many female staff keep coming in to the male area and this is very off putting for most male guests. Front Desk staff are very nice, but when I asked to leave my bags to have them put in the car (which, by the way, I ordered the Merc to collect me from the airport and take me back, so I was certainly spending the money!), they said I had to take it downstairs myself to the Bell team. I thought this was five star Ritz Carlton - I guess it is going down the four star route. I would return, but they need to improve their service for the prices they hope to command and if they want to have the Ritz Carlton service. Overall I am disappointed as there is nothing like Arts in Barcelona and they could do so much better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: topsmed
Reviews.Content: The location is not the best (Olympic port, pretty far away from most of the sights) and it is hard to love the building. Otherwise, this is a very well run luxury hotel. I had a suite, and it was one of the best rooms I have had in a city hotel. Restaurants, shopping facilities, fitness, pool and spa are all first rate.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous for chilling out. ....rejuvenating....”
Reviews.Author: mollychop
Reviews.Content: The reviews on the site give a good balanced viewpoint. It is fabulous for a relaxing stay. I only stayed 2 nights & was tagging along with my husband who was at a conference. Room was wonderful. Very comfortable & great bathroom. I also thought there was a background 'drain' smell but it was very vague and as the drains in Barcelona as a whole smell I'm not surprised the hotel drains do! Free water and apples round the pool, loads of towels, lots of flowers & lots of nice touches. Service is exemplary. Have stayed in a lot of hotels and this is def top for attentive service. I think the reviewer who thought they were rude misunderstood the staff. They drove me nuts at breakfast asking me if i wanted more orange juice & coffee though. If you are travelling with kids I would ask them to remove the mini bar items or move them yourself. There are sweets and choc & my 4 year old ran up huge bill!!! This is a real 'chill' hotel- loads of places to go and chill out- big double sun beds, slung double hammocks, outside sofas, big cushions. I dozed in the March sunshine with a glass of wine & it was heaven. Wander in the herb garden too -it's on a roof and it's immaculate. Lots of clever design ideas to inspire you to take home too. A rejuvenating experience.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive - but worth it!”
Reviews.Author: PLI143
Reviews.Content: Hotel Arts is an "eyesore" from the outside - but beautiful inside. Very modern decor, fabulous rooms with great views of city & ocean. Pool good with excellent staff to help you with towels etc - they keep an eye on sunbeds which have not been used for a while and basically move the belongings so you can have the sunbed when the pool area is busy. Why is it people think by putting a book on a sunbed it belongs to them!!! Hotel Arts is right at the beach with some great restaurants. I stayed at The MAjestic Hotel for 3 nights first to visit the city then down to the Arts for the beach part of my holiday. Plan to revisit in April 07.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: iriredodge
Reviews.Content: The hotel at the time and may still be, the tallest building in Spain, well the neighboring "Mapfri" building is the same height. The location is unbeatable. On the waterfront, a five-star world-class hotel, with almost everything to be expected of it. The room was fantastic. The automatic blackout shades were a great amenity, to block the breathtaking view of the water, city, and the shimmering "Frank Geary" 'fish' sculpture below... while recovering from jet-lag. The bathroom was in a class of its own. It was nicer than many hotels / resorts "community spa areas" Dining, beaches, discotheques, all 15 floors down, and 50 yards from the front door. The concierges were extremely helpful, with any request. One of the best perks. My only gripe was the security / front desk people were rude (condescending) and disrespectful: We were constantly being challenged, as to what we were doing, what were our names, room number etc... I can understand this once or twice. We stood out, American, meager Spanish speaking "weak mexican-spanglish at best", and dressed to casual country-club attire standards excluding my flip-flops (unless heading out on the town.) The point is "We stood out" so I expected them to learn my name, or recognize there is the American with the $12 flip-flops that has been here all week. At ~$1000/night I expect that courtesy from staff. Which they failed to do, or intentionally did not do (aside from the Concierges and Bar / Restaurant staff who were great) It finally became semi-entertaining. Lobby staff, "Um, excuse me, may I help you?" Me, (continuing to walk towards the elevator) "Sure, send up three ice cold aqua's con gas, no wait two con-gas, one no gas, gracias!, it's room 1520" Overall a great hotel, I loved it, the slight disrespect aside, I still highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great interior”
Reviews.Author: Christina_Jorgensen
Reviews.Content: The interior of the hotel is great - as mentioned by several other members. However, the minibar prices were crazy. After having had a little espresso from the in-room machine, I was visited by a maid (entering without knocking....), who kindly advised me that it cost €4 a cup and that I would be better off taking my coffee elsewhere. Nice thought! - And €7 for a soft drink. But the interior was the styliest I have ever experienced and the food good. Stayed there for a conference, but would never have paid for it out of my own pocket. Compared to some downtown hotels it is a little off track, and I would instead recommend staying closer to e.g. the Gothic quarter (see my recommendation for Hotel Colon). The bed, though, great! Even though - while searching for a lighter I dropped - they apparently never clean under the bed.....

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Loved the Arts”
Reviews.Author: alp3073
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 rooms with AMEX Platinum travel, and both rooms were upgraded upon arrival. Check in was a little slow, but wow... Our suites were fantastic. Huge, with fantastic views of the city and the Med. 1 1/2 bathrooms, large living area and a separate bedroom area. Just beautiful. Best showers ever! There were many restaurants and beaches within walking distance, so we only ate breakfast at the hotel. (That was $160 Euros for 6 people - buffet) Great service at the pools, bell staff, cleaning staff and front desk. Restaurant on site for breakfast buffet was adequete, but nothing special. Overall, a new favorite hotel for me!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Stylish luxury by the sea”
Reviews.Author: Scaggers
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to stay at the Arts as part of a corporate weekend conference. From the outside the hotel is not particularly attractive, looking more like a high rise office block. However, once inside the stylish modern decor and rooms more than make up for it - I've never seen so many fresh flowers all in one place!. My room on the 10th floor was genuinely breathtaking. It was extremely spacious and the views were fantastic. The bathroom is out of this world with a separate shower room (complete with seat and multiple jets) which is like a mini wet room and mood lighting. The room is full of gadgets - automatic blinds, Bang & Oulsen TV and CD - it look a while to figure it all out. I didn't get to use many of the hotel facilities (gym, pool) as most of the weekend was planned by the conference organisers but the breakfast was great with plenty of choice. The hotel bar did seem a bit expensive but then we were drinking cocktails (and I guess the owners think if you can afford to stay here, then you can afford the bar bill)! My only niggle was that I had to ask 3 times before the batteries in my TV remote were changed but other the this the staff were very friendly and attentive. The hotel is well placed for sightseeing and nightlife (I think it is on the route of the hop on/hop off bus) and is right on the beach. Overall, it is probably the best hotel I have ever stayed in but if the price tag makes you feel faint, Hotel 1898 on Las Ramblas is very good at probably half the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel but with a price tag to match”
Reviews.Author: Havanafan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September 2006 as part of a corporate trip. The hotel was fabulous, but I was glad we were not paying for it ourselves. Everything was a crazy price, but was very nice. We didn't eat in the hotel except for breakfast as there were different events planned each night, but we did head to the hotel bar one night for a round of drinks and they were extremely expensive. The rooms were lovely, really modern and the staff were very nice. I would recommend it to someone if they had plenty of money to spend, but it is a bit expensive in comparison to other hotels. A nice treat for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel except for the whiff from the drains”
Reviews.Author: Gaelic_traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night. On entering the hotel I was very impressed by the initial visual of superiority. The room was very comfortable and high tech. The facilities eg TV, CD player etc are very modern. It took a while to figure out what all the buttons were for! The bed was incredibly comfortable. The bathroom had a big bath and great shower with power jets. One of the buttons was for 'romantic' light in bathroom. The only problem I had was the awful smell from the drains. Maybe it was a once off as this hasn't been mentioned in any other review but I thought it was bad. It was further compounded when I used the loos downstairs near the conference rooms and it was so bad I was dry wretching and had to get out of there. I was so surprised and disappointed by this. Maybe because it was close to the water, I don't know but it would put me off staying there again in case the problem was on-going. Beware of ordering breakfast in the room too. I had asked for it to be delivered between 7 and 7.30am. They arrved at 6.55am when I was taking a shower. I guessed I had missed it and so called again. When I was checking out they had charged an additional €5 for non - delivery first time !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: wjs1968
Reviews.Content: The hotel is set in a wonderful location with fantastic views of both the city and the sea. The rooms were large and the bathroom wonderful - all well appointed and very clean as you would expect. We stayed in a club level room and the service in the lounge was second to none - a wonderful selection of food presentations which changed 5 times a day, Free DVD lending selection and very attentive staff. It was my Husbands 40th birthday during our stay and they really made the occassion extra special. We could not fault the hotel in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Great Concierge Recommendations”
Reviews.Author: Kirklander-joe
Reviews.Content: The Arts is a magnificent Ritz Carlton hotel but what makes it special is the outstanding service and professional staff. I just came back from a three night stay with my wife and it was heaven. From check in to the moment we left the hotel did experience no problem at all. The concierge staff were very helpful and friendly. Let them advise you where to go for dinner. We were booked at Xalet de Montjuic, which is a beautiful trendy restaurant with breathtakings views of the city. If you like seafood there is no better place than Botafumiero, a real must. Our last night in Barcelona we wanted to stay around the hotel and went to Cangrejo loco, in the marina, just five minute walk from the hotel. We had great paela and sangria. On the other hand I must say that this hotel is not cheap at all and you need to be very patient every time you want take the elevators. All in all a fantastic stay at the Arts on our getaway trip.

Reviews.Title: “What a sad excuse for a hotel...”
Reviews.Author: London,SW1
Reviews.Content: This place is well past it. It may have cut it a few years back when Barcelona was one of the poorer European cities, but these days it has been left behind by a crop of much better and trendier places, actually located in town ! A lump of concrete with some expensive shops does not equal a good hotel. Maybe in Baghdad I would accept this fake and soulless place and be happy that I was safe from bombs, but in central Barcelona (please note this hotel is nowhere near central), I have a choice of at least five better places. The hotel really needs to pick its act up as younger rich people are looking for more than over priced drinks, non-speaking Catalan staff and signage (Barcelona is the capital of Catalunya), and general drabness of this god awful place. The last time I went there I hoped I would never be unfortunate enough to return. I will remember this more clearly next time. Lastly, working girls may keep the (current roster of) business types happy, but the market has moved on, and it would be highly suggested to get out and look at some leading places such as : Malmaison, Hotel du Vin and Sofitel, which yes do charge your sort of high prices, but do deliver an exceptional service, not some drab pastiche of international travel that is no longer acceptable in 2006. I can only conclude that anyone who actually 'likes' this place has very little idea of what a leading venue should have to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: arnop
Reviews.Content: For a first stay @ Barcelona, we choose Hotel Arts from a friend who went there a couple of times and was an amazing stay ! The hotel is superb and the rooms are amazing. Everything from check-in to breakfast to location was perfect. The room are very big with a 32" flat TV and a B&O stereo. The views are on the sea or on the city and with a highfloor room, you can be sure to have an amazing view. Some people might say that the hotel is far away from the heart of Barcelona but you can go there on foot in less than 20mn. The swimming pool is a bit small but the gardens and the restaurants are excellents. I'll go back to Hotel ARts next time I'm in Barcelona for sure!

Reviews.Title: “A very over-rated hotel”
Reviews.Author: LPSP
Reviews.Content: The rooms and location of this hotel are excellent but our 3 night stay was spoilt by bad service: i) upon arrival our luggage was delivered to the wrong room and we did not receive it until 4 hours later; ii) sloppy room service - twice our room was not made up and towels not replenished, prompting more calls to manager in reception; iii) try leaving the hotel at peak time (8-9am and 6-7pm) and expect a 20 min wait on your floor for the lifts to arrive. Note we found you can take the fire exit stairs to the second floor and walk through a restaurant to get out but its a hassle, not least if you're on the 32nd floor!; iv) you actually need to take 2 separate lifts to leave the building and after 11pm you need to enter your key into a slot in the lift to make it work - nice security idea but would have been nice if staff`told us about it rather than finding out by chance! v) room minibar overpriced - e.g. 7 euros for a bottle of coke; they even charge for the tea & coffee vi) breakfast very average - hot courses consisted of scrambled egg, bacon, greasy potato and er, poached salmon?!? However there was some lovely fresh fruit it has to be said. The cold porridge was also just about bearable. Very over-rated this place, be aware!

Reviews.Title: “WOW what a hotel”
Reviews.Author: kulov
Reviews.Content: What a hotel, built for olympics way back in the early 1990s. Very state of art, with a truley amazing art collection. The pool area is fantastic but very busy, so get there early. They have a michelin star rest which was fully booked during our stay, but the food looekd fantastic. The hotel is a bit on the outskirts of the city but has great views. Expensive but nice, hugh range of malts and cigars in main bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach location”
Reviews.Author: maldivian
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel with a very interesting design features. The rooms are wonderful, bathrooms second no none, and the best hotel views in Barcelona. The service was mixed, although in the main fine. The SPA has outstanding views, and the location on the highest levels of the hotel make for a very interesting experience, although I did find the service manner quite abrupt. The breakfast was very poor, food that should have been hot was cold and in very limited supply. Pastries, fruit etc were of fine quality and If your tipple is Moet at breakfast you'll be fine. I liked the fact that the hotel was away from the hussle of the heart of the city, with taxi fares very cheap, and roads relatively clear, you can get to any central location with 5minutes for around 7/8 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: KSlondon
Reviews.Content: I agree with the accuracy of the previous reviews.An excellent hotel,good not to be in the centre of a very noisy city and it only took us 15-20 mins to stroll in to the centre of Barcelona . On the positive side (with the exception of bag service see below ) the staff were excellent .The bathrooms were superb On the negative side the mini bar prices are astounding-but aren't they always and it is a good party game with your wife "how much do you think they want for a bottle of water ? " The bag delivery service to the room was appalling-45 mins still no bags and we were late for a meeting in the hotel I had to change for .It took 2 phone calls and a trip to reception to extract our bags If you have a spare 30 minutes learn how to use the light switches and don't do what we did and by mistake press the privacy switch which meant no room change the next day !

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jardi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Arts prior to a cruise out of Barcelona. The two nights spent were wonderful. We had club level so that made it even more special. The hotel itself is beautiful and the staff is very warm and helpful....Perfect location to view the sea and the port and also a quick metro ride into the main portion of the city. Barcelona is a very unique city with great food and friendly people. Loved the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: “Big, Sort of Coporate in Scale, but Great”
Reviews.Author: NYCWGV
Reviews.Content: If you want a big cushy hotel on the beach, this is it. My partner and I opted out of staying at a boutique hotel in the heart of the city and we were so glad. This hotel was the most comfortable we ever stayed at with a fantastic room, great views, fast service, and a superb pool. From the door staff to the check in counter to the bartender , everyone was pleasant. The rooms are large and ours looked directly at the Sagrada Familia -- not bad! The location is great if one wants a beach/urban experience. Sitting by the pool feels like you're on the beach but look around and you can see that you're in a city with great architecture. If you are concerned about the location, there are always cabs that pull up to the front door that cost about $7 US dollars to get to the heart of Barcelona. It's well worth it given the quality of the hotel. But be aware, it's not small and due to its large towering size, can feel kind of corporate.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room. appalling breakfast”
Reviews.Author: nicgooner
Reviews.Content: We had the corner suite. It was fantastic. Great views, great comfort. The Ritz Carlton showers are the best in the world. However the breakfast, which is not included in the price, was an absolute joke. £110 for 4 people!! The choice was appalling every morning. Cold, over salted scrambled egg, cold bacon. Other than that it was just cakes or a few bits of fruit. Never have I felt so ripped off in all my life. AVOID THE BREAKFAST! Other than this it was an enjoyable experience, though not as great as people make out in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: macks_1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend at the end of August '06. Barcelona was really busy and lively. We had a really great time. Staff were brilliant, food fab, and location was superb. We stayed in the 'club' level where the views are great and the service brilliant. As it was so busy the pool area was a bit hectic, however the pool man soon sorted out a bed for us. On the Sunday the concierge got two brompton folding bicycles for us & we had a really fun day, covering the town with ease. The only small negative was the 'grumpy' attitude of the lady attendant at the 'spa'. She didn't seem at all interested whether we used the spa or not...so we didn't! However, we would not hesitate to go back to hotel Arts; a really class hotel in a brilliant location.

Reviews.Title: “Reward Yourself”
Reviews.Author: sandcstl
Reviews.Content: Loved it. What a great vacation! The pool was the place to be for me, but only because it was a great compliment to the city, the museums, the sites, the food, the sangria. I booked this hotel using membership reward miles, so with the room gratis, I did not even notice the 5 euros they were charging for the cortados. I found the service overall exceptional, with special kudos for the pool lady who deftly managed a wait list and got me a comfortable lounger in no time. The only thing mediocre I would say is the spa. Very expensive and only marginal in quality, but great views. As for the hotel basics -- Huge room, huge bathroom, great home base for lots of sightseeing. Can't wait to go back. I hope AmEx runs the same promotion next year.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room, Bad service”
Reviews.Author: HoustonLawyer
Reviews.Content: The room is AMAZING. The view of the harbor, the ipod connected stereo system, the amazing shower, the comfy bed, the flatscreen tv, the electric window shades, etc, all means one word: SUPERCOOL. Even the hotel location is okay, because the tourist bus (the BEST way to get around the city) has a stop just outside the hotel. However, beware the service. The concierge is soooooooo busy, especially at weekends that we found it quicker to call restaurants ourselves (we even got better tables by calling ourselves). One time, the concierge did not even call us back. And when we asked for a US adapter for our laptop, it took 45 minutes and three calls to get it. Not what you would expect for a place like this. If they could improve the service, this would be a top hotel even on a world-level standard. With the service as it is, it's worth the money, but only just.

Reviews.Title: “very good overall”
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel, but for the rates it charges it should be. We booked rooms on the Club floor, which although you pay more, do negate some of the issues about everything being very expensive once you get there. If you use the facilities, I think it represents good value. The rooms are very good and the service generally is excellent. We experienced no problems at all waiting for lifts, which seems to have been an issue in previous reviews.
