We liked the location, the mixture of beach, marina and city worked well - it's about 25 mins walk or a 5 Euro taxi ride to get into the heart of the city. If you want a purely city experience it's probably better to stay somewhere more central. Having used Ritz Carlton before this one doesn't quite live up to their usual exceptional standards of service, but it is undoubtedly a very good hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Pete82
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Room was lovely, large and comfortable with a big bed and black out blinds. Bathroom really nice, very large separate shower and extremely luxurious design. Nice lobby, only annoying thing is you have to get the lift up one floor to the lobby and change lifts to go up to your room. Location was ok, not the best but still on the route for the tour bus so not too bad. Pool brilliant, lovely double sunbeds and they give you free water and snacks which is a really nice touch. I would definitely come back and stay in this hotel if i could afford it!!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't live up to expectation”
Reviews.Author: Tripper_From_UK
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Arts has a big reputation but failed to live up to it. The room was pleasant but unexceptional but the ludicrously long wait for the lift was very irritating. Nothing seems to be included in the price, car parking,internet,drinking water and newspaper were all extra. A big attraction of the Hotel Arts is its beachfront location but its swimming pool is hopelessly inadequate and the lack of sunloungers very annoying. We couldn't help drawing comparisons with the Rey Juan Carlos 1 where we have stayed on previous trips, the rooms at the Hotel Arts have the edge but beyond that the facilities at the Rey Juan Carlos are better. The Hotel Arts has the better location, but the huge price difference ( 3 times ) would pay for a lot of taxis

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable, Nice location for Summer Months”
Reviews.Author: anonymousreviewer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Arts Barcelona in June for 4 nights with our two teenage daughters. We were extremely comfortable and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Our rooms were very nicely appointed and on the large side. We had connecting rooms with a terrific sea view. We found the room cleaning staff to be exceptionally good. While the hotel pool is small, we never waited long for a lounge, and the pool side staff were terrific. We also enjoyed the miles of beach, for walking, lounging (local vendors rent chairs and umbrellas for the day) and terrific beach side restaurants. The food at the hotel was first rate, and not horribly priced, at least not in comparison to other 5-star hotels in Spain. We were pleased to find that the hotel offered an a la carte breakfast in addition to the buffet. Some days we just don't want to eat EURO 27 worth of food for breakfast. We also pleased that the hotel clientele came from differing nationalities. We had arrived at the hotel from a stay in Mallorca, where our hotel was occupied almost entirely by Brits. We found the greater range of nationalities of guests at Hotel Arts to make it more a more vibrant and happening environment. The hotel staff were very professional. Restaurant recommendations were generally very good. Service in restaurants was also good. On our first night at the hotel the noise from an outdoor wedding was loud until 3 am making it difficult to sleep. After a few phone calls to the night manager, who handled the calls very well, the hotel provided my husband and I with an additional room on the other side of the hotel less affected by the noise for the evening, and they removed the room charge for the night because of the inconvenience. Our original room was very quite for the rest of our stay. We used the gym facilities daily and found the gym to be well equipped. Our teenage daughters also greatly enjpyed our stay at the hotel. We would definitley return to Barcelona and to the Hotel Arts.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Service Problems”
Reviews.Author: YVR2007
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Arts for 4 nights. I got locked in my room for 20 minutes and the elevators were broken due to a flood (walked up 19 flights), which meant they had to relocate a bunch of guests. If your staying call ahead to see if the hotel is fully booked, cause if it is your going to have to fight for a lounge chair by the pool. The room was nice and it's what you would expect of a 5 star hotel. The cons - overpriced drinks and everything in your room comes with a hefty price tag (nothing is complimentary). Good location and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Just awesome!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hello all! My wife and I booked a cruise that departed from Barcelona this past May 2006 and we stood the night before and night after the cruise in the Arts hotel. All I have to say about the hotel is that it is awesome! The lobby is not huge like some other Ritz Hotels but it was very contemporary. It takes about 25-30 minutes from the airport to the hotel, and if you are booking a cruise the hotel is not even 10 minutes away from the port. The customer service was great, and the standard room was no ordinary standard. It was huge with an incrediable view of all 3, the city, port and beach!!! The bed was super comfortable and the bathroom was huge! We loved the 26" flat panel TV and top of the line sound system. Little things like controlling the window shades with a button from the bed made it that much better. We got to see some celebs. The first night we saw Tara Reid, and the last night we saw Morgan Freeman and Terry Hatcher, so that top it off for us! If you are visiting Barcelona I recommend you stay here!!! Happy traveling. -L&C

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel....”
Reviews.Author: Ringo3
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Arts was terrific. However we have stayed in many 5 star hotels and the service in this hotel does not warrent 5 stars. When we went to the pool, we had to wait for a lounge to become available. We asked the reception to send an item to our room - when we got to our room (1 hour later) it had not arrived. I think the hotel is beautiful. The restaurant is incredible. Dont expect 5 star service and you wont be dissappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!”
Reviews.Author: kyrikos
Reviews.Content: What can I say about the Hotel Arts Barcelona. We stayed at the Hotel Arts at the end of May 2006 for just one day and I m still abolutely amazed. The building is a very interesting design. It is a very high tower. We arrived at the lobby to see the lovely fountains-rain outside of the hotel. Check in was not that organised (we had to queue), however I ve never seen anything more personal than their service. Took the lift and went into our room. Deluce room with a view of the sea-city. Fantastic. Room was incredible. We had an Bang and Olufsen tv with a Bang Olufsen CD player. Lovely Crups espresso machine. Huge bed, comfy with a matress topper and very small details, like privacy button (instead of Do not disturb signs) that really made the difference. What can I say about the bathroom. Two fantatic basins. Seperate loo-room. Seperate bath. And the most incredible. hower room with seats. Gorgeous. After that we spent the day overlooking the fantastic fish from the hotel's garden-swimming pool. Only problem there-it was very busy and we had to lay on the lawn and be on a waiting list for a sun lounge. Gorgeous though. Last thing we didnt like. There are spa facilities on the higher floors. However they are operated as we were told by a different company, thu we d have to pay 40 euro per person per day to use the facilities there i.e. the glass sauna that overlooks the sea. and rest of em. We really treated ourselve staying there and we d definitely come back. And another thing. Location is good but not excellent. U willneed a good 40 minutes to walk to the centre. It is extremely expensive but it s worth every littlepenny.

Reviews.Title: “Nice But Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Fayssal
Reviews.Content: Amazing Hotel. Especially if you book one of the corner view (sea/city) rooms. Room service is extremely expensive. I paid 120 euros for a breakfast for 2. A coke will cost you something like 10 euros. But the rooms are really perfect and you get sleek design tv and hifi (bang and olufsen). Gorgeous bathrooms with music inside. And very quiet rooms. Breakfast is open until noon, so you'd better wake up on time, it's very consitent with champagne available. It's seems to be the perfect place for a stay in summer with the beach just in front of the hotel. The picture would be just perfect if room service was not that expensive. You can get around , it's not far away from diverse city attractions (5 or 10 euros to get around on a cab). I think that this hotel is a good value for the money. Again, Be careful with the expensive room service.

Reviews.Title: “Elevator nightmare”
Reviews.Author: NYCTravels032570
Reviews.Content: It is a wonderful hotel, with wonderful service, all the amenities, etc. However, the elevators are so slow, that I think 20% of my time in the hotel was spent waiting for them, trying to get my room key to work to make it go to the club floor, etc. It was ridiculous -- and everyone in the hotel was complaining about it. Make no mistake, this hotel is of the highest class, especially the club lounge, which is terrific, but I began to dread leaving my room for the elevators, because they were that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: PICKYTRAVELER27
Reviews.Content: I normally wouldn't stay in a hotel this big but it was wonderful! We had been booked at the horrible Palace Hotel and luckily were able to switch over here...it was perfection. Fabulous service everywhere, everyone was so helpful. I wish it would've been warm enough to lay out at the pool! They recommended great restaurants--Enoteca in the hotel was awesome! Typical Ritz room, passed out every night in the comfy beds...loved the blackout curtains! Fabulous views, great location. Just do it!!!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller8686868
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed at the Ritz-carlton hotel Arts for 3 nights and it was exellent. We stayed in a superior room ( the cheapest in the hotel) and it was great the room were big and fresh. Two big beds and a beautiful panoramic view over the porto olympico. The bathroom was a big and great as a normal suite in any other europe top class hotel. Ritz-carlton shows again that they are the best chain in the world. The lobby was great big and modern designed. The food was expensive but worth the money. The pool area was great offering free water and fruit made it very good. We have stayed at many of the "good" hotels in europe but i find this the best. overall this is a truly luxurious experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best service ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Ritz Carlton Barcelona. The hotel is just magnificent and the service is impeccable. Since the moment we checked in we were treated as if we were celebrities! Doorman Jose Ramon welcomed us with a smile and kindly showed us the way to the lobby on the first floor. We were given an amazing corner room by Renata from front desk who also took her time to escort us to our suite on the 19th floor. Bellman Oriol brought the luggage to our room and told us everything we needed to know about the hotel facilities. Marta and Carlos from concierge were also very helpful and made reservations for botafumero(fantastic shellfish at a price)tenorio(trendy restaurant near ramblas) cangrejo loco(very casual but great paela). The tea saloon is beautiful and waitress Latiffa so friendly and attentive. The spa on the 43rd floor is out of this world and the views are just breathtaking. I have been to many luxury hotels and after my stay at this Ritz Carlton I can assure this is the best service I have ever experienced in my whole life. Congratulations to the hotel Arts for having such fine staff!

Reviews.Title: “Amazine”
Reviews.Author: bridalwedge
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in the Penthouse Suite over looking the ocean. The room was split level, with two double rooms and two seperate bathrooms. The downstairs had a kitchen and living room, which dvd and cd players. You got free nibles in the afternoon, in the club room upstairs and the breakfast was great. One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in, worth every penny. The hotel is in a great locations, and the nitelife in Barcelona is great. The pool area in the hotel is very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: bungo
Reviews.Content: On previous stays in Barcelona we've booked into Le Meridien on the Ramblas but this time thought I'd try the Hotel Arts - and am so pleased we did. The hotel just exudes comfort, cleanliness and style; even the lobby smells delicious!! Being by the sea - and with a gorgeous pool with double sunbeds and where you get attentive service (complimentary water, fruit, suncream etc)- it feels much more like a 'proper' holiday than being jammed into the city centre. The hotel is a good 40-minute walk from the Ramblas (don't let anyone tell you any different!)but the open-top tourist bus stops right outside the hotel which is pretty convenient for sightseeing. We paid for a deluxe sea-view room which was exactly what it claimed to be - beds were the comfiest I've known in a hotel too. Staff were considerably friendlier than in many luxury hotels and went out of their way to be helpful (not the supercilious look-down-their-nose at you types you often get in top hotels). Do try the Arola restaurant - we nearly didn't, thinking two Michelin stars would automatically mean second-mortgage prices, but it was quite the opposite. The starters are tapas-style (ie you choose a couple each and share) and were just gorgeous. Kids love nibbly things like that and, to their credit, even though Arola clearly likes to come across as funky (it has it's own DJ!) there were lots of families in there. Our 12-year-old thought it all very 'cool' and loved the food (result!) Only real drawback to the Hotel Arts are the breakfasts - the most eye-wateringly expensive I've seen yet. Ours wasn't included in the room rate we'd booked and there wasn't anywhere nearby that did anything more breakfasty than just coffee and a croissant. Also, we'd thought the seafood restaurants around Port Olimpic, just steps from the hotel, would be fantastic, but there are so many chasing the business we were 'hustled' as we walked along checking them out and ended up feeling quite uncomfortable (and the one we chose was rubbish!!) The following day we had lunch in a big seafood restaurant that virtually backs onto the hotel pool (can't remember the name, it was two words both beginning with M!), and had a fantastic lunch outside on their terrace, so would just go straight back there another time. I can't recommend the Hotel Arts highly enough. It really turned a city break weekend into something that felt like a laze-by-the-pool holiday too - the best of both worlds.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best”
Reviews.Author: jpz52
Reviews.Content: After checking in to a different "5 star" hotel,and being quite disappointed, we checked out and made our way to The Arts. The designation of 4/5 star hotels in Barcelona can be deceiving but The Arts is 6 stars. The personal attention, especially if your room includes the Club floor, is outstanding. The staff will do everything to please you. The rooms are spacious, beds and linens divine, and the views gorgeous. Bathrooms are beautiful and well appointed with fabulous rain showerheads as well as side jets. Whenever I called reception I was greeted by name and spoken to in English so I wonder if they make notes in their computer when you check in. This is a beautiful, service oriented hotel located just outside the hubub of the city but an easy taxi or tour bus ride into town. Great restaurants, the beach and a nice seaside promenade complete the picture. The Arts was the absolute best hotel I've ever stayed in and I am very picky!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely magical!!”
Reviews.Author: dreamholiday
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a we while ago but it was probably the best hotel i have ever stayed in! We were a party of 4 couples and got upgraded to the Duplex Apartments which were truly amazing! These are the ones that Elton and Robbie have stayed in and no wonder!! Anyway we could not fault this place everything was wonderful! Would really recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and good location”
Reviews.Author: Maramu
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel from 3/10/06 through 3/17/06. The staff at the reception was very good and courteous. The corner executive suite on floor 21 had a great view of the beach and a partial view of the city. Nice living room and guest bathroom (our kids loved it there), great bathroom and three-head shower, and comfortable beds. Bose system a nice touch to play your own CD's and DVD's. We had breakfast included in our package so every morning we had a very good buffet, sometimes sitting outside. Didn't eat in the hotel restaurants because there are tons of places to eat nearby (highly recommend La Barca de Salamanca - great fresh fish). You can walk to Las Ramblas (15 minute walk), take a taxi (about 5 euros), or take the subway (1 euro). Talking to the locals, this is considered the best hotel in Barcelona and I can see why. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: klbklb
Reviews.Content: Moved to this hotel after a horrible night at a hotel on Las Ramblas. The hotel was the perfect hotel. The service was impeccable. The rooms were huge. Had Queen beds in Europe - that was a treat at the end of our 2 week vacation. The location was great because it was a stop on the doubledecker tourist buses or a cheap cab ride away. The brunch is expensive but amazing - a piano player and champagne is a great way to start the day. I have stayed at many Ritz Carltons - this is by far my favorite. The view was fabulous and the special touches made this a great visit and will tell anyone I know to only stay here!

Reviews.Title: “polished”
Reviews.Author: misdirected_baggage
Reviews.Content: Absolutely perfect service. The staff at the front desk remembered my name from day one. Everyone was incredibly gracious to a fault. I upgraded to a corner, ocean view room (75 euro more) and it was worth every penny. I have stayed in luxury hotels around the world and this is one of my favorites. My traveling companion reserved a room on the "private" floors (special key entry) and the lounge for those floors serves an amazing tapas and wine buffet nightly. The hotel's restaurant is small, but the food is excellent with very attentive service. The breakfast buffet is also excellent. The only drawback to this hotel is that its location, though awsome for beach access, is inconvenient for walking tours and Barcelona taxis are (a) very expensive and (b) the drivers often tend to take one on the most roundabout route in order to run-up the meter. My only complaint is that the spa, although good, was not of the same calibre as the rest of the hotel. The venue was pretty, but it lacked towels, the hot tub was lukewarm, the sauna seemed to be cool and the treatments I had were OK, but not especially memorable. It's a beautiful spa situated at the top of the hotel and knowing the hotel arts, my experience was probably an off day.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Arts - worth it?”
Reviews.Author: Josug
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Arts in January to celebrate out 10th wedding anniversary. We were pleased from the moment it started - all the staff smile and remember your name, but it is definitely worth paying more to stay on the executive floor. The club lounge is great with complimentary food and drink all day. We ended up spending more time there than anywhere else. The location is quite far out - not in the hubub of La Rambla but we preferred that as felt a bit nervous walking around the Barri Gotic at night. Everywhere was no more than a 10 euro taxi ride away and we also did a lot of walking, which is perfect when in Barcelona. We toyed between the boutique hotel experience such as Hotel Neri and having gone to see it when we were there, I am pleased we chose the Hotel Arts as the area felt safer and quieter. Hotel Neri is right next to a nursery backing onto a courtyard and it seemed very hustly and bustly. No complaints about Hotel Arts - everything was done quickly and without fuss and the staff were exceptionally helpful to us. We ate at the hotel restaurants, Bites was great - good food and not too expensive, Arola seems too hyped - the portions were small tapas style, but the staff seem to think they are the most important ones rather than the clients. It wasn't bad, just not as fantastic as it thinks it is. All in all, we were pleased with the Hotel Arts and think it was worth the money as it is expensive. By the way, there is free bottled water in the gym and spa which you can take rather than pay for it from the mini bar!

Reviews.Title: “amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: delt
Reviews.Content: my brother and i stayed here in march '02. along with hotel caruso ravelo, it's the best placed i've stayed. our room had a view of the olympic village overlooking the sea. marble bath, 3 head'd separate marble shower, and spa like tub. full suite stereo system with bathroom and bed controls. auto blinds/shade controls from bed. the staff was great. even had them tailor a suit and they did a good job. the location is excellent as well. seconds from the beach!

Reviews.Title: “really fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: brandenburg5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early Feb 06 during a business trip with around 120 colleagues. We all loved it. The hotel is gorgeous, and the food (catered for our conference) was lovely. What really impressed me, though, was the friendliness of all the staff. Usually very stylish hotels like this have pretty snooty staff, but the people here were just great - so friendly and helpful. When I come back to Barcelona I will definitely try to stay here, even though it is not very central. It is near the beach, though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Arts”
Reviews.Author: dgeedin
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for work in Jan 05 The room are just amazing. I had twice a room with a view at the sea. However, a view sea/city or even at the marina is very good as well. Anyway if you happen to stay, try to have higher floor. The staff and service are also amazing. However, I was very disapointed with Enoteca restaurant. Service was poor and food not amazing for the 80 Euros we paid. Same for the "bites" restaurant, evenso the bill was cheaper. One of my colleague was upgraded to a suite (see picture). Recomanded if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel with a taste of luxury”
Reviews.Author: Rachelle2008
Reviews.Content: It was a great hotel with a great beachside location. I was slightly disappointed as it had the "Ritz Carlton" brand, and I had better experiences staying at the Four seasons. Overall it had spacious and soft beds. Nice touch on the bathroom with the multiple shower heads.

Reviews.Title: “quality, quality, quality”
Reviews.Author: divenuts
Reviews.Content: we loved this hotel. our suite was huge, great views on two sides, beautiful bathroom, lovely comfortable furnishings/bedding and great service. the restaurants are very good and the staff is really attentive. for a big city, luxury hotel, we thought the suite was a good value for money and worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury overlooking the Mediterranean”
Reviews.Author: sophisticatedme
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Hotel Arts. Hotel is beautiful, the rooms exquisite (top floors are newly refurbished) and the service the best we have ever experienced. Although a fairly large hotel, staff seem to anticipate your needs. I would recommend a junior suite, oceanview. Try for a newly refurbished room. You will be astounded by the views from the picture windows. Top of the line amenities and incredible comfort await you. Expensive but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel--but a couple things to bear in mind”
Reviews.Author: EMG_ACN
Reviews.Content: THis is a great hotel in terms of view, service, and room quality. We had a great stay there last week in a beautiful sea view suite. The breakfast is pretty good as well. There are two important things to know: A) it is not near the historic part of Barcelona, rather it is on the beach. So this means you have a 30 minute walk to the Gothic Quarter or a 5-10 Euro cab ride (or a two-three stop Metro trip); B) it is really a convention hotel--crawling with tacky conventioneers). OTherwise, it is really great and the service is especially strong for Spain. I am not sure there is better choice for a modern style 5 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, total luxury”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived in the hotel lobby, to second the door of our taxi was closed for us when leaving for the airport our stay in the Hotel Arts was a dream come true. My husband and I stayed there for our 30th wedding anniversary and really pushed the boat out. We had already had 2 nights at the Hotel Rey Juan Carlos I, which is on the north side of town and thought that was good, but wow....... now read on.... Stayed there in July 2004 - Room 1101 to be precise, seaview overlooking both the pool and the amazing "fish/whale" sculpture. Great panoramic windows the entire length of our suite with electronic blinds to keep the sun out as it moved around the room. B & O stereo, biggest bed we've ever had and a bathroom to die for, bath, huge his and hers double sink and walk in marble shower cubicle big enough for probably 4 people. We used the restaurants and bars and can report the food was excellent. The pool area has great ,double sunbeds with thick mattresses and great pool staff who bring round cold facecloths, fruit and water to help ease the strain of relaxing so much! Great location right on the beach and the coastal walkway route around to centre of Barcelona. I wouldn't recommend going the road way very busy. The marina opposite has a great selection of seafood restaurants to choose from as well. Getting into centre of Barcelona is no problem at all we walked everyday and got a taxi back in the evenings, not expensive. Overall the best place we've ever stayed and hopefully will go back to someday when we want to push the boat out again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money for the view alone”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a long weekend at the Hotel Arts Barcelona and it was absolutley amazing. We had an executive suite on the 33rd floor and the views of Barcelona and the marina to the other side were so breathtakingly wonderful, I could have sat and stared at them all weekend and have done nothing else! Yes, it is very expensive but this hotel is luxury personified. The staff are helpful and friendly without being snooty. If you can afford it, go for the Club Levels as the club lounge is a wonderfully relaxed place to hang out for breakfast or a drink before you head off for dinner. Our room had only been redecorated a month and was gorgeous, with luxurious lounge area and great sized bedroom. From both beds you get the amazing views so you can wake up, with a touch of a button have the shutters open and watch the city waking up. The bathroom is beautiful and the shower is like standing in Niagara Falls, to the extent I got a headache after a while! It is a bit of a walk to the Old Town, but still, you can amble through the park and then walk back along the sea (or get a taxi if you're feeling lazy) and therefore get to experience other parts of Barcelona that you may not have seen. All in all, I would not hesitate to recommend this to anyone (as long as you are not on a tight budget, or any sort of budget really!), particularly if you are going to Barcelona for a special treat as this hotel will do nothing but enhance it.

Reviews.Title: “Of course it's good, but it's not worth staying at”
Reviews.Author: MATT_LHR_JFK_SYD
Reviews.Content: Really good hotel, but that's to be expected at this price. The question is... is it worth it? And the answer is no. Why? Because... 1. Location. Barcelona is not the place to go for great beaches. So why stay at the beach? You go there for the food, the gothic quarter, the architecture, the bars, the culture, and the vibe. Staying out here alienates you from most of that (unless the pinnacle of your Barcelona visit is to be a night out at the Baja Beach Club in which case ignore everything I say). 2. The rooms. I think the rooms are in the process of renovation. And they really do need it. 2006 may well be a better year to visit than 2005, when the rooms may well have reached their post-opening (1992) nadir. 3. The pool. Tiny, over-busy, full of kids. Not enough sun loungers by a mile. 4. The cost. Not just of the rooms, but of the million and one overpriced extras that are the hallmark of luxury American chain hotels. As a result, the prevailing feeling all around is of money, not style or class. 5. The alternatives. Hotel Neri for example is fabulous and captures the essence of Barcelona perfectly. On the plus side, the hotel is still clearly very, very good. The views from the higher floors are pretty spectacular. Food at Arola is excellent. Agua restaurant on the beach is a great place for Sunday lunch. And Restaruant Barceloneta in nearby (and walkable) Barceloneta is probably the best seafood place in town. I wouldn't go back, but I'm still happy enough that I went, if you know what I mean.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but not fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Arts was certainly a 5*, but it pales in comparison to other 5*s. Most of the staff were helpful, but certainly did not go out of their way. There were a few employees that stuck out in my mind: a concierge who gave us a recommendationfor a great tapas cerveceria (Ciutat Contal), manager at checkout who saw my confused looked and check us out way ahead of others, and the hotel maid that remembered my first request and repeated it throughout our whole stay. The beds were soft, comfortable and queen sized. Overall it was a great place to stay, but I'm not sure if I'd pay 5* prices for it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: asdgjkdhjk
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from a very pleasant weekend at the Hotel Arts. Our Executive Suite is probably one of the best rooms I have stayed in. We were lucky to have been given one of the new rooms on the 24th Floor with fantastic views across Barcelona and the Olympic Port. Our room consisted of a sitting area with two small comfortable sofas a B&O flat screen TV, an espresso machine, and guest toilet. This led to a corridor with a couple of wardrobes, a desk facing the window and two frosted glass double doors which opened into a marble bathroom consisting of a vanity area with two designer wash basins, a large bath, a toilet/bidet room behind frosted glass doors and a large walk-in shower with a huge shower head and auxilliary side jet sprays which turn the shower room into a steam room (theres a marble bench in there as well). The corridor leads into a bedroom behind a large wooden sliding door with two large very luxurious and comfortable double beds with a number of different sized fluffy pillows and duvets - pure heaven. The bedroom had another TV in there along with a B&O DVD/CD entertainment system. The pool area was lovely but there can be a lot of competition for the deck chairs - there are however plenty of other comfortable grassy areas under palm trees to spead out your luxury beach towels as provided by the poolside along with complimentary bottled water.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and pampered stay at the Hotel Arts”
Reviews.Author: ClaireRobinson
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a five day break at the Hotel Arts. It was fabulous. The staff could not do enough for us, even down to providing an umbrella one wet evening, and everyone was so welcoming to our 10 year old daughter. We had a 9th floor room with a side view overlooking Port Olympic. Its a great location as the tourist bus stops outside the hotel, there are loads of good restaurants nearby and the beach is just in front of the hotel. Yes, the food is expensive but worth it, the casual dining by the pool is great! We loved the way the room was attended twice a day, in the morning to clean and tidy and again late afternoon to prepare the room for the evening, putting on the soft lighting and playing relaxing music on the CD. When we came to leave the staff were very accomodating about us keeping our room beyond the regulation 12 noon checkout, which meant we could enjoy our last day. I'll definitely be recommending Barcelona to friends and family and if they can afford it suggesting they stay at the Arts. We will certtainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected...”
Reviews.Author: torta_basilica
Reviews.Content: Luckily, our hopes were not up after reading all of the reviews, but it's not like there's one stellar hotel in Barcelona that stands heads & shoulders above the others... I didn't mind the location - could still walk or taxi everywhere. Our room on the 9th floor had a great view of the Olympic port & was quite nice. Everything worked & I felt lucky! Had a few issues with room service, but it was always friendly, if slow & expensive. Staff were great & very friendly. Bathroom was well-equipped - very nice marble shower - I didn't like the shower door-type closing on the toilet/bidet area, though - this could have been done better. Plenty of closet & storage space & the built-in desk/office area was very efficient & effective. Was nice not to have my husband's computer & work stuff spread all over the room for once! The pool area is beautiful & I had no problems booking at manicure at their associated Beauty Center. Only complaint would be that the gift shop is really weak on things you actually might need while travelling & the public carpets are badly in need of a thorough cleaning or replacement. Other than that, we had a great stay. BTW, when you totally burn out on tapas, there's a good little Italian restaurant in the Olympic port - al Passatore - very casual, but I had Linguine al Cartoccio - incredible seafood linguine delivered in a swan shaped foil packet. The caprese salad was weak, but this pasta was to die for!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful days with children at a GREAT hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Arts with our two small daughters (age 2 and 3) in july. Having read some of the negative reviews we were somewhat curious to what we could expect. Reality surprised us in a very positive way! The staff were professional, smiling and very helpful. They made us and our daughters feel really at "home". We had a corner room which was large and newly and stylishly renovated, with B&O TV's, DVD player and stereos - nice baths etc. The view from our room was awesome! To lie in bed, seeing the Familia Sagrada and the city at your feet is quite something! The restaurants, pool, gym facilites etc were all state of the art - and the staff the right mix of informal and professional. We have stayed at many hotels in Barcelona, and no matter where you stay it is impossible to be close to everything. In our opinion the location at the harbour/beach was brilliant, giving us a "beach resort feeling" in the middle of the city, and all the other sights are a short cab-ride away. If you're willing and able to pay for a 5 star hotel, we highly recommend a stay at the Arts.

Reviews.Title: “over expensive luxury”
Reviews.Author: businesseye
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Arts as a special treat prior to boarding a cruise in Barcelona. We'd stayed there some years ago and remembered it as being something special....someone else was paying then! Our interconnecting rooms (two sons in one, two parents in another) were very luxurious, well fitted and had tremendous views of the city and marina. But, overall, the Arts was an extremely expensive experiece for two nights, and the standards of rooms didn't constitute sufficient value for the high prices. Everything is costly - from room service breakfast to mini bar drinks (avoid, if possible) and wine in the rather pretentious restaurant. The reception staff could also be a little less 'superior' in the way they deal with guests. The views from this spectacular structure are quite something.....but the overall experience left us feeling just a little ripped off. Not quite what we need before boarding a cruise ship!

Reviews.Title: “Nice...but needs a little work”
Reviews.Author: stephentx
Reviews.Content: This is a great location and a really cool hotel. However, the rooms need a thorough review and some minor renovation. My room darkening shade (automatic) kept coming off track and I had to intervene manually to raise and lower the shade. The privacy shutters had completely ceased to work. Internet connection from the room was intermittent. However, the rooms come equipped with CD players, DVD players and TV. Plenty of space and storage. A complete control console beside the bed. My room was equipped with an impossible to use shower that would not function in the normally expected fashion (as in having the water go down as opposed to across the room). I suspected that I might have been put in a handicap room for whatever reason. Public areas are great, but layout is confusing. Be sure and partake of the beachside bars and restaurants and nearby Port Olympic and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel but could be better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel after a long trip in Italy and must say we were pleased with our room because it was concierge level (the rooms are not run down here like in the regular rooms); however, we were bringing our teens and when Amex centurium booked our reservation they asked for two nights, which for some reason the hotel did not have. I expected them to solve the problem or upgraded us to an apartment, but instead they gave us a really low fare for a double room (It was crowded with all four of us but again it was only one night). The design and environment seems very elegant and of high standart; however, service needs improvement and we were able to see this in only an overnight stay! Even the concierges at the concierge level were not efficient. I left some of your luggage in the lauch because our room wasn't ready when we arrived, and I had to ask for it several times for they forgot to bring it to me in the evening! They had all day. As for restaurants, not only were they way overpriced but service was extremely slowed and in one instance that we were getting our tea service, we even left without it because it never arrived. I suggest eat out, you can get much better food, service and deals. As for location been far, don't worry about it, taxis are not as expensive as other parts in Europe so it is affordable to move from one place to another, besides you are near the beach and this view is very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Outstanding! My husband and I arrived tired and without our luggage thanks to British Airways who still had it in London and didn't ship it to us for 5 days. We were on the Club floor. Rm. 3206 - Beautiful view of the yacht harbor. Room was very comfortable - very high tech and the king size bed extremely comfortable. The Club Lounge staff bent over backwards to help us. They made numerous phone calls during our entire stay trying to locate our luggage. The Club Lounge has an outstanding staff headed by Nicole. The food is excellent - 5 food offerings a day! Service is Tops! British Airways also would not ship our luggage through to the US on our trip home.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Arts”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great service at the Arts! Just came back from a 3 night stay at this beautiful hotel with amazing views. Maria at the concierge was very kind and doorman Carlos is such a character, so helpful and nice! They both went out of their way to make our stay just incredible! On the other hand I must say rooms are a bit old fasioned but so large. If you can afford it..... go to the Arts

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: stlm
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Arts on my Honeymoon from May 13th until May 15th, before my Mediterranean Cruise. Our rate was $335 EUR per night, buffett breakfast included and it was WORTH IT!! We got a room on the 23rd floor with views of the Mediterranean Sea and the city, since it was our first time in Barcelona, the Bellman suggested to take the Tourist Bus, which has a stop in the corner of the hotel (Great way to see the city), the bus stops at different monuments and landmarks of barcelona and you can hop on and off whenever you like. There are 3 bus lines, and the Arts stop is the connecting stop for the Blue and Green Lines. Anyway, when we arrived at the room, they had a bottle of Spanish Cava (Sparkling Wine), a plate with chocolate covered strawberries, a heart made of rose petals on the bed and candles all over the place, we didn´t ask for it (I asked my husband if he´d ordered it) and it was a nice detail from the hotel. The room is HUGE, the bed very comfortable, you can control all the lights and drapes from your night stand and huge closets. The bathroom was all marble separate shower and tub, two sinks, and all the amenities you need. Service was TOP NOTCH, the concierge very helpful, made reservation for Dinner at a nice restaurant in Barcelona, and the next day suggested a Tapas Bar. Actually we got robbed on our second day in Barcelona, and we had to report all my husband´s credit cards, and they were extremly helpful, even they helped me to file a police report, and gave me some water and chocolates to calm down. My overall experience is EXCELLENT hotel, yes the location isn´t the best but the Tousrit Bus and the cabs are just outside, I will definetly stay ther my next time in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A bit overrated”
Reviews.Author: flydutchven
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Arts for a three-day conference. Interesting design, good service, great food (priced accordingly).Room was a bit run-down though(some fixtures malfunctioning, curtain torn, and not really clean). All in all a good place to stay-but not as outstanding as prices suggest. Our favourites are still the Majestic ,and the Meridien on the Ramblas, with a SPECTACULAR corner room..! Both offer better overall value than the Arts, unless you attach a lot of value to being right by the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms - worth the extra money if you need a safe bet”
Reviews.Author: A-non-o-mouse
Reviews.Content: We had a few days after a business trip and spent a night at the supposed 4 star Ambassador just off the Ramblas - awful - was so in need of a decent night's sleep checked into the Arts. Did not regret the decision. A very very comfortable room and superb beds that were like sleeping on a cloud (without being too soft). No noise from other rooms (a little traffic noise that might be too much for very light sleepers on the lower floors - also sirens as there is a hospital next door - however this did not bother us). Great views, esp from our room which was on the 20th floor. Be careful of the extras - as these are expensive of course. Did not eat at the 2 michelin star restaurant (as it was closed) - found that the bar by the pool was the best bet for eating at the hotel - was not impressed with the Bites restaurant... which was also expensive of course.

Reviews.Title: “Posh but you pay the price”
Reviews.Author: Transatlanticgirl
Reviews.Content: Hotel Arts is a posh hotel with posh prices and if that is what you want then fine. Rooms are very spacious, clean and the service was excellent (except in the restaurant which is extremely expensive for what you get). I stayed on business and that's the only way I would stay here. It's fine for business meetings and the like but for tourists, it's a way from the town centre (10/15 mins in a cab). If you want better value and a central location then stay in town. I've stayed in the NH Duc de la Victoria - which is not in the same league as the Arts being a 3 star (but a very good 3 star at that - should be 4*) but it's less than half the price of the Hotel Arts and much more in the middle of things for those who want to be tourists and see this wonderful city. The open top tourist buses are great value and cover pretty much everything you'd want to see and you can get on and off during the 12 hours they run. They do stop near the Hotel Arts as alternative way of getting into town. A bargain at 17 Euros for one day and 21 Euros for 2 consecutive days!

Reviews.Title: “half a hotel, double a bill”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The communal areas are fantastic , well designed and funky. The pool area is great , and the general staff very friendly The rooms are awful ... they are large , but are now terribly dated and in need of serious refurbishment .. the bathrooms especially are horrible The cost of staying here !! the room rate is high, but my 5 day bill was average of 200eur a day in extras (room service breakfast, lunch by the pool -grilled lobster 150eur if you are crazy enough to order it, I wasnt- and a drink or two by the bar) stay somewhere else in barcelona ... and go to the Arts to visit the great bar and the fantastic Arola restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Waste of money”
Reviews.Author: thatguy111119
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed by the hotel arts this past week. We stayed 4 nights in their basic room. The hotel lobby, bar and grounds are VERY nice. They all meet the RC 5 star standards you would expect. The conceirge was very friendly and helpful, a must for a city like barcelona if you ask me. My chief complaints go towards the actual room, room service and value. Simply put, the rooms are dated. Old carpet, furniture, fixtures, etc. No movies on demand, no DVD player, only a VCR. Sure they let you borrow movies for free from the front desk, but the selection is limited, VHS quality (combined with the dated POS VCR) and we had to have our VCR replaced because our first one ate the tape. Sure the service was great in replacing the VCR late in the evening and not charging us for the lost movie - but imagine if that were my personal tape, something for work that was destroyed. Totally unacceptable. THe bathrooms were huge for european standards, but unintelligently designed. The sink faucet was underneath the mirror shelf. So for example, if you were to wash your toothbrush off under the water, it would disappear while actually under the water... adn this wasnt some nice euro modern design, it was a design flaw. The shower was huge, but no water pressure. There were misters, but only on one side.... just plain bad design. Room service. We had it once. We had a pizza margarhita and a bowl of their french onion soup. THe soup wasnt edible. Think beef broth with powdered parmesan cheese on top. THe pizza made us sick. (I know it was the pizza and not the soup because its the only thing we both ate) So we spent the evening hovering around our bathroom rather than out enjoying the city. Value - the place is just WAY overpriced. Now, i know, if you are considering a hotel like this you have money to spend. But noone likes to WASTE money. Its just plain silly expensive. Example, one cosmopolitan and one vodka tonic = 36 euros including tax. I have the bill to prove it. THe service was exceptional. Everyone was friendly and helpful. They were never snotty with us desipite the fact we were a couple of casually dressed 20 somethings.... The location could have been better... great view, but far walk from just about everything. The only reason i would ever stay at this hotel again would be for business...the staff is very helpful and it wouldnt be on my dime.
